description:
I randomly stumbled upon this place before going to dinner, and dang am I glad I did! I never would have expected that a low key, clean, inviting bar with actually good beer could exist in this area, but then again I basically never get out because I have a toddler :0 It was solidly a 30-40 somethings crowd which I appreciate...no more meat market + sloppy binge drinking + bad DJs for me. I WAS ABLE TO SIT AND HAVE A BEER AND TALK AND HANG OUT LIKE A REGULAR ADULT.

The bartender was a little kooky but it's a small price to pay. 

PS They only get beer from small(er) operations and I was told that it would be unlikely that I could find tap rooms or retail sales, but it turns out the brewery I liked -- Harmonic -- has a tap room in SF.
author: Cersei L.

description:
Great beer selection and nice design.  Staff is friendly and helpful.   Crab tater tots are very good...just wish you got more of them for the money.  Fries were good too!

This is a great place to catch up with friends over some delicious beer.  And just about any style you want, they have it.
author: Bill T.

description:
Y'ALL STAFF IS AMAZING. To the two Johns and Hopwater Distribution staff: y'all ROCK. 

They don't have a huge sign with their name on it (they kept the old sign outside for history), but when you pass they have a fancy gold symbol with and H on the glass.

Ambiance is industrial, but very welcoming. Fun fact: You can adjust the heights of the stools by spinning them around.

They know their beers, and they take good care of the system that runs the beers. Honestly, the people make this place: they are super kind and fun, and you can really tell they care about their customers. From what I saw, they were greeting everyone new that came in, and if some people were more regular, the staff recognized the people and greeted them with care.

We tried the the Five Dungeness Crab Tater Tots and The Pork Sandwich. I had a pomegranate cider and my bf tried lots of beers that I can't even remember the names of, but he loved them.

This place is worth the stop if you want amazing food, beers, and staff.

Thank you Hopwater Distribution, you rock!
author: Rebecca H.

description: Love this place. Cool space, great service, awesome and constantly changing beer selection and solid and growing food menu.
author: Paul D.

description: Sooooo good! Do yourself a favor and get the crab tater tots. Little pieces of heaven! Great ambiance and service!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Quick update. I'm now 25 years old and these are still the best fries I've had in my life.

Beer's still good too.
author: Shawn W.

description: 5 stars for the drinks but only 2 stars for the food. You can ask to try the beers before committing but the first one I tried was so good that I just went for that. Their crispy chicken sandwich made me regret ordering food as it would've been better spending my calories on something better in SF. It was more like chicken cutlet on a roll instead of the crispy chicken sandwiches that I am used to in NY.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
I'm giving this a 5.

The ambiance is unfinished industrial. Not like a super fuzzy/cozy joint, but still welcoming if you know what I mean.

There are plenty of places in SF to get plenty of different beers. Hopwater-D gets a 5 stars from me because of their taste. I had not heard of plenty of the beers or breweries they curated. I'm not a full-fledged neckbeard beer connoisseur, but I know enough to searched for breweries in different parts of the country. So when I didn't see much I recognized, I was worried it wasn't worth the effort to get there. 

I was wrong. I tried a few different brews and I was very pleased. Bartenders were grand. I wanted to stay longer, but had to get moving. This place is worth the stop.
author: Matt A.

description:
I give this place 4 to 5 stars!

My brother, boyfriend, and I went for the first time and absolutely loved it. We were looking for a place with good food and drinks, but not very crowded. This was it. Apparently this place only gets busy on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursdays around 4-7 (makes sense, after work in downtown area).

Ryan, who was the guy at the cashier where you order your beer and food before self seating yourself, was amazing! He truly tried to find us beers that fit what we liked. He was also very welcoming, and wasn't just there to take people's money. He started conversation and gave great recommendations.

I honestly can't remember what kind of beer I had, but it was good and just what I asked for. There's about 30 options and I am SURE you will find something you like.

THE FOOD IS BOMB! LIKE SO SO SO BOMB!
The three of us shared...

Bar Bites:
- Five Dungeness Crab Tater Tots 
THESE ARE THE ONES! IF YOU DON'T GET THIS, YOU ARE NOT TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THIS PLACE!
- Five Deviled Eggs with Bacon Jam or Cured Rock Cod
YES, YES, YES, I also very much approve of this!
- Five Buttermilk Fried Chicken Tenders
The other two were better, but these were still AMAZING! So juicy and soft and full of yum!

Sandwiches: (we self cut these into small bites so that everyone could try. They also all came with yummy fries!)
- Buttermilk Fried Chicken 
Again, the chicken was very juicy and good. Definitely needs like ketchup or mustard or some sort of sauce on it.
- Cod Sandwich 
GET THIS ONE YOU WON'T REGRET IT
- House Blend Burger
Meh.... Not bad, but there's so much more better. Don't be basic!

Will definitely be back, and I do plan on eventually trying the entire menu!!!!!!! #TooGood
author: Kassie E.

description:
A short walk down (albeit San Francisco steep) from my hotel, a little streetside discreet bar exists.  From the street, nothing.  Inside, life exists.  Exuberant bartenders set the mood for this neighborhoody bar, a great menu, and a bunch of northern-only taps...make this really a beer bar.

I didn't know of any the 25-30 featured draft beers, and I get around.  Why?  They only feature from breweries 60 miles max.  No worries, I ordered a Sugaree Maple Pecan Pie Bourbon beer (High Water Brewing) and a PranQster Belgian Style Golden Ale (North Coast Brewing Co), and both were totally delish and $7 (in fact, all brews are $6-8).

Wonderful new mate, AJ, recommended the crab tater tots & the bacon deviled eggs, so I had to try after the chicken tenders were so amazing.  All were very worthy and memorable (especially with the California Chili hot sauce), I'd rate:

1.  Chicken tenders [$8, 5.0 stars] -- incredible batter, perfectly cooked. 

2.  Bacon deviled eggs [$8, 4.5 stars] -- a little small, 5 x 1/3 eggs, but OMG.

3.  Crab Tater Tots [$12, 4.0 stars] -- great, but not sure if I'd order again.

Overall, great bar with amazing friendly service (by all 3 bartenders) with great food and beers.  Two thumbs up.
author: Randy B.

description:
Cool joint with great taps and apps.

I tucked into a Kolsch while the GF had some sort of raspberry ale. We split deviled eggs with bacon jam, crab tater tots and the chicken tenders. Everything was spot on, and the staff we super nice. The space is cool and unpretentious and the ordering system is perfect.
author: Drew P.

description:
Phenomenal beer selection. These folks manage to snag beers that are virtually impossible to find anywhere else. It's a must-stop every time I'm in San Francisco.

The food menu is fairly simple, but I've been pleased with everything I've ordered. The service is usually quick and attentive, both at the bar and at tables.
author: Peter F.

description:
Didn't eat any food here, but came for a beer in the evening. They have a really good choice of beers that will tickle anyone's fancy. Don't know what to get? The bartenders are really knowledgeable and won't hesitate to give you little taster samples. 
Would come here again for good beers at good prices when in SF
author: Mati K.

description: Super fun local atmosphere with great service great beer! Excellent food and kind people. So welcoming it feels like you are a part of the neighborhood!
author: shea h.

description:
Really great place for meeting up with a group of friends or to catch up with an old friend over beer and a good tasting bar food. Hopwater has an extensive selection of rotating California beers and the staff was helpful at making a selection, so don't worry if you're not knowledgeable about beers. 

They have upstairs and downstairs seating. You order all food and beverage at the counter downstairs where you will get your drinks and a food runner brings the food when you're seated. We ordered the following:

Crab Tater Tots - Crunchy outside with a soft inside with lot's of crab flavor. The flavor was reminiscent of a fish stick, but in a good way!

Deviled Eggs w/ Bacon Jam - Creamy and salty with a hint of sweetness at the end from the bacon jam. 

Buttermilk Fried Chicken Tenders -  Crispy outside with tender juicy chicken on the inside. I wish the chicken was more flavorful but it came with a sweet dipping sauce, which was good in moderation.

The Pork Sandwich - The disappointment of the evening. The sandwich lacked flavor, which was surprising considering the ingredients. It could have used a sauce, perhaps. However, the fries was delicious!

This is a great place that we will be returning to and will recommend to others.
author: Sara P.

description:
Hopwater Distribution is a great place to hang out with some friends and get some craft beers and finger food near Union Square.  The place has a great ambiance and decor and there's cool seating on the second level as well as additional tables and chairs further into the bar.

Prices are fair given the area.  The place can get pretty busy around happy hour when seating can be more difficult to find.  I was really excited when this place opened up in 2014, but as the years have gone up has become a little less sharp and seems to be moving somewhat to a more dive bar aesthetic.
author: Mark C.

description:
Great atmosphere. Wonderful beer selection. Didn't try the food but that's going to happen on trip 2. Staff was attentive, seating options were creative and comfortable. And they know how to pour a beer with proper head and in the right glassware. 

Definitely on the return to list!
author: Kevin K.

description: My girlfriend and I stopped here for dinner on our way to a show. It was more casual than we were expecting which was nice; we sat ourselves upstairs on the little balcony. Great beer selection on tap. All of the food was very tasty, the only downside being that much of it was fried/heavy and we didn't feel great afterward. I'd say their selection of lighter foods is not as strong. The crab tater tots were a highlight. The warm goat cheese was absolutely delicious down to the leaf it was sitting on. We got mixed pickles and appreciated how each vegetable seemed to have been pickled with a different mix of spices. As an entree we split the fried chicken sandwich. It was good but nothing to particularly write home about... these days you can find a relatively good fried chicken sandwich in so many places, they really have to be stellar to stand out. The fries with it were excellent.
author: Adrienne R.

description:
Robert and I stopped here for a tasty beer selection and found John and Mary pouring unique delicious beers - very local and the best from these breweries. Many of my favorites!! 

We shared the Five bacon jam deviled eggs and the Buttermilk Fried Chicken tenders - Mmmmm delicious and just the right amount. 

30 interesting beers from California, a winning combination!
author: Rew C.

description: Good beer selection, good food and good service. They really got the basics nailed down. You order at the bar and get your own table which makes things simple and the beer selection is listed on the wall behind the  bar. Great lite place right off Union Square (a bit of a climb from Union Square actually)
author: Gil S.

description: Came down to Hopwater Distribution for some nice indoor bar atmosphere as well as a steampunk inspired theme! Offers a menu of wines and beers. I got a glass of champagne called "Bubbles" for $12. That was a little much and honestly my only complaint if I had any. But in San Francisco, that is pretty average for a drink. Overall it is a fun place! And I will definitely frequent again.
author: Samantha C.

description:
30 beers on tap, enough said. 

I needed a place to get some friends together for a casual reunion and thought Hopwater Distribution fit the bill. It is a few blocks away from Union Square so far enough from the hustle and bustle, but close enough to BART. We met there around 7PM on a Tuesday evening and found that it indeed fit the bill. It was the right balance of hipster sanctuary for the overworked techie and rustic-industrial bar for those that don't want to be categorized into the other group.

They have a rotating tap, but I recommend the Altamont Maui Waui IPA. I'm not typically a fan of IPAs, but this one had a smooth sweetness to it that almost made me think I wasn't drinking an IPA. Sample a couple before you decide! 

The price was average ($7-9/pint), options were superb (lots of local craft brews), and it was crowded on a Tuesday (which implies either popular spot or rough Tuesday).
author: Catherine L.

description:
Huge beer selection, so just come here for that and skip the food menu. We made the mistake of ordering their chicken tenders. They came out 35 minutes later and tasted bland but had this weird texture like you're crunching through something (think rubbery/crunchy). I remember that texture from the last time I froze chicken then reheated it. Not sure that's what they are doing here but wasn't good. One of the tenders was cut in half (maybe to check if it was done?) and one of the larger tenders was undercooked. 

Just come here to drink, don't bother with their food.
author: Scott H.

description:
An upscale brewpub that services a large variety of beer, plus food that's quite a few notches above typical bar fare. They have 30 brews on tap, featuring primarily California brewers, and their food selection is reasonably extensive and good-quality, whether it's cheese and salumi plates, salads, apps like deviled eggs, or more traditional comfort food like sliders, chicken tenders, and burgers.

Service is friendly and approachable, and there's a variety of spaces for all sorts of groups and purposes, whether the more social bar and ground floor area, or more private tables and booths in the upstairs loft. A very nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Had the crab tots (MUST have) and pulled pork sliders nearing culinary perfection.  Great spot for craft beer and great food (harder to find combo in SF than I anticipated).  Cloudy WC-style IPA I had was heaven. 

Speed of service during tail end of busy time Tuesday was lackluster, reason not a 5.  Highly recommend.
author: David T.

description:
We hit this spot our first night in town and it suited us just fine. The beer selection was large for SF beer week, and we both found things we really enjoyed. Ale Industries Cherry Kush was a tea beer with cherry juice that is worth a mention here
We also ordered two cheeses, a cow's milk truffle ricotta and a semi-soft cow & goat cheddar, the arugula salad, the crab tater tots and the pulled pork sliders. I really enjoyed both cheeses, but he BF wasn't really that interested in the ricotta. The salad was good--hard to mess something like that up. The tots and sliders were his, but I tasted both and all was good food. 

This place has a different feel than a restaurant since you have to order your food and drinks at the bar and then find a seat with a number so the food runner can bring the plates. Although it was crowded, we had no issue ordering and the bar tender was friendly. The food came out right away. Getting up for more beers was the reason for 4 stars.
author: Allison A.

description: When I'm in the Bay and want to grab a beer, I immediately think of Hopwater. The vibe is pretty chill even on the busier nights. The crowd is always friendly. And the selection of libations in always on point. Seating can be limited but don't let that turn you off from enjoying yourself here. I have not had the food; however, in the future, I will make it a point to enjoy some munchies.
author: Eric O.

description: Nice, diverse tap list.  Creative combinations and tasty grub.  Pleasant atmosphere and staff.  You can rack up a bill pretty quickly with $8 pours, appetizers and entrees.  Portions could be a little larger but no regrets.
author: J B.

description:
This place is beautiful! And they have great beer. We came in around 7:30pm on a Friday and there were literally only two seats on the top floor left. You order at the bar before finding a seat, both your food and drink, and then they'll bring the food to you wherever you sit down. 

They allow dogs, they were playing basketball on the tvs around us, and the beer was excellent. The only downside was how long it took to get served and how pricey the beer was! I think I'm just used to Texas prices though.
author: Sereena J.

description:
Great place. We were bar hopping all Friday and this was one of the places along the way :) So happy we stopped by! Clean spot with friendly service and lots of seating options. Great food (we had the steak fries although what I really wanted were the crab tater tots) options and lotsa beer on tap - 30 to be exact! WHOA!

We tried the HenHouse, Faction Something Different IPA and Social SKB Pilsner. Beautiful colors of three lovely beers :)

Need to come back!
author: Heliana M.

description:
For the second stop on our impromptu pub crawl of nob hill we stopped here. The space is cool with brick walls floor to ceiling and a long bar with tables throughout the first and second floor. 

It was about 6:30pm on Saturday night and the bar stools were full with a few seats available downstairs.  We saw a sign stating you order at the bar. There are 30 taps with a great selection of beers. I love IPA's and there were several to choose from including some double and triples. 

They have a nice menu full of bites, cheeses and salumi, sandwiches, sliders and salads. The prices are reasonable and we decided to try the jalapeño salami.   It came with some crunchy bite size toast and some pickled carrot slices. All for $4. The meals we saw going to other patrons all looked good.

As we were leaving, the downstairs was almost full and a few tables were seated upstairs.

The service was very good. The decor was really neat, our style, industrial. We would like to come back some time for dinner.
author: Mike B.

description:
Had this place bookmarked and was in SF for a quick weekend getaway  so I said what the Hell.

VERY crowded..but it is tourist season. Beer selection pretty good but with volume of people hard to get a quick refill.  I had the beef sliders with bacon and mozzarella and was pretty good...a little dry but I would order them again.   Looking forward to a return visit in the fall.
author: Paul E.

description: First time here and loved the Pumpkin Harvest Ale. Enjoyed a salad with the buttermilk fried chicken! Very cool place with a great beer selection! Two floors of seating and great atmosphere. Order food and drinks at the bar; super casual!
author: Jaime B.

description:
I went back and forth on this. It's a good place to get a beer with a great selection on tap. So, if you're in the area and looking for a beer, this place is 4-5*. 

What sealed the 3* were the sticky tables. We sat at a high table and then a sit down table upstairs and both had sticky surfaces.  Left an icky first impression. 

Onto the food. We came for dinner. The chicken tenders were more like 5-6 pieces of chicken nuggets and the sauce was too sweet. The sauce was greatly improved by mixing it with mustard. 

The fried chicken sandwich was Delicious!  They had a nice slaw and aioli on it and the bread was warm and soft and delicious.  Felt like they were a little skimpy on the fries. 

It got quite loud as a large group came in. 

So, somewhere from a 3-5* depending on the scene of the day and what you're in the mood for.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Casual, cozy brew pub featuring a nice variety of California brews and very tasty snacks.

Seemed like mostly local young crowd with a few out of towners like me mixed in.  Low key, relaxed atmosphere.

Order at the bar, not at the table.

I had the pork sandwich and it was Very Good, but smallish.
The other items coming out looked like little snacks too.

I enjoyed my meal and beers and would return if I had the opportunity.
author: Dave P.

description:
My lil bro is a local and this is his favorite bar he recommended. I went with a few friends on Saturday night 8:30pm and we were fortunate to catch one of those upstairs loft booths I think are so fun. Almost like a church balcony! With enough beers, anyone can be singing amens in there!

Pros: 
- Great chill vibe. Not too loud, so you can actually have a conversation. 
- Almost full but not overly crowded on a Saturday night. 
- Large selection of local beers

Cons:
- not a huge variety of beers..I think the bourbon barrel aged imperial stout I got was the only stout up there. Maybe only one or two ambers, 1-2 total browns / reds. And then the rest were hoppy IPAs and pale ales. I'm kinda going off memory, but that's the sense I got. 

Overall obviously I loved it!
author: Jeff O.

description:
As a Nob Hill resident there are many places to choose from to eat at, no matter what you are craving. Hopwater Distribution is one of those places I can always go to at a moments notice and know I will enjoy my time there completely.

It may seem like a small, hole in the wall bar, but there are plenty of seats towards the back, upstairs and around the main entrance.

Note: This is an order drinks and food at the bar and seat yourself kind of place!

Beer: I always go with an IPA (usually Faction) and it is delicious and gives that Hoppy taste one may acquire. There are over 25 different beers to choose from too, so you are bound to find a beer that will suit you!

Food: 4/5 Food here is pretty good every time I go! I either get the cheese burger or pulled pork sandwich. Both very juicy and cooked to taste! There are also a ton of appetizers, which I haven't tried before, but have seen them on other tables and look great! 

Service: 5/5 The bar tenders are very helpful, kind, and easy to talk to when ordering or sitting at the bar. Although you order at the bar, the people who bring your food to you where you're sitting are always nice as well, even if it is a quick encounter.
author: Michael T.

description:
A solid bar in a really central location. I came for friends, but stayed for the triple IPA they serve.

Their burger is also great! No veggies, but the meat patty is thick and cooked well aka medium rare. They know what they're doing -- that's both the chefs and servers who are very prompt.

I also thought their bathrooms were noticeably nice and admired their second floor which is more like a perimeter / indoor porch area than floor.
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Had high hopes for this place but it was pretty average for my So Cal taste buds.

Think I had the Sudwerk Pilsner and ordered the pulled pork sliders (was hoping some sauce or more flavor but the pork was tender), chicken tenders (average at best but I did like the tangy sweet and sour sauce), and side of fries (it was average but i was hungry).
author: Dennis H.

description: A new favorite place for me. Incredible beer selection, maybe the best in The City. Tasty appetizer style foods that made for a wonderful meal. And a cool space and attentive service.  Thumbs up!
author: Jay H.

description:
Great spot! Atmosphere is top notch! Inner brick, and overhead loft space - Grab a drink here with friends, there is lots of room. 

A ton of local beer options for you beer lovers. And great food options to pair with it. I had their veggie burger and it was super delish.
author: Jenna M.

description:
Definitely the neighborhood place to come if you're aching for an amazing and super reasonably priced craft beer, think around $7-8 per pint, and they frequently rotate their offerings. Great if you want to try a new selection of beers every other week or so. Staff are always very kind, quick to take your order at the bar and register, and they case the place for dishes to clear so that the place remains consistently neat and tidy. 

What they've done with the venue space is absolutely amazing. What was once an old brick building has become a restaurant, bar, and overhead loft space. It's incredibly fun to sit up above and look down at the bar below. Downstairs area has tabling and communal seating as well. 

Not a great place to come if you're hungry and looking for a substantial meal. Their bar bites are tiny, their "chicken strips" are more like chicken nuggets (tasty and high-quality meat nonetheless), and the salads run a little pricey and definitely feel more like a side salad than a meal salad. Would be 5 stars if the food offerings were a little better, and if they rotated out their menu (it seems to have stayed the same for quite a while now).
author: Alison A.

description: Very good food  Pickled veggie appetizer was great. The steak fries are nicely seasoned. I ate the arugula salad with grilled cod - very tasty. Other items we had were the pulled pork sandwich, grilled cod entree and Cobb salad.  All were very good.  Mexican Coca Cola is served. 30 beers on tap. They do not offer beer flights. We were a part of 8 with 4 kids. They had an area of to the side which was private. It was next to the kitchen but that didn't bother is with the amount of noise 4 boys can make.
author: Mary S.

description: I'm only speaking for the service and the beer.  I did not eat any food but the people around me cleaned their plates.  Didn't look gourmet but definitely a solid menu.  The service was impeccable and every beer filled to the brim.  California knows how to brew beer and these guys know how to serve it.  I will be back.  Cheers
author: Greg G.

description: Really cute low key bar with great bartenders, delicious food (Pork Sandwich was amaze), and great beer selection.  I love an easy going triple (Drunk Monk? ... clearly too alcoholic for me).
author: Yon L.

description:
I'm a fan of Hopwater, and not just because I live close by. They have a good (rotating) selection of beers, and lots of space to sit and drink them. It's a good spot for groups of 4-5 and stays open decently late. They also serve food, which I've had a couple of times (and was good pub grub) but the main highlight is the beer.

I've occasionally had issues with the place getting a little overheated (especially upstairs), but it's not unbearable. Other than that it's a nice space.

Highlights: watching a dog show on the bar TV from 3 years ago while sipping on a pint and becoming increasingly more invested in which doggo was going to end up on top. Haven't had that experience anywhere else yet.
author: Joe B.

description:
Solid place for a casual dinner or beer. Great for catching sports but also good for a quiet meal upstairs. 

The vegetarian lentil and polenta dish keeps me coming back. It's the epitome of comfort with creamy polenta in a bowl of lentil stew.
author: Crystal F.

description: This is my favorite place in my neighborhood to grab a drink, eat some good food, and just relax. The staff is friendly, the food is tasty, and the rotating beer selection is great! The one thing that's hard about the rotating selection is that when your favorite's gone, you have to find a new drink--but there's so many others to choose from that you'll find something.
author: Midori H.

description:
When I lived in the area, Hopwater was always my go-to meet up spot. Especially good for friends visiting from out of town. They also do take-out for those nights where you want a quick, quality dinner.

I still go back sometimes for the chicken sando (dat chimichurri), crab tater tots, and bacon jam deviled eggs. The salads are also tasty!
author: Liz J.

description:
Good place. Love the aura here, very relaxed.  I like the triple voodoo 

Staff are friendly.

Order at the bar. Then servers will bring you your order.

I like the second floor space.

Restroom is surprisingly clean. Good job staff and customers.

Parking is of course street parking. 

Ill come visit again and update my review with more content.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I have come here a total of 2 times. Once with le bf and once for a work function. 

This place serves some pretty awesome food. I've tried:
1. Steak fries
2. Chicken tenders 
3. Sliders
4. Burger

The streak fries are very, very good. I highly recommend you get them. During the 2 times I have been here, I have ordered at least 5 portions of it because they just disappear because they are so good. They always come out super hot, which I really like. They are also super crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside. The chicken tender were surprisingly good. They were super crispy on the outside, and tender on the inside (in the best way possible). The sliders and burgers were also very good. Always come out well seasoned. I've never personally had any of the deviled eggs (with bacon jam or cured rock cod), but I kept needing to order more of both kinds during the work event. I think in total, over the course of 1.5 hours, I ordered about 6-7 portions of it. It seemed like people really enjoyed them.  

This place has a very impressive selection of beers. They also do have wines, if beers/ciders aren't really your thing. I would definitely be back for the fun environment and tasty food. Definitely come on the earlier end if possible because finding a table could be kind of hard.
author: Carolyn Z.

description: Some reviewers indicated that the logistics in this place are bad when it's busy, and I could totally see that, although we went on a late on a weekday evening and it was slow.  The service and atmosphere were good.  The food was good, standard gastropub type and quality; I wouldn't go so far as to give it an "upscale" gastropub fare designation.  Beer selection was commendable.  I would eat here again if I was in the area and hungry, but I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way for it and it's not the kind of place I'd tell others "You have to go!"
author: Cassandra R.

description:
Hands down a true San Francisco gem. 

The entire staff is welcoming, friendly, and helpful when it comes to their extensive beer selection. The food is dangerously delicious (crab tater tots, the chicken sandwich, the burger are some of my go-to choices). And they have a generous amount of seating which makes it perfect for watching baseball games (they'll even put on A's games sometimes!) or for meeting up with friends before a movie.
author: Bev M.

description:
Before catching a show at the Masonic, my friend P and I stopped by here for a nosh and a beer (or three). We were initially dismayed at the wall of people & sound when we crossed the threshold.  And there wasn't an empty seat in the house at 7 pm on a Wednesday night.

But "seating karma" was with us that evening. On making an about-face near the bar, I noted a sweet window spot just opening up. We descended quickly, to the annoyance of others who noticed too late. (I've been those people many, many times).

I left to order beers while P guarded the spot.  And after our beers were half sipped, I guarded the spot while he ordered food at the register; necessary precautions with the constant, roving packs of seat-hunters. Sort of ridiculous, truth be told.

The food was decent and very much in the gastropub mode:

-- Sliders: We ordered two plates of 3 mixed sliders:  The chicken slider was a bit boring; the pulled pork was good but not great; but the standard beef was my favorite

-- Deviled eggs with bacon jam: Decadent as expected. Delicious but not mind-blowing.

The service here was excellent, even though the only option was to order beer and food at the bar. The super friendly bartender looked like she had just hopped off the bus from Kansas. She was so very psyched and excited about every single beer she poured it became a joy to order.  Bussers roamed the room efficiently, removed empty plates and beer glasses out of our way.

And speaking of beer, their list was fantastic: 31 beers, all from California, consisting of multiple types and styles, and mostly winners. I tried a double IPA, a session pale ale, and ended with lovely, smooth Baltic Porter. We didn't really need brews at the concert venue after that.  :-p

Love: 
-- Great beer list and service
-- The faded, neon sign out front advertising the old 1950's Key Club location. Definitely on the hipster end of the spectrum. But I loved the disinformation.

Didn't Love:
-- Crowds, crowds, crowds. Yes, there is such a thing as being too popular; we were indeed fortunate we found a spot. Next time I try to come here I'll make sure to have a backup spot in mind. I doubt we'll be as lucky.
author: Dan B.

description: Very disappointed in this place.  Keep in mind that if you go here, their kitchen is not prepared for any sort of rush.  Friends and I went here before a show at the Masonic a few weeks ago.  We all ordered at the same time, my 3 friends got their food in about 10 min or so.  I kept waiting for my food (nothing complicated, just a salad and crostini).  30 min later I still don't have my food.  The waitress was pleasant and it definitely wasn't her fault, she was trying her best.  Finally I go back to the person who took my order and she was very nonchalant and rude, tells me the kitchen is backed up and to wait.  I told her it was ridiculous that my entire group had already finished eating and I hadn't gotten my food.  They gave me my money back right as my food came out, 45 min after we ordered.  The food tasted fine but by this point I was so irritated that I didn't enjoy it at all.  I will not go back.
author: Julie P.

description: Good food , great beer selection. Their pomegranate cider was awesome! Definitely would recommend, cool vibes.
author: Monica N.

description:
This spot, located near Union Square is a place you can get lots of different delicious brews (probably have like 50+ beers on tap). The wooden atmosphere is welcoming and an ideal trendy spot to meet for happy hour and such. I went to this joint before heading off to dinner elsewhere so it's not a bad place to meet up for a drink first before painting the town red.

Don't get the regular fries--they're just some lackluster steak-cut fries that suck.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Super neat tap room serving craft beer and gourmet bites.  They have 25 beers on tap at all times which get rotated.  They also have a small selection of wines for non-beer drinkers and one of the taps had cider for the gluten free crowd.  

My favorite was the New Republic Apricot Aged Sour beer which was a 5oz pour that I couldn't get enough of.  I had two glasses and could've sucked down a couple more but I have my limits.  

The crab tater tots were delegate bites of crabby goodness topped with a simple aioli.  The sliders the table next to us ordered looked great as well.  

Don't let the unassuming sign outside fool you.  This is a gem of a place, so go in there, order at the bar, keep that tab open, find a seat then tip well and be happy.
author: Tammie W.

description:
Man have I looked for that one place that is both convenient and awesome. Some places are good, but way out of the way.

Enter Hopwater Distribution, the place for a beer guy. My server was pretty cool. Got the beer Don't Tell Claudia. She thought the name of the beer was funny, so It's good for people to have a sense of humor.

The atmosphere is hands down boss. Having a couple levels, just like a Super Duper burger, so you can enjoy your beer anywhere in the place. 

One suggestion is to turn the roof seen on the 2nd floor into a patio so that it can be like a beer garden. That would be quality. Also chargers, need lots of wall chargers, but that's you know can live without it.

Hopwater Distribution is exactly what I was hoping for. My long, hard fought search for a real watering hole is over. Salute.
author: Mike H.

description: Great place with a lot of beer.  We ended up getting a couple of  appetizers. Let's just say we where not disappointed.  Beer is cold and they have plenty of choices for everyone.  Staff was super friendly upon our visit.
author: Jerry C.

description: Mary was amazing! She was so sweet and considerate when I was ordering my drinks and food. I was trying to order the veggie sandwich but without portobello mushroom (I don't like mushrooms). She said the sandwich wouldn't be much of anything if I took out the mushrooms. So I tried to put more toppings to add to the sandwich. She said I could do that but I'd have to pay extra for the add-ins! That was very nice of her to tell me. Usually waiters just ring me up and don't tell me/care that I'd be getting charged extra on top of paying for a mushroom sandwich without the portobello. She was very awesome and considerate!! She offered alternative dishes I could get instead. I got the chicken sandwich without chicken and it was yummy! The fries are really good here! Mary was amazing though & I appreciated her service!
author: Kim P.

description:
Came here before a show at the Masonic. Was easy to order and nab seats upstairs but wish they had a food menu board since the paper menus were hard to find. Had a blueberry ale and an IPA which were alright. 
The burger and fried chicken sandwich were delicious.
Was hoping they would have a Belgian white beer option but oh well.
author: Marie W.

description:
The reviews on the bacon deviled eggs are no joke.  These things are delicious and reasonably priced.  I could have eaten 10 of them!  They have a great beer selection with cold, bold beer (we visited a place earlier in the week and the beer tasted watered down).  They have a delicious North Coast Belgian beer on tap - I had two.  The pork sandwich is pretty good but nothing tops the deviled eggs!! 

ONE TIP!  This place is hard to find.  There is very little signage outside.  I will take a pic of the building to help.  Basically - we walked until we found the numerical portion of the address, other than that - we would have never found it.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
I think tonight might have been a freak - Bryan Ferry at the masonic and it was Packed!

We ordered out food at the bar and I was afraid our food would come with no place to eat it. But I asked a table for 4 with 2 empty seat and they let us join them. 

The food looked a lot bigger on Yelp I am (totally guessing) that they halved the chicken fingers for tonight's rush (the fingers looked a LOT bigger on Yelp) I know a chicken finger and these were cut in half.

We also got the deviled eggs - the bacon jam - could have been more bacon-y. The highlight of the three was the sliders - but they were a highlight of mediocre. 

Ambiance - I liked it...but likely will not be back
author: Amy W.

description:
Great Tator Tots - never thought I would write that phase.  Actually, the food is very good and the beer selection excellent.  Outstanding sliders with paper jack cheeses and avocado - topped off with delicious sliced pickle...
Sat upstairs in comfortable small booth - the overall space is more intimate than looks on line.
Note - have to order - & re-order all drinks and food at the bar - so could be slow when busier.
Note - a couple of flat screen TV's are positioned above the front windows - so we were able to watch the game.
author: Dennis S.

description:
I  really liked this place and wish a similar establishment would open in OC! 

As other Yelpers mentioned, there's a huge variety of beer on tap. They're mostly heavier beers but I ordered a lighter one (Pilsner I think) and it was still a bit on the hoppy side. I ordered a burger and it was pretty good - cooked to order. Wish the burger patty was a tad bigger but overall it made me full. I actually really liked the steak fries - thick potato slices and not overly salted. 

Shout out to the super patient lady taking our order. We took at least a few minutes and I knew were holding up the line but she was so patient and nice. We never felt rushed and she let us sample several beers before ordering. 

I would definitely go back to hang out and sample more beers!
author: Christine K.

description: Great beer,  the food is top notch, and it was family friendly sitting down the back.
author: Rob S.

description:
This place is great! They have a fantastic mix of about 20-30 beers that are usually local and all delicious. If you don't know what you want, the bartenders are also great about providing suggestions based on what you want. 

They also have great pub food, but, if i remember correctly, the kitchen closes relatively early (around 9) on weekdays. So make sure you order early! They do have an upstairs area too, so it's nice if you wanna come with a group- you don't have to worry about space constraints as much.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
We had the fried chicken sandwich, crab tater tots, chicken tenders, hobb's salumi and the jalapeno salumi. They all were decently priced and yummy. 

If you are not a fan of hoppy beer like I am - try the Sudwerk and North Coast PranQster. They were really good! 

Overall, I really enjoyed the drink, food and vibe here!
author: Josephine S.

description: Went here for small bites. Nice chill place, but a bit loud for my taste. Food was good, but pricey. I think it is more for hanging out with the younger crowd and drinking. If I was more into that type of thing, then I would love it here! But we were looking more for some small bites and doing a snack break with the food. But very nice location.
author: Okapi C.

description:
Glowing with lights and charm!  

I adore this gastropub that is filled with a varietal of special draft beers and bite-sized dishes to delve into!

It's self-order at the counter and the food compliments well with anything and everything.  Yes, it does and I just said it.  Wings, burgers and the gourmet of munchies.  I.E. I love the wings!  You name it!

They have upstairs side booths and downstairs with adequate dining. A hung tv screen to watch whichever game is going on.

Definitely a spot to chill at! Hop on over to Hopwater and get drinking!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Great spot to drop by for drinks and grab a bite to eat. There are lots of beers on tap! The staff is friendly and great at offering recommendations If you're not quite sure which beer to try. You could also ask to try out a few samples. The Oatmeal Stout was nice and smooth. It was my choice of beer for the night :) 

As for the food, the deviled egg was pretty good, chicken tender was just okay, and the sliders were a bit bland and too dry. Hopwater is more of a spot were you come for the drinks and food is more of an afterthought. Perhaps next time I visit, I'll find something on the food menu I really enjoy. If not, I'd still be very happy just to come back and check out the new rotation of beer on tap!

It was a pretty good turnout on a Friday night yet it wasn't hard to find seats. If you have a larger party of more than 4, you might want to come earlier. We opted to sit at one of the booths on the 2nd floor that overlooks the bar area below. Great ambiance, lots of working professionals, pretty busy but not too loud to have a conversation. Definitely one of my new go-to spots if I'm in the area. Overall, it's a great spot to wind down from a long work week!
author: Ruby C.

description: Stopped by for a quick drink or 2 after work on a Friday.  Gradually got busy after a few hours, found 2 bar seats.  Had the beef sliders, wasn't nothing out of the ordinary.  Ordered joy juice, really good.  Staff was really friendly.  Tons of beer selections to choose from.  Plenty of space upstairs to socialize with friends, grab a drink and some food.  Cool spot.
author: KB B.

description: The food is ridiculously good.  The tap selection is awesome.  It's loud and young and vibrant here.  You will love it for the price.
author: Christopher B.

description:
Ate here two weeks ago Sunday.  It was pretty good.  I understand the brewpub type seating - just find a table and grab it, but this place is very busy and it's confusing as to who's already been standing there and who hasn't.  It's really kind of a mess.  You don't order at the table, rather you stand in a pretty decent line at the bar which crowds the tables near and surrounding it.  Servers were very nice, and the beer {we had a very dark ale it was excellent} was very good.  We ordered the fried chicken bites, the deviled eggs, the crab cake bites and the steak fries.  The crab cake bites were very fishy {too fishy} but the sauce on them was very good.  The deviled eggs were amazing - definitely my favorite of our order.  Our server, who seemed rush, pulled our table number 1/2 way through delivering our order.  When I asked if she still knew we were getting a few other dishes she immediately returned it, however, when we got the remainder of our order the fried chicken bites were over-cooked and very dry and the steak fries tasted like they had been sitting for quite some time.  I would definitely not order the steak fries again at all.

I would come back again it just wasn't one of my favorites in the City.  It was okay - a decent and inexpensive bite to eat after seeing a show nearby.
author: Samantha T.

description:
Tons of beers on tap (even a cider option for those looking for it).

Spacious bar with front, back and upstairs dining. 

Order food and drinks at the bar; food is brought to your table. 

The food is tasty and great!! Believe the reviews on the bacon jam deviled eggs and crab tater tots. 

A great stop in if you're looking for a chill, casual atmosphere with good food and beer.

Thank you, Yelp!
author: Pamela K.

description:
Wonderful ambiance, friendly servers, great beers, and a great crowd!

The hardest part was choosing WHICH beer(s) to get.  I wanted them ALL.

Why only 3-stars?  I found the food to be really mediocre.

Not "bad", just...not worth eating.

Maybe it was my mistake for feeding myself at a beer joint?  I live far north of the wall, in culinarily-challenged Alaska.  My expectations are not high.  I figure just about any 'ol joint in SF will have much better eats than most spots in AK.  I am at a sandwich and it was painfully OK.

Would I come back? Absolutely!

I'll just get food somewhere else, beforehand.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Low key, great food, and rock solid selection of craft beers on draft.

We checked this place out for dinner and were not disappointed.
I ordered the Blackened Brew Rock Cod Salad (Served with: Summer Corn Ratatouille, Chive Creme Fraîche, Market Greens).  Wow, I had no idea I was getting probably one of the best things on the menu. The fish was cooked perfectly and it had great flavor. Also, the portion size was not disappointing as many restaurants these days can be.  I tip my hat to the chef on that one. 

They even had the football game on that I wanted to watch and the bartenders provided great customer service. 

Solid selection of local and not so local crafts. The IPA's we had were quite tasty and served nice and cold.

Great experience overall. 

Tip: This is a great spot to take someone on a date who truly enjoys a good beer while in the city.
author: Chris Raymond H.

description:
Continued to be in town for a few weeks oddly enough without my work schedule putting me all over the country. Was happy to meet up with a few friends I had not seen in a while and decided that Hopwater would be the destination choice. This joint is a beer person's heaven without a doubt and sure has a great atmosphere as well. As soon as you walk in, the room is an open floor plan with tables all around the joint and TVs set up to allow you to watch games which in our case was the cubs game. The place is always pretty hopping so worth it to bake some time for grabbing a spot at the bar especially. The bartenders were all pretty chill and were able to carry a conversation with the all the patrons causing a fun atmosphere.

The beer choices are actually written up on the board for your choosing and they certainly have plenty of options to choose from so beer fanatics do not be afraid. If you are not a beer fan, this may not be the spot for you but even I not being a huge beer person found this place pretty enjoyable. I had three different beers and all were delicious and by pure chance of luck happened to be the highest ABV... I swear. After enjoying a few of these beers, we ordered food which for me consisted of the house burger. The burger was pretty solid and I was a fan overall of it coupled with the beer. Kind of the perfect pair. 

All in all, a solid spot and definitely worth checking out. Cool vibes atmosphere, solid burger, and plenty of delicious beer choices.
author: Dan M.

description: Loveee this place! I would definitely recommend stopping by and giving this place a try! So many great selections of beers and food. The looks of the outerior isn't as appealing or eye catching but you will be surprise how beautiful the decor is inside.  Amazing customer services i will be back here for sure!
author: Helen N.

description: Beers are good and prices are fine. Crab tater tots tasted odd. Perhaps there are too many dried herbs? Not sure. Chicken tenders are good, but not overly special. Views and ambiance are A+++.
author: Mackenzie W.

description: Great place! Fantastic selection of local, craft beers, coupled with tasty pub grub. I found this little gem hiding across the street from Del Poppolo, which I also recommend. If you like craft beer, you will love this place.
author: David R.

description: Get the crab tots, they're impeccable! Love the staff there. They're always so helpful when deciding what to drink since they have an enormous selection of beer. It's a fun place to meet friends for a drink and a bite to eat.
author: Alison V.

description: Good selection of beer and the deviled eggs and crab tots were amazing. No wait service so order from bar.
author: Jonn D.

description:
This review is for 4.5 stars.

This is my type of bar.  Rotating beers that range from local to across-country rare.  Friendly staff who knows their stuff and will give you a recommendation if you ask for it.  I came with a friend for one quick beer and we ended up staying for three a piece.  This is a type of bar that every city needs.
author: Zachary A.

description: Fun place to get a beer and food with friends. They have a ton of different beers and their food is AMAZING!
author: Kathleen C.

description: I had an amazing burger for a very great price. The beer was delicious as well. It is possible to eat there, or to just have a beer. A wide selection of beers is available.
author: Damian F.

description: Great selection of local beers. Food was good too but don't come hungry with a Texas appetite :)
author: John D.

description:
Hopwater Distribution is a great happy hour spot to catch up with friends over craft beer and bar bites. Theres a great selection of beers on tap and the food is delicious.

I've brought a few different friends here and everyone seems to enjoy coming. The atmosphere is fun and it's basically always packed. It can be a bit difficult to find a seat, but usually you don't have to wait too long until something opens up. 

Hopwater definitely puts a gourmet twist on your typical bar foods. Everything I've tried has impressed me, but don't expect to be cheap. I try not to come here too often because it can be a bit pricey, but it's hard when I live down the street and the food is so good.
author: Estelle C.

description: Great food and beer selection! My husband and I were visiting from L.A. He loves beer and I prefer wine. Both of our needs were met. I found a nice Pinot Grigio and he found three different beers. The food was delicious! We ordered deviled eggs, Pulled Pork sliders and steak fries.
author: Cecilia m.

description: Cute little spot a few blocks from the Masonic. They have over 20 taps with a great local craft beer selection. The food was also pretty good. We had the crab tater tots (which were like mini crab cake bites), the sliders (med-rare with swiss cheese), and the truffle ricotta. The tots and ricotta were 5/5 but the sliders were kind of disappointing. The bun was dry and burger patty lacked flavor. We ended up spreading the ricotta on the bun and that actually made it better. This is an order from the bar and find a seat type of establishment so it can get crazy. We sat at the bar so we didn't have to keep getting up to order. Overall I would return if I was nearby, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Rachelle Anne J.

description: Impressive beer menu. Food was way better than expected. What a great spot! Place was jammed packed by the time we left. Good people.
author: Micah A.

description:
Nice bartenders.  They gave me and a friend good advice to grab a table ASAP before they became too crowded, rather than ordering our meals first.  Sure enough right after we sat down a lot of people started coming in, so we were seated just in time. 

The venue is set up in an attractive manner.  Wooden themed. 

Nice drink assortment.  Almost too many choices. 

Good food. 

I would definitely come back again if I were in that neighborhood.
author: Joseph B.

description:
FOOD: 

Deviled egg with bacon jam - 4.5 stars - yum, this was bomb and hit the spot. 6 pieces for $7.

Crab tater tots - 4 stars - 3.5 stars - this was good too, though 6 tiny little pieces for $12 was a little pricey that I might not get it again. Yes, it is crab.. but still. Since the deviled eggs were better and cheaper, I'd go with that. 

DRINKS:

30 choices of beer! So if you love beer, come here. I took a sip of El Toro Poppy Jaspar Amber Ale and it was pretty good! Prices are only $6-7 too!

VIBE/ATMOSPHERE: 

I like it, nice, clean, chill bar atmosphere, very cool spot playing hip hop throwbacks like Mary J Blige. I like how it's located in Union Square too, great place to chill after shopping or pregame before clubbing. 

OVERALL:

Yes. I like and would come back again!
author: Raquel Y.

description: I like that there is actually a defined area to line up to buy drinks. The beer list is solid, and the snacks are good (if a little pricey- pretty normal pricing for SF). I also like that the space doesn't feel as cramped as many SF bars. I would go back! If I changed anything I would bias the beer list less toward IPA's but I realize that this is not the West Coast way.
author: Teresa M.

description: Only giving four stars because of the limited food menu and the order at the bar.  The beer selection is SOLID, and the I LOVE that the beer menu on the wall is ordered by goldens (ales), lagers, IPAs, and then darks (stouts).  I wish they had IBU listed as well as the ABV.  The service is EXCELLENT, and they are VERY GOOD about allowing you to taste anything.  The food was VERY TASTY.  We had the chicken tenders, the burger, the Hopp Salad, and the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich.  All were VERY GOOD.  Atmosphere is pleasant but LOUD with lots of room both upstairs and down.  If looking for a CRAFT BEER joint with food, this is a SOLID YES.  If looking for a FOODIE joint with craft beer, NOT for you.
author: David L.

description: Great bar with good beer selection.  We didn't eat but the menu looked great and everything going by looked delicious.  Really good layout to the restaurant, could have your own space and still see the tv and bar.  Order up at the bar but a nice line system so you're taken care of instead of trying to get the bartenders attention.  Definitely will be back
author: Margo B.

description:
Beer selection is great and order-at-the-register service is prompt, helpful and friendly.  The exposed brick interior with an upstairs gallery with wooden booths is charming. 

The reason for the 3 star rating is the food.  It was a disappointment, especially after reading so many rave reviews of their food.  The menu has apps, salads, sandwiches and cheese/charcuterie.  I had the fried chicken sandwich and fries, which the bartender said was so excellent he ate it everyday for a month straight when he started working there.  That's some high praise, so when it arrived with two thin, barely crispy 1/4 inch thick slices of chicken I was disheartened.  I got the impression the chicken was previously fried and then reheated when the sandwich was prepared.  The steak fries were hot, but only half of them were crisp and the other half were sad limp high school cafeteria steak fries that you eat because they're there, but you aren't happy about them.  

The chicken sando + fries were $13.  My friend ordered the pickle plate app, which was $6.  It had two bites of about 6 different pickled items.  The price point is fair, but the food is lackluster.  

I would go back just to drink beer!
author: Jamie B.

description:
Hopwater Distribution is a chill after work sort of bar - it's free seating and you go up to the cashier to place both your drink and food order. You get a number on a stand if you do order food. I asked the bartender for a beer recommendation: something refreshing. She chose the Calicraft pink panther, which was spot on for me. It was sweet but not cloying, and light enough for the summer.

As for food, I ordered the deviled eggs with bacon jam and chicken tenders. I was popping the deviled eggs into my mouth like candy, the savory creamy devils they were. The chicken tenders were actually really tender. It's kind of like an upper class nugget: two-bite sized but tender yet crisp with chives for garnish.

I definitely see myself coming back here with some friends or just for an enjoyable solo dinner.
author: Jin C.

description: Beer was good and the atmosphere was, too. The food was just okay - nothing to write home about. The tables we sat at were really REALLY sticky which grossed me out a bit. It was also really really hot which made me want to get out of there faster.
author: Ashley G.

description: Loved this place. Great environment, tasty snacks and good beer. The only disadvantage is you have to order everything at the bar. Other than that we were very happy with our experience here.
author: Julie D.

description:
They had pints of Old Rasputin Nitro on tap for $8, which was nice. And, the bartender - she was super nice. 

But, it wasn't my kind of place. I just moved around the corner, and I was hoping for a good neighborhood bar. But, maybe I live too close to the financial district? It wasn't what I was expecting. 

I went on a Tuesday night, and it was pretty busy. But; it was just filled with sales and marketing guys. Probably a few of them thought they were technology guys, but no; they were really just all sales and marketing guys. And; notice that I say 'guys' because I think 1% of the crowd was female. Not that that matters to me - just re-enforces my point that they were all sales guys.

Dim inside (ok),  beer menu (but nothing rare), loud, busy; faint 80s gangsta rap playing in the background (kinda cool, but weird???)

Clearly it was busy, and other reviewers seem to like it, though.
author: Aaron P.

description: So we needed a beer after hiking around the Golden Gate bridge, and this place was close to our hotel. Seemed a little dark and not many folks when we arrived.  Uh oh.  But wait, the beer selection was great (even for a non-IPA guy). The sandwiches we're good tasty serviceable food and we were the beginning of the rush. Super helpful bar staff.   Very limited choice for our new found friend who was a vegetarian from Israel, so maybe peruse the menu if food is a big deal.
author: Dan P.

description:
Great beer bar in Nob Hill! I was telling my boyfriend last night how I feel there are so many of these types of bars in SF now that the novelty has gone a little downhill for the city and that it's really hard to choose a favorite with the wide variety of beer on tap from various breweries. I don't really explore this area too often but I figured it's hard to compete with the ~30 or so beers they have!

What's a little annoying about this place is that the servers don't take any orders; they only deliver your food. All food and drink orders are at one register at the bar which is a little hectic considering the capacity and popularity this place gets on a weekend and having to wait in a line that one person is in charge of. And if you're sitting up top like we did, you will get some serious cardio in! Aside from that, the food, beer, service and layout of this place is awesome. Price ranges from $6-8 for a good glass of craft beer, small plates from $4-$12, and a good meals from $10-$18 which is very reasonable IMO. My boyfriend and I got a cozy two-person table upstairs and got to enjoy people watching from above while sipping on beers. I tried a very good sour and the Altamont Mango Crush Wheat Ale which was delicious! Lately I've been on a light and fruity beer craze so these have hit the spot! As for food, we shared their five pc bacon deviled eggs, five pc dungeness crab tator tots, their charcuterie board, and their Hopwater truffle ricotta. I definitely want to come back for a good burger or sandwich with fries! Beer isn't complete without some good fries!

Good spot for big and small parties and post-work happy hour. It can get a little loud here so maybe not too ideal for a first date. They also have TVs playing the most current sports game which is easily observed from upstairs, woohoo!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Reasonably priced great local beer. Lots of selection. Solid food too but limited menu. Must stop for beer lovers.
author: Benno A.

description: Great place with lots of choices for beer and really good food.  I will definitely be making this one of my regular stops when in the Bay Area.
author: Chris H.

description: All I have to say is the service was awful. We are from out of town and didn't know the protocol of ordering at the bar so we sat ourselves waiting to be served. Once we addressed the employee who by then passed our table at least three times came off very rude and threw the menus at us after we asked how to be served. It would be nice for the bar/restaurant to have a sign with instructions informing that you need to order from the bar especially for out of town guests. Luckily we knew better then to stay.
author: Marcia H.

description: Love the atmosphere and layout of this place.  There's plenty of seating and plenty more upstairs in the more private booths (though you're further from the bar).  I love that they have 30 taps here with some amazing beers.  They have some awesome food too, I got to try the crab tater tots, they were amazing!  Just be forewarned that you're only getting 5 tots.  They're a bit more sizable than your average tot, but some may feel cheated from that.  But I loved the crab inside it was fantastic.  This place is definitely a new favorite!
author: Bryson L.

description: I was staying at a hotel nearby and was looking for a good spot for a burger and local beer. I went in there with the intention of a burger. After consulting with the bartender, I went with the pork sandwich. It was delicious. Smoky bacon flavor, tangy sauce, great fries, and some great local brew highlighted by the Magnolia Blue Bell. I really wanted to get the crab tater tots, and that will have to wait for my next trip. Highly recommended.
author: Matthew R.

description: The girls at the bar were very helpful and friendly. Large selection of beer which were all great. We ordered a couple of appetizers that were delicious. Overall a great spot would definitely come back!
author: Rani Y.

description: Beer selection and staff both top-grade. We did have some issues with the food - found most of the dishes too salty - but would surely return & recommend to others for the beverages!
author: Kara G.

description:
This place is cool. I pass by it everyday; but never went inside until the other day. I lived in this neighborhood for a long time and I remember when this place used to be a market/key shop. They kept the old key sign out front. 

This place has an airy loft feeling to it. I like the brick walls and the old windows out front. There are seating upstairs too. 

The bar set-up is cool with numbers on the tap. They have a lot of beers to choose from. And the prices are reasonable. I didn't try any of the food this time based on a lot of other reviews, but I will give it a try next time. 

I definitely recommend this place if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Edie G.

description: Excellent place to meet up with my city dweller son and his girlfriend. Beer selection had something for everyone's palate. We had the crab tater tots that were ah-mazing, pork sliders and the buttermilk chicken sandwiches. Staff was super friendly and seating areas comfy. If you live in the area or are visiting from out of town..., a great spot to stop and have a beer and a few bites. Yummy!
author: Martha C.

description: Went here one night at a conference. Husband wasnt in town yet, so I ventured in on my own. The staff was very friendly, as was the local customer who I sat next to and struck up a conversation with. The beer was delicious and I appreciated that they only serve local California beer. I got the pork sandwich which was also really good. We are always looking for local brewpubs and this didnt disappoint.
author: Shannon B.

description: Great vibes, great beer, and great food at Hopwater. 30 beers on tap and really yummy burgers. Nice location close to hotels and music venues. Friendly wait staff.
author: Steve K.

description: We came here for a quick bite and drink before a show and liked it so much that we came back for more beers after! I got the fried chicken on top of a salad and it was so surprisingly delicious. The only drawback is that it was very hard to find a place to sit around dinner time on a Saturday.
author: Emily W.

description:
Hopwater made me question my notion that I'm "not a beer person."  The Almanac Imperial Stout was amazing!  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  Based on my description that "I don't like beer, I like scotch," he directed me to the perfect beer.

The meal was also perfect. You absolutely MUST have the Dungeness Crab Tater Tots - amazing.  It's more like crab croquette.  Definitely try with the California Chili Hot Sauce! I also had the Cod, which was perfect.  My friend had the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich and liked it, and we shared some delicious steak fries and pickled veggies.

I can't wait to come back!
author: Greg B.

description:
Heard good word of mouth for this craft beer bar from within the craft beer community and I made a point to check it out. It specializes in California craft beer and it's pretty spot on as a fun place to hang out with sports and atmosphere and some fun grub.

+ great atmosphere
+ good for watching local sports
+ good local selection
+ comfortable seating and layout
+ good service
+ pricing is good

- no bottles
- not really focused on outside CA beers

I really have no beef with this place. It doesn't do everything but I can't knock them for that, as they are forming their unique identity. If I am around the area, I'll definitely come back!
author: Jack T.

description:
A madhouse, but a well-oiled machine of a madhouse. 

Beer menu is huge and varied, but everything was very light and oddly basic. Nothing very rare and lots of "meh" breweries included.

The food menu looked incredible, but when I saw sandwiches going by, they were all on very small bread. Not terrible, I guess, if they taste good! I didn't get any food.
author: Julia D.

description:
I went to Hopwater with a group of ladies while we were in town for a conference.  We were lucky to snag a booth when we walked in, as the place got very busy while we were there.

We enjoyed a cheese plate, deviled eggs, chicken tenders, the pickle plate, and some sliders.  We also tried a variety of beers on tap.  The food was good - the pickle plate was the best - we actually ordered a second pickle plate when we finished our first.

It's a little chaotic there - all food and drinks are ordered at the bar with one checkout station - no table service.  At times, the line got very long, which made us decide not to order any more food.

However, great beer selection and a unique menu with lots of fun small bites to share - I would definitely go back!
author: Kathryn R.

description:
They have a wide selection of beer and although I should've ordered a drink, I opted for just the food.

Angus Sliders - a bit dry and bland
Coppa Salami - love coppa salami as it is not too salty and the mini crostinis are just as cute as they are delicious
Goat Cheese - the texture was more of a soft spread but I kind of wanted something firmer, still good in flavor 

Service was great.
author: Linda N.

description: Good spot to have a beer. So many beers written on the chalkboard in a dim lit environment so hard if you have a group . Tried a few different items off the menu very good. When I came in you had to find your own seat and order at the end of the bar. Menus are near the order area FYI. A little confusing at first but then you realize it's a cool spot #happyhourqueen
author: Kristina R.

description:
Great selection of beer, the bartender is knowledgable and good with making recommendations.  He gave us a few samples to ensure we got the beer we want before pouring it.  

Negative Aspects:
The (-0.5 star) is for no table service, and only bar service.
The place also did last call at 11pm on a Sunday. (-0.5 star)
No Wifi (disappointing).  

If you want a few good beers I would recommend going there, did not try any food so will refrain from commenting on it.
author: Bojan P.

description: Friendly staff and great beer selection however I'm fairly certain the tables were wiped down with a fermented rag. Stinks so bad!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Amazing brews on tap, with a fine selection of bar bites.  Hard to find selection.

PROTIP:  
Crab filled tater tots are a must.
author: David C.

description:
First of all the taste of the burger was great. The outcome was not. I sat up with my boyfriend the entire night as his body started to deconstruct. It started with an upset stomach to a full on 
breakdown. He was shaking, sweating, his stomach tossing and turning and nausea like I had never seen before. We tried Imodium, Pepto Bismol nothing could mute the hurricane he had headed his way. To put this nicely he was frequenting the bathroom every hour of the night. It is now 4pm the following day and he is still in a lot of pain. 

I advise people to come here for beer NOT food. Also, this is my first negative review on yelp, actually I hardly even review on yelp. I just feel really compelled to warn everyone so they do not go through the same hell my boyfriend went through. 

Lastly, I love supporting small business especially one in my neighborhood but since they do not have a number up online I could not warn management to do a quality check on the meat they serve. I hope you guys read this ASAP!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Came last evening for a beer. Very cool set up for their crafted beer. Totally forgot to take a picture. Didn't get a chance to try a lot of their brews or any of their food. A quick stop before dinner. It was packed already by the bar but was still able to get a drink pretty quickly. They spotted us which was awesome. I had their Faction - Pale Ale $7. It was smooth. It was cold. Just the way I like the beer. 

I like the layout. A lot of seating and tables. Two floors. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Sandy B.

description: Hopwater has everything you need if you're looking for great craft beer, a really cool place to hang out, and good food to boot. The sliders are very good and you can't go wrong with the appetizers. Wish they were open more often!
author: Chris B.

description:
AHH the age of the microbrewery has taken over and Hopwater Distribution should be your go-to spot for local cali beer. We arrived on a Thursday 30 minutes before a Warriors game, and despite it not being a sports bar the place was pretty packed. My wife and I were lucky to snag some bar seats. The restaurant offers about 30 local cali beers on tap. The menu provides a pretty good description of taste and the bar tenders are very knowledgeable about providing suggestions as well in case you get stuck.

I started with the Blitzen, a high content, triple IPA. The beer was delicious, plus it was 10% alcohol. As our buzz set in, we  took a gander at their food menu. The buttermilk chicken sandwich caught my eye. While waiting for the food to arrive, I ordered the Hella Hoppy, a 9% double IPA. I guess I was watching my IPA count...

The food arrived shortly thereafter, and I was very happy with my chicken sandwich. The deep-fried buttermilk chicken was served on fresh sourdough baguette topped with slaw, mozzarella and chimichurri. I wasn't too sure how the chimichurri would work with the fried chicken, but I was happily surprised that it did. The sandwich came with thick cut steak fries which were good, but could have used a few more seconds in the frier to get more crispy. 

My wife ordered the veggie sandwich and was loving it until she found a black curly hair on her plate. She showed the bartender who was overly apologetic and immediately removed it from our bill. She then went above-and-beyond and offered another round of beers on them. A very nice showing of customer service. Ultimately, I really enjoyed my time at Hopwater.
author: Josh K.

description:
Nice beer selection. Terrific service. Mary and the gentleman working the bar (sorry forgot the name!) were so helpful and friendly. Enjoyable experience with both food and drink. Will definitely be back next time I'm in San Francisco.

[Edit] wish I could give 6 stars! Owner (John) was terrific. Wonderful experience. The people that frequent this place are just as nice as the employees. Bright spot in my day.
author: Kevin A.

description:
Hopwater Distribution is full of awesome food, a laid back vibe and a stellar beer selection.

We came as a group and while it was initially packed in here, a table magically opened up from some nice guys who saw us waiting. We had already grabbed some delicious beers, including an alternative Anchor Steam that was really memorable, and settled in for a nice, huge meal.

At a place like this, I feel like a burger can serve as a solid measurement for the rest of the menu. I split a burger with someone and also tried the fried chicken sandwich 
(Spicy Slaw, Fresh Mozzarella, Chimichurri on a Torpedo Roll w/Steak Fries). Both were really good, although I give a slight nod to the fried chicken sandwich.

While the entrees were awesome, I think the apps stole the show. Those deviled eggs with bacon jam could've been my whole meal, they were so flavorful. We also had the dungeness tater tots, essentially a crab cake tater tot. Oh man. So rich but so so good.

This is a great spot and the service is on point.
author: Adam S.

description:
This place is one of the rare places that I will visit more than once on a trip to SF (City Beer Store being another, quite different from this place too; normally I try something different every day)  excellent selection of beers, especially CA local. The food was between good snd great. The service is laid back, knowledgeable of what's on tap  (and beer in general), the place fills up and has a good vibe without being too crowded. 

If I were a local, I'd post up here regularly.
author: Aaron B.

description: Cool little spot to check out if you're a fan of craft beer, they have 20 drafts, all seemed good, I was only able to stay for two but I enjoyed both of them, not a whole lot in terms of food, so don't go there too hungry, but I got the deviled eggs which were good, and had fish on top, and my friend got the pork sliders, I had one which was fine, if I'm ever back in SF I would stop here again, free help yourself water, chairs are hardwood but whatevs, a TV in back for sports events, also no hard liquor FYI
author: Daniel S.

description: This is my go-to spot in my hood. The beer menu is stellar and always rotates. Sliders and deviled eggs are yummy. Perfect spot for a date, to watch a game, or have a solo meal.
author: Kim O.

description:
Let's start with the 30 craft beers on tap.  They come out cold and there's a beer for every taste.  I love IPAs and they have three great ones.  Local - Duboce Park IPA, Sonoma Springs Subliminal Gold IPA, and Faction Winter IPA.  

Their food menu is a little limited, but it does have a nice variety.  I'm having a burger and fries which are both amazing.  I'm at the bar and folks are around me enjoying other items as well.  

There are two people pouring beers.  They are friendly and knowledgeable about what's on tap.  

There is some music playing but it's hard to hear because the 40 to 50 people here are all talking.  

All in all a great place in San Francisco to visit when you're looking to enjoy some great food and craft beers, along with great service.
author: Dennis A.

description: Awesome food and drinks! I ordered the portobello mushroom burger with all the veggies and was very impressed. Atmosphere is fun and relaxing. The front of the building is loud with people having a great time, but we found a quiet table in the back where we prefer.
author: Julie D.

description:
I'm not gonna lie, I'm just not into beer. 

You could offer me the most robustly flavored brewski you have on tap or even one with the highest alcohol content, it just does not excite me. Yeah, call me names, but that's my story and I'm sticking to it. 

Beer geeks will certainly be enthused with their rotating selections of California brews. From pale ales, pilsners and more, go ahead and admire the considerable selection of golden taps on the wall. Order at the counter and the staff will help even the most indecisive of drinkers.  

I had a Fort Point Kolsh, only 4.5% alcohol and crisp. This might be the most boring thing on the menu and almost tastes like water. But it didn't leave me with a bloated feeling like what beer usually does to me. 

The pub style food is outstanding! From the cheese and salumi selection (Marin French truffle brie, Zoe's ghost pepper salami) the Deviled eggs topped with bacon jam and Dungeness crab. We also tried the addicting steak fries and crunchy fried chicken tenders with mango-chipotle sauce. YUM!

I'll pass on the beer but I'll definitely be back for the food. That's no lie.
author: Janice C.

description: I only hesitate to give Hopwater 5 stars because I want to keep it to myself. Unfortunately, it's too good of a place to keep as a secret. The food is great. The beer is extensive and flavorful. And the service is just amazing. We've always had a blast here and recommend a quick drink or bite to eat. Have fun.
author: Nick C.

description: Cool little spot. Awesome selection of beers.  I had a delicious IPA. I think they may need to clean the lines running from the kegs. Service was fast and good but not personable. I was in and out so not much else to add.
author: J W.

description:
Hop, hop, hop on over to Hopwater Distribution because you won't regret it.
