- 31 beers from California on tap (get frequently changed for variety). The beer gods have spoken, and we are lovin' it!
- Bar seating where you can admire the beer board and all the taps. Whew, what a beauty.
- Small bar bites (~$4) and real meals (~$7-$17). The burger was so juicy! Heard their sandwiches are very popular so I'm going to go back and try it for myself.

Order your beer and food at the bar. Grab your beer and find a seat. A server will bring your food over when it's ready. Seating is first come first serve, so use your hawk eyes to scout out open seating/tables!
author: Christine S.

description: Alright so I got the chicken sandwich tonight and had an awesome cider to be totally honest with you I felt like two incredibly hot people were having sex in my mouth. Best night ever!
author: Michelle K.

description: Stop! Whatever you've read about this place....... is absolutely true. Great beer selection, even sour beers if you're  into them (if you're not try one). The Dungeness crab tots rock. Lots of crab inside and the bacon jam deviled eggs are scrumptious! Friendly people in the front and back of the bar!  It's now a regular for me
author: Eric D.

description: The reason for a loss of star has to do with the lack of improvement in the quality of the beer offerings.  I'm a taste first kind of guy, but nothing really wows me here.  Furthermore, if you check their beers versus well respected apps for those who love craft brews (I am one) you will see what I mean.  A dollar more for a beer that's rated higher is worth it.  Unless you have some rare stuff... which this place doesn't.
author: Buddy G.

description: One of my go-to spots in nob hill. Some of their portions are minuscule (ex: tots) and should almost come with a warning that you need 5 orders to equal one normal one, but the options for drinks are too strong not to give this 5 stars.
author: Alice M.

description:
Great place to grab drinks!
Plenty of beer options, some wine options, and great service!
Their snacks are delicious as well - definitely get their deviled eggs!

Crowded on a weekday afternoon/early evening, but not too difficult to find an open spot.

Will be back
author: Michelle L.

description:
I came here on Sunday night around 9pm and easily grabbed a table by the bar for my friends and I. You have to order at the bar and they give you a number to set down on your table. Since I am not a big fan of beer, my review is based mainly on their food. However, I did order a glass of Two Rivers Raspberry Cider, since it seemed to be the least likely to be "beer-like." I made a good choice because the cider was very light and fruity. 

For dinner, I had the Soup of the Day (cauliflower and beer cheese) and Angus Ground Chuck Burger. I also got to try their Onion Dip, Dungeness Tater Tots, and an Angus Ground Chuck Slider. 

Cauliflower & Beer Cheese Soup: HARD PASS. When the waitress brought it out, the bowl it was in was hotter than the soup itself. The soup was disgusting and tasted like they used bleu cheese to make it. I took one sip and didn't touch it again for the rest of the meal. 

Onion Dip: Meh. The dip came with homemade potato chips. The waitress let us know that if we ran out of chips we could always flag her down for more. The dip itself wasn't spectacular and I would probably would pass. 

Tater Tots: very strange. The tots were made of real crab and potatoes. I would definitely pass because the flavors did not go well together for any of my friends or me. 

Burger & Slider: Meh. The burger was too oily for me and the steak fries that came with it were too salty. The slider tasted better only because of the house yellow pepper catsup that came with it. 

The food here was mediocre. I wouldn't come here again unless my friends wanted to just drink beer and hang out.
author: Melanie H.

description:
Do you love beer?! Welcome to the land of golden taps and never-ending beers! All kidding aside, I have to admit, I'm not the hugest beer drinker. In fact, I feel a little lost when I come to places like this, but I'm learning.

Drinks:
*Pine street - black bay milk stout 5% ($7 for 16oz)
*Fort point/De struis - st francis 12 belgian quad 10.5% ($5 for 5oz)
*Fort point - ksa kolsh 4.6% ($6 for 16oz)
*Cismonte - dead santa golden strong 8.5% ($6 for 10oz)
*North coast - rasputin's imperial stout 9% ($7 for 16oz)
*Stone - lucky bastard american strong ale 8.5% ($6 for 10oz)
*Marin - crazy uncle grant's wild rice pale ale ?% ($6 for 10oz)

So how did I choose what to order when I know nothing about beer?! Basically by name or alcohol percentage. It seemed to serve me well as I don't really like light beers.

Food:
*Local cheese: Marin french truffle brie ($4)
*Five dungeness crab tater tots ($12)
*Five deviled eggs with bacon jam ($7)
*Local salumi: Hobb's rustica soppressata hot ($4), Zoe's ghost pepper salami ($4), Zoe's salami de cacao ($4)
*Five deviled eggs with crab louis ($10)
*Buttermilk fried chicken tenders: with mango chipotle sauce ($8)
*Three angus ground chuck/brisket sliders with yellow pepper catsup ($12)
*Steak fries ($5)
*Cold duck duo: rillettes & liver mousse with accoutrements ($9)

Of course, you need snacks when drinking! My favorite dish was actually the crab tater tots. They were more like crab cakes. Very tasty. Of course, you can never go wrong with a nice salumi or cheese, so those were great as well.

The bar closes at 11pm on Wednesdays, so they make sure to get everyone out of there by that time. Get ready for the lights to turn on and people yelling at you to finish your beers and close your tabs.

If I was more of a beer drinker, I'd probably want to come back. But I think for me, once is enough. I had a great time, so if you love beer, you should definitely check Hopwater out.
author: Elena N.

description: Cant say enough about Hopwater. This is one of my favorite bars in Northern California. Speaking of Northern California... they have a plethora of beers taps, focusing on Northern California breweries. My favorite is Oaktown brown ale by Calicraft Brewing Co in Walnut Creek. The best part of Hopwater is the awesome staff. Attentive, fun and great personalities.
author: Zac T.

description: Though one of the best places for beer, this place has never boasted great food. However, what used to be decent food at the last visit was downright terrible. The burger was overcooked and the tater tots and fries oozed oil. The fries were actually soggy. The rating would have been a five star but for the food. Coming back but only after having eaten elsewhere.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Good beer and good food! 

There's so many beer options! You'll find something you like no matter your beer tastes. 

For food, I keep ordering the fish and chips. I'm a big fan of this solid dish. I've taken a few friends here on separate ocassions, and they all seem to like their dishes.
author: Lainey D.

description: Celebrating the last night of the best bartender in town! Great food, great beer. This place is a must in the tourist center for the non tourist.
author: Brian W.

description:
Great place to go and chill with friends! It's pretty busy during the weekends but I went with a big group and it was fairly easy to find a place to sit down and enjoy a conversation.

The service was great! Everybody was diligent, friendly and fast. We ordered some burger slides, some fries, and some chicken tenders and everything got delivered quite fast. I really enjoyed the apple sauce thing that came with the tenders, delicious!

And for the good part: they have a LOT of different beers on tap. I love my porters and stouts and had a chance to try three different ones over there. The Almanic ones are pretty strong and heavy on the alcohol content but never the less they were really tasty.

Would definitely recommend. Cheers!
author: Paola S.

description:
Drank: Multiple different beers:
Ate 1: Chacuterie plate on one visit
Ate 2: Jalapeno salami on different visit

Beers - 5 stars for selection & quality.
Food - Really weak charcuterie plate & terrible salami. 2.5 stars. Meat quality was poor on both, the salami in particular was razor thin and would be beaten by packaged supermarket run of the mill salami, hands down. 

Will definitely be back -- but for beers only!
author: David J.

description:
I guess the allure of this place is just lost on me. The bartenders are super nice but the whole vibe of the place is nothing unique or special. They have a good variety of beers and food ranging from salads to sliders and from cheese to deviled eggs. There is no table service and it's hard to get a table sometimes. I guess I just think there are better places out there... Not bad if you want to grab a beer but very loud and hard for small groups or first dates to hear each other over the noise. 

Average spot- I doubt I will go out of my way to return. Sorry fans!
author: Jess D.

description:
Came here on a Monday after work and it was actually pretty filled, which to me was a good sign that this place is so good that people will come during the week....and it is.

First of all, they've got 30 beers on tap at a time which is awesome. They had a wide variety and selection as well, which meant everyone could get something they wanted. They do have food, but the menu is limited to bar foods like sliders, chicken wings, sandwiches, and burgers. You order food and beer at the counter and it gets delivered to you pretty quickly.

Overall I'd say come here for the beer and relaxed atmosphere, have a bite to eat, and stay for another beer. Definitely a local gem!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Excellent food in unsuspecting location!  Place is not well advertised with street or store front sign, but find it and you won't be disappointed!  Not fancy, bar style, but all ataff friendly.  I had Roasted Hef'n Rock Cod - cod with dark kale and beans, onions and seasonings.  So tasty!  Husband had pulled pork sandwich and fries - steak fries perfectly crisp and tender, and pork well seasoned with interesting spices and thinly sliced pickled cucumbers.  Loved food, no wait, and nice selection of beer and wine.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Stumbled across Hopwater Distribution on Yelp when I was looking for a place to meet up with friends in the city for a bite to eat and a good drink. The reviews were decent so I gave it a shot. Met up with a friend from high school who was visiting SF from Ohio and brought some local friends too! 

The decor and vibe of Hopwater was great - we found a table near the back and sat to drink and talk. I ordered a blonde beer (they have a wonderful selection of beers on tap) and it was smooth and tasty. 

For a bite to eat, we ordered the chicken tenders, chicken sandwich, and crab tater tots. The tenders were good but small. The crab tater tots reminded me more of crab cakes but were moist and tasty. I didn't eat the chicken sandwich (my friends had ordered it) but heard it was really good. All in all, for the price and location, Hopwater Distribution is a cool spot!
author: Courtney P.

description:
What a perfect place 
30 beer on tap!!! Food was fantastic 
Sliders and fries so gooooood
Burgers were heaven sent ! 
Fries were so good !
author: Linda R.

description: Great selection and loved the atmosphere. Would definitely recommend! I liked that it felt very local. Service at the bar was quick and friendly.
author: Danielle M.

description:
Great spot in the FiDi. Came here with a friend for dinner last week and it was just what we had hoped for. 

I started off with the cider, which was really good! Not too sweet. There is a great beer list here, which is constantly rotating, I believe. 

We ordered the deviled eggs and burger sliders to share & it was perfection. So delicious and just the right amount (considering we had eaten a little bit beforehand). Will definitely be back!
author: Ilana B.

description:
I had the fried chicken sandwich at the recommendation of the cashier. It was just OK. 

The beer on the other hand, was great. And prices for both food and drink were very reasonable. If they could make better food, then this would be a 4 or 5 star review.

I plan on going back and ordering other things on the food menu. Will update my score accordingly when the time comes.
author: Alex P.

description:
The beer selection is good and the bar staff is friendly and offered tastings. Which was great.
The Cod sandwich is very flavorful. The place has a nice vibe to it. The only downside was a bad smell which seemed to be wafting into the bar every now and then.
author: Rikesh C.

description:
Hopwater Distribution feels like home. Everyone is so friendly! The bartenders greeted me and my friend when we walked in, and even when we took a seat at the tables in the very back, one of the waiters came out of the kitchen to make us feel welcome. Now THAT is service. There is plenty of seating and standing room, but this place gets busy super fast. We came here on a Friday at 5:30PM and had the choice of sitting upstairs or in the back. The bar seating fills up first, and the back area is good for groups.

You can order food and drinks at the bar. I'm not sure why everyone forms a line in front of the cashier because another bartender can just ring you up from the other end... so remember this pro tip. Hopwater has an extensive selection of food and beer on their menu. We snacked on the tasty Steak Fries and used the fancy salt and pepper grinders at the table for seasoning. The beer is great, the atmosphere is great, and just the whole experience will definitely be one for the books!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Great bar, great setup, good food. Tons of micro and nano-brews sure to bristle the beards of even the most discerning beer nerds. It felt very chill (albeit on a Sunday night). You want new sours, unique IPAs, simple and crisp lagers? They got 'em. Burger and buttermilk fried chicken sandwich are legit, and plenty of smaller gastro bar bites to keep you sated. Definitely a place to hunker down with friends for a few hours.
author: Yan T.

description:
I really wanted to love the place but I had such mixed feelings about the food here, which kinda drag that rating down.

The ambiance and the place itself was beautiful and a wonderful hang out spot for groups.  We celebrated my bf's birthday here and we had a good 10 or more people so we got here early and sorta took over the back room. But it was that chill. No one cared and it was feel good fun with their so many beer on tap and their food you have to go to the bar to order and one waitress brings the plates to you.

Okay so the food, we ordered the duck three ways, crab "tater tots", burger and crab salad. My friend order the deviled eggs with bacon and some other stuff, i don't really recall.  

Let's start with the apps. So the duck three ways was amazing! i wanted to lick the plate! Lol the only downfall is that one of our friends came later and order the duck three ways and our plates did not look the same.  They added extra stuff to his plate which kinda threw us off and was disappointing.. The crab tots are not tater tots, hence the quotes i put prior when i was listing the food.  it was good but not a lot of crab and we were REALLY expecting tater tots. They really are just croquettes. The deviled eggs, I would recommend. It was pretty good.

Now the main course.  The bf had the burger, which i asked for medium rare and it came out beyond well. It was really dry, which was disappointing because the seasoning of the burger was really good, but for us to keep eating the burger, we had to keep adding ketchup to get us through how dry it was.  The crab salad, for $17 (i think, might have been slightly more or less) was a completely rip off and definitely did not look like what a few people have posted in the pictures. It was such a huge let down. It was greens with some salty crab meat and sauce, that I can recall... the only thing good about it was the dressing, the dressing was pretty amazing. But like I said, huge let down.

Prob will give this place another shot but not anytime soon.
author: Hepsie C.

description: Excellent selection of 30 beers on tap. Convenient location. Seating areas on the main floor and mezzanine. Fills up quickly so arrive early.  Tasty appetizer menu with some dinner entrees too. Very friendly staff with great service even when busy.
author: F T.

description: Great spot with a large variety of beers on tap and some good food as well. Came in here for happy hour and would definitely come back.
author: Matthew M.

description: Excellent spot, friendly staff and a decent beer selection. Didn't try their food but people seem to enjoy theirs.
author: Lo F.

description:
I love it when a prediction of mine proves correct.  In this case, once upon a time back in the day, I used to walk by this spot when it was an abandoned store-front on Bush.  It sat empty for years, and on my daily walk to the office I thought to myself:  This would make a great restaurant or bar.  Flashing forward, I don't come this way as much - so I was surprised to see that someone finally made my day-dream a reality.  Boy, did they nail it.  

31 artisan beers on tap.  All California brews - many of which I've never seen on tap anywhere.  AMAZING range of options to try.  Super knowledgeable bartenders - the service was excellent.  These things add up to a great combination.  I am a big beer fan.  I tried three brews when I was in on the recommendation of the bartender.  Every one of them was off the charts.   I understand that they are constantly rotating the selections, so you won't run out of things to try.  For what it's worth, the $6-8 price-point for pints was reasonable enough given the quality of the selections. 

It's a terrific vibe here.  The space was done really well - very open, high ceilings.  It's a pretty large bar with a number of bar-tops on the ground-level and small tables around an open loft-level.  There is also a dining room in back with table service.  They have a nice little menu - I didn't get a chance to try anything yet, but it looks pretty tasty.

I'll be back!
author: Adam S.

description:
Please take this review with a grain of salt as we did not order any beer. 

Nice atmosphere for a beer after work or happy hour although they do not have a happy hour menu. 
There is upstairs seating for a little more privacy, but a nice friend interactive area downstairs more like a bar. 

A bit overpriced given the portion size.

We tried the deviled eggs, crab tater tots, and sliders which were all not bad however not great or amazing....
author: Tatiana T.

description:
Just to be clear, there is no doubt that the star of Hopwater, and the real reason to visit, is the bar with the 30 all-Californian beers on tap. Anything from good ole' familiar local boy Anchor to more niche in-state players. You're bound to find something you like and it'll be like drinking your way through the Golden State without ever leaving your seat. 

There are drawbacks though. The ordering process is a little confusing when you first walk in especially if it's crowded but basically you order at one end of the bar and you get a number for your food and your brews right away. We didn't find menus at first and went around the bar ourselves to get them. Think it would be more efficient maybe to split the food and beer ordering. Speaking of food, it's acceptable bar food here. Nothing to exceptionally rave about but they complement the brews well. I accompanied my Sticky Zipper American IPA with their burger and it was executed well as ordered. Relatively juicy and paired with tomatoes and arugula, which I love, and served with a hearty order of steak fries. The fried chicken sandwich, which sounded so good on the menu, turned out to be a little wet and messy which nullifies any fried action on the chicken. 

Still, if you like beers, and Californian beers in particular, you should come here. The staff are friendly and the mixed crowd gives off a relaxed vibe. Can't wait to take my next brewery road trip just by sitting at the bar next time I'm back.
author: Jon L.

description: Decor and ambiance is awesome.  Patrons and bartenders great.  Impressive beer collection, decent wine selection (just wish there were more).  The food is unfortunately lacking.  Had the steak fries - which looked NOTHING like the pictures posted on Yelp.  TBH, it looked like decades old Costco - freezer burn variety.  Sorry just keeping it real.  And the chicken tenders were way overcooked.  So in short if you want to drink at a clean hipster establishment and LOVE beer, come on by.  If you want to eat as well, I might maybe skip.
author: Ann S.

description:
Why 5 stars? Because the beer selection is my favorite that I've seen in SF.

   ---   ---   --

It's not that Hopwater has the MOST beers on tap in SF, but they aren't overrun with IPA's - at least not during my visit. 

It's frustrating to try and find a good beer bar on the west coast, as IPA's seem to rule that entire region. But some of us think IPA's taste like throwing a bunch of grass in a blender. And if you're like me - you'll love Hopwater Distribution.

During my visit, there was a great selection of Belgians, Fruit Beers, Hefeweizens, and even a hard root beer. All awesomeness.

As for the food, the chicken sandwich was solid. Anytime you add chimichurri to something, I'm sold. 

Hopwater actually wasn't our original choice for dinner, but I'm glad we ended up there!
author: Brett N.

description: They have a great selection of CA craft beer and a friendly staff that knows the beers well.
author: Brian R.

description: I love this place, the beer selection is amazing. I love that it's all micro brews. It's a very classy and basic setting. I love the upstairs view over looking. It can get a little crowded here. The food is also pretty good here. It's kinda a hidden gem.
author: Krista R.

description: Visiting San Fran and found this very unique bar. Service was top notch. The signage was very cool. Had to pose for a photo!
author: Leslee M.

description:
I stopped in with some friends at about 7pm on a Thursday. The place was packed, with no tables available, although there were a few bar seats scattered about. There are dozens of beers on tap, which is always a good sign. The food menu looked interesting, but since we were unable to grab a table, we ended up leaving for another restaurant.

Overall, a great place to grab a few beers, although if you want some food, it'll be a challenge to get a table for more than 2 people during the busy hours.
author: Ho L.

description: Love this place. Great food, great beers and close to Masonic if you want to grab some food before/after a concert.
author: Dave F.

description: YUM and YUM. Came where last night as we were yelping beer bars. This came up and we decided to go. It's a super cool place. Ambiance is really cool and rustic. They have an amazing selection of beers (although I haven't tried any of them, they just look amazing lol) we ordered the fried chicken sandwich, crab cake Rita, arugula, beef sliders and some pickle stuff which I did not enjoy ( I done pickled pickles or whatever it was haha) everything we ordered was really good! It was nice to be able to split all the food and share it.
author: Nessa H.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite pubs to grab beer and food in the city. Only because they have not 10 but 31 beers on tab! They also have an awesome selection of appetizers thats meant to be shared. 

I think the highlight dish for me here is the Crab Tater Tots. I'm on a tots binge lately it seems... The chicken tenders, the pulled pork sliders, and the deviled eggs are also great here. 

Seats are first come first serve style. Usually you order at the bar, you get a number, and a server will deliver it to you. I like their upstairs seating, its a nice little space to catch up with friends without feeling too close to the bar.
author: Kathy L.

description: I definitely enjoy grabbing a round, or two, at Hopwater! There's always a good variety of beers on tap, bottled beers, craft beers etc. The most "reliable" meal (for me anyway) is the burger and fries. For the price, I'd like it if the burger was a couple ounces bigger and if there were a few more fries. That being said, the flavor of the burger is fantastic! The steak fries which accompany the burger, some of the best I've had in the city. I whole-heartedly recommend visiting Hopwater and will continue to do so myself.
author: Peter C.

description:
Hopwater Distribution is an awesome destination for beer lovers.

With exposed brick walls and high ceilings, the atmosphere is relaxed. The long copper topped bar offers a nice old school touch. Of course, there are the requisite number of TVs, so sports fan can catch multiple games at once. The best seats in the house are either at the bar or the upstairs booths by the windows, but be warned:  this place can get pretty crowded at times.

With at least 30 beers on tap Topwater Distribution focuses mainly on California craft brews, but there are a few Belgians thrown in as well. From Santos saison (7%, $7 for 16 oz.) to 
North Coast Old Rasputin Russian imperial Stout on nitro (9%, $7 for 16 oz.), there is a beer choice for everyone. 

But wait, Topwater is not just a beer joint:  there's food too.  And it's pretty good. The deviled eggs with bacon jam (6 pieces for $7) are awesome. Crispy on the outside, most and tender the inside, the crab tater tots (6 for $10) are a must-try. With a dallop of fresh ricotta and a sprinkling of toasted sunflower seeds, the stone fruit and arugula salad was refreshing and delicious.

Service is friendly and prompt. Bartenders know their beers and can make good recommendations.

If you are near Union Square and even slightly thirsty, Topwater Distribution should be your destination.
author: CJ G.

description: This place wasn't too crazy on a Thursday night. We were able to get a table upstairs. The ambiance was nice- a hip spot to catch up with friends or go on a date. A little loud, but not horrible. The food was just OK unfortunately- we had the chicken tenders ($8) and burger ($12) that did the job but were nothing special. The beer selection looked good and was lined up really prettily on taps along the bar tenders back wall.
author: Ella C.

description: I base this solely on their outstanding beer selection,  friendly service,  and a cool and comfortable atmosphere. Food looked and smelled good, but my one track mind was firmly planted on those tasty beverages. Yay beer!!
author: Caddy M.

description: Very helpful with letting you sample different beers. Modern interior, and great background noise isn't so loud that you can't hear your conversation.
author: Julianne V.

description:
I had an awesome burger for a very good price. The beer was tasty as well. It is possible to eat there, or to just have a beer. A wide selection of beers is available. 

The bar has a good atmosphere, I can definitely recommend spending your evening there. 

Service was quick and friendly.
author: Janwillem S.

description: Love this place.  Great beer selection and the employees I've spoken with are extremely helpful with knowing what they are serving and what to recommend and are extremely patient and friendly.  There's also a great variety of food, whether bar snack or dinner, to choose from.  Overall a great find close by to work.  I agree that it can be on the pricier side, but nothing wrong with that.
author: Maggie A.

description:
I literally walked uphill in the snow 5 miles to get to this place all for the Brie. Ok so not snow, but the hills were there. 

I had an amber that the bartender recommend and it was wonderful. Smooth, light, and refreshing. There are plenty of beers on tap for all. I sat at the bar, it was fairly crowded for a Thursday evening at 7:00. That's always a good sign. There is more seating towards the back, that's great for larger groups. You order at the bar and a server brings your food. 

Then I got what I wanted-the truffle Brie with toasted bread. I'll be honest it was the strangest yet greatest thing I have ever eaten. Tangy but creamy light yet full. I can't really describe it, but it was good!! Just get it if you love Brie. 

The Dungeness Crab tator tots were really just a fancy version of mini crab cakes, but again delish. Crispy on the outside and full of rich crab on the inside. The remoulade sauce on top was a great addition. Not too overpowering but gave it a bit of a mayonnaise kick. 

I climbed the hill again and I went back a second time.
author: Leslie D.

description: Every time I go here I have a great time! It's always lively and the food is delicious. They have about 30 beers to choose from and rotate pretty regularly. There's a good mix of local and non local beers which is great since I have a difficult time finding non-local craft beers. The chicken sandwich is my favorite!
author: angela l.

description:
Lots of beer on tap and friendly bartenders. Two floors with bar and table seating with high ceilings and rustic atmosphere.

We tried: Dungeness Tater Tots, Deviled Eggs, Three House Blend Angus Sliders and the Pulled Pork Sliders. Even though the sliders come in 3s, the kitchen staff was nice enough to give our table 4s to make it easier to share. The food really didn't stand out- I thought the sliders were pretty dry and lacking something that I can't quite pinpoint. The tater tots and the deviled eggs were great bites. 

Beer selection is good and there's a lot of variety with food. Great place to unwind.
author: Angie K.

description: Nice vibe, a little loud. Fantastic bartender who helped me pick a really nice local beer out of their great selection of local options -- would have given it 5 stars if I'd only come for a drink. However, I ordered the cod entree, but the fish was so salty that I (a very hungry  person) couldn't eat it. There are no actual servers here (seat yourself with a number) so I gave the feedback to a food runner when he was walking by, but he just took my plate, stared at me, and walked away without a word. Bummer.
author: lesli k.

description: Unsure why I'm not compelled to give 5 stars as i have no real complaints. Good beer, decent bar grub, quick and friendly bartenders. Had plenty of seating on a Saturday night at 10pm.
author: Alex M.

description: Solid beer selection. Food was tasty but it didn't excite me. Expected more from the chicken sandwich. Good atmosphere :)
author: Daniel N.

description: This is one of my favorite local pitstops to hang out or have dinner/happy hour. It's also the only place nearby that has such a great beer selection. Great neighborhood beer and bites selection. I never know what I'll get when I walk in, sometimes it's a local IPA, or the fried chicken sandwhich, the deviled eggs, or a hearty stout. The place doesn't have music, so if that's your thing you won't find it here, but there are TVs for spectating and lots of community and small tables. The staff is great too - helpful to answer questions and not pretentious at all. Definitely a great stop for anyone looking to have a great craft beer and snack!
author: Rachael O.

description: Nice neighborhood pub with a great beer selection. I also recommend the delicious fried chicken sandwich.
author: Joe Y.

description: Cool spot for drinks and food! They have over 30 beers on tap and food was really good! Loved the chicken strips, cheese boards and the lentil bowl! Cool spot where you serve yourself!
author: Meghan W.

description:
This is an awesome microbrewery to try out after work for happy hour (but no happy hour prices). They have 30 beers on tap and a great selection that they rotate frequently! The location is spacious with booths, tables, and an upstairs area. There's no waiter service so you just order at the bar. 

I ordered the Triple Voodoo and my bestie ordered the Berryessa. They're both light, refreshing and girly, perfect for us! They have a small menu of food items which is great! Sometimes, I don't want to be overwhelmed with tons of choices because I don't want to use my brain anymore afterwork. The food here is very good and goes well with a nice glass of beer. There are cheeses, meats, bar bites, salads and burgers, easy selections! We ordered the 5 deviled eggs with crab louie to share which was delicious and beautifully presented. I also had a roasted golden beet & wild arugula salad with goat cheese and pomegranate seeds. Loved it! They are generous with their cheese portions because my salad came with 2 large chunks of cheese the size that comes in with a cheese plate. So good!

This would be a place I would definitely come back to for a beer or two after work. My only complaint is that the cashier/bar staff that day wasn't very friendly. Maybe she was having a bad day.
author: Janny S.

description:
My boyfriend is a big beer fan. So, I figured we had to stop here based on all the reviews and boy, was I right. He was so happy with the place.

Another location in SF where you order at the bar then they give you a number to bring back with you to leave at your table. 

The front part of the bar was completely packed but we were able to find a table in the back. By the time we were leaving, the place had completely emptied out (near 11 pm on a Saturday, which is weird since in NYC things are just beginning to fill up around that time). 

Tried the deviled eggs with crab, which were pretty good. Not as great as people made it out to be. 

My bf ordered the drinks and food and said the bartender was super friendly and nice. Though originally they screwed up our order of deviled eggs and had put in something else. But she quickly remedied it, no biggie.

I ordered the Golden State Cider, which was amazing. If they have it and you're a cider fan, definitely order it. It's like water and super refreshing but it hits you after you down two because again, it's that refreshing.

We'd definitely return if we're ever in town again.
author: Janice L.

description:
AMAZING! 

My boyfriend and I live in Oakland, but took a day trip to the city and were fortunate enough to stumble upon this place. Fantastic selection of beers on tap! And the lovely beertenders were so helpful, kind and attentive. 

We had a couple beers, but to be honest the best part was the pickled cauliflower. Like, OMG. How do you even make it that good? Is there crack in it? I wouldn't care if there was! Bring on the buckets of crack- laden pickled cauliflower! We also got some cheese, (okay we ordered every cheese they had on the menu) RIP that chunk of delicious Humboldt Fog in my stomach. 

The decor and ambiance were perfection. I gazed upon their tap wall with envy. I've worked at beer bars the past 4 years and have only dreamt of something so elegant yet industrial and handsome. 

Anyway, you should definitely check this place out. I know I'm glad I did!
author: Macy G.

description: Solid bar. Great draft selection and great aesthetic. Perfect place to catch up with friends, and grab a quick bite.
author: Lena N.

description:
They have 25 beers on tap, all from California breweries. The don't serve any beer in bottles. The beer selection is excellent though.

I had the chicken sando, and the soup of the day, a New England clam chowder. The food was good and was just the thing I needed to fill the hole in my belly while I quaffed one of the excellent draught beers.
author: Steve N.

description: In town for a conference and wanted to check out the local brews and restaurants. This place opens at 5pm daily. Upon arriving this place had 28 beers on tap and about 10 food items on the menu. Everything is ordered at the bar. Great selection of IPAs, pale ales, stouts, summer, etc. The staff was very personable and also educational about the different beers. We had the crab tator tots, and the buttermilk fried chicken tenders for an appetizer. Both items were delicious, flavorful and fried to perfection. For our main dishes we had the angus burger, cobb salad with buttermilk fried chicken strips and Dungeness crab salad. The best out of the three was the Cobb Salad!!!! Expect to spend between $6 to $7 per beer and the appetizers were between $10 -$12 and the entrees were about $15. Definitely would recommend and I'll probably go back again tonight to get the Cobb salad.
author: Gerard T.

description:
I love a good beer and I was nothing short of pleased with Hopwater Distribution.

With 30+ beers on tap, the selection is bound to please any palate - light to dark! The bartenders are a pleasure and happy to sample some for you if you aren't sure if you want to commit to an entire pint.

I had an IPA and triple IPA of breweries I was familiar with ($7 a pint) and loved them both. 

The space is much much larger than I anticipated - a bar all around that seats nearly a dozen people, with tables situated downstairs, in the back room, as well as upstairs - overseeing the downstairs main dining area.

Had no idea they also served food, until I witnessed the staff bring out 3-4 orders of delicious burgers to other tables. We went ahead and asked for a menu and ordered some appetizers (Crab Tater Tots!) and Steak Fries - all were divine! 

I would gladly come back here any day. Opens at 5 Daily! Fresh Brew + Fresh Food..yum!
author: Veronica S.

description:
A solid watering hole in SF with a rotating draft selection of California brews, Hopwater delivered for a fun night out catching up with friends.  I definitely appreciated the slew of offerings from so many local breweries including Drake's, Linden Street and Iron Springs.

For noms, the variants of deviled eggs, fried chicken tenders and Angus sliders were all on point.  I loved the seasoning on the chicken and the beef patties were just as derricious.  I'd pass on the meats & cheeses though for the price, the same goes for the dry and underwhelming pulled pork sliders.  Do give the Dungeness tater tots a go at least once - very tasty and worth the steep price.

While there is no table service per se as orders are placed at the bar, the staff here do an excellent job of bringing everything over in a timely manner and checking in regularly to clear plates and utensils.
author: Eric F.

description: Wondered in here while on short trip to the city.  Really glad I did.  Ryan and Sam took great care of us.   My wife usually struggles to find a beer she likes when we have gone to brew pubs in the past.   Not at Hopwater.  They took the time to ask her what she likes and kept giving her samples until she honed in on the right one.  Had the chicken strips and the crab tots.  Both were well seasoned and the peach chipotle sauce is really good.  Also split the Angus burger.   Perfectly cooked and also seasoned well.  Scallion aioli on the burger is also very good.
author: Jim T.

description: When you're craving a really good burger (an Angus house blend full of rich fatty flavor topped with smoked white cheddar, arugula, tomato, and house made pickle slices) and great local beer this is your place. You will eat every perfectly salted/crispy on the outside/ warm and soft on the inside steak fry on your plate. You will suck down an Almanac double IPA called Dank Affair with your meal and then go a shade lighter on your second round with the Moonlight lightly smoked lager. A robust 6.3% lager mind you. Then you will be full and happy and there will be much rejoicing.
author: Rob K.

description: Delicious food- great beer! Worse part of this place was the walk back to my hotel because it was uphill and thats not their fault.  Had the chicken tenders and sliders.  Hands down the bedt sliders ever. Very fresh and delicious "bar food".  Elevated to another level.  Space is very unassuming and you pay at the register and wait at your table for your order. Try this place - you wont be sorry
author: Meghann O.

description: Awesome place.  Great beer selection and awesome food.  Fried buttermilk sandwich is awesome w bacon and cheddar. Fries damn good.  Will definitely come back next time in town.   Great atmosphere.
author: Kris P.

description: John and his staff at Hopwater are amazing!  I took my husband for his birthday and John immediately made us feel so welcome. And they are both Wisconsin boys! His knowledge of beer and suggestions for what we should taste of the 32 beers on tap were spot on. I'm a red wine gal and he had a craft beer partially made with red wine grape musk that was delicious.  The food was great and an added plus. So many craft beer halls have nuts and cheese, so if you want to taste, drink and linger you need food! Our new favorite  place in SF!
author: Joan K.

description: I went there for dinner by myself when I was visiting on business. I had the fried chicken sandwich which came with fries. Both were really good and the fries were nice and hot. Also had the crab tater tots which were delicious, crispy and great pure crab flavor. The service was friendly and I was able to get a seat at the bar. Only downside to the place was the noise level. If you are going to have a conversation this isn't the spot. Otherwise, awesome!
author: Kathryn M.

description: This place is great! A little hard to find so make sure you really look for the tiny sign stuck to the window. Came here for a friend's birthday and they were packed on a Tuesday night. Service was still great and their buttermilk fried chicken sandwich was amazing and great value for money. The waitress was so caring and help us set up the cake for our friend and joined in to wish him as well. Great experience and will definitely be coming back!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Good beer. Good food. A good find for being out of town. 
We got a slough of apps because I can't open my mouth wide enough for a burger after wisdom tooth surgery. 

No worries, the crab taters and deviled eggs are melt in your mouth! The steak fries were a bit dry but with plenty of salt, who cares! The chicken fingers were detectably moist and the dipping sauce was sweet and satisfying. Seemed to be a grape jam of sorts but who am I to tell...I've been eating nothing but mashed potatoes for two weeks. 

Great ambiance, low-key crowd on a Friday and perfect for the two of us.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I live 3 blocks down and since this place opened last year I've almost never come here - mostly because it's way too crowded and the setup for ordering food is in a crowd about 4 deep from the bar every time. The ordering set up should be closer to the front; the tables next to the stairs are oddly situated to squeeze by the bar crowd. You end up knocking backs with those who are sitting. 

Beers are great, but food is bleh. After three tries, I just stopped coming back. Much better service, layout and even more unique beers at Hogwash and other spots nearby.
author: Alita M.

description: My fiancé were visiting the city for the weekend and wanted to check out some local breweries. The beer here was amazing. The only thing I didn't like was that we didn't sit at the bar, but had to walk up to the bar and carry this big tray of tasters back to our table while trying to not spill. They should either hire a waitress or train the "bartender" to do this. Plus, the girl working behind the counter that day was a little rude and spoke to everyone in a condescending tone. I thought it was weird considering her job was to explain the different tastes of the beer and how they were made. Other than that, the actual beer was really good!
author: Katherine C.

description:
OUTSTANDING!!!  This place offers DELICIOUS microbrews AND mouthwatering food that is not your typical bar-fare. Not sure you'll like a particular brew?  Ask for a taste. While I'm writing this, I've tried 3 of the microbrews so far:  
       1) Auburn Gold Country--Pilsner; 
       2) Hop Dogma Yellow Mellow--Kolsch, and 
       3) North Coast Old Rasputin--Russian Imperial Stout. And they are all delicious!!

Now onto the AMAZING food...make sure you order the Dungeness Crab Tater Tots--they are HEAVEN in your mouth. Also, the Bacon Jam Deviled Eggs were to die for, as was the Angus Sliders--plain or topped with yummy add-on options they will make you want for more.
author: Patti P.

description: Tasty food, nice beer selection and friendly staff.  Five stars relative to a beer joint.
author: Ashland L.

description:
Hipster galore! I felt bad that I didn't have glasses and a tank top, or like, a flannel and beanie, but oh well!

Plenty of beers on tap, plenty of local selections, cool copper bar top. The open floor plan makes the place seem airy and inviting; it looks way bigger than the facade will have you expect. Good people watching if you sit upstairs. What makes this pub great is the great food. I had a slammin' veggie burger and dem fries was killin it. Keep slayin boi. It's nice to be able to stop into a modern-styled pub and wash down some good food with good beer. It's not like the place is filled with geriatrics. If you like non-threatening white bohemians then you can let your guard down here. Very relaxing and enjoyable.
author: Gorbachenko L.

description: Great food, but often very busy with long waiting time and not so fast service. Prices are mostly average, but the drinks are expensive.
author: Sonny R.

description:
I had such a great time here! Delicious food, thorough beer selection, and a fun vibe.

We arrived on a weeknight and the place was heaving! I'm not used to this whole standing-in-a-pub thing so it's quite a novelty for me - although not one I'm super keen on! I prefer to be able to sit and chat easily, rather than shuffling out the of the way of the servers zipping around. Luckily there were some very kind guys who gave their table to our large group, so that was really sweet. We grabbed our drinks from the bar and the super knowledgeable bartender picked me a great local hoppy IPA. 

We were hungry so ordered the devilled eggs with bacon jam, and the crab croquettes to share. Both were insanely good - the devilled eggs were creamy, rich, and smooth, and the crab was flavourful and deliciously textured.

For my main I had the dungeness louis salad, which was fantastic! The ingredients were all separated on the plate, which allowed me to incorporate a bite of avocado into each mouthful - always a bonus. The crab was plentiful, and the salad was very filling.

This is definitely somewhere I'd come back to next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Ayla C.

description: 30 different beers on tap! There's something for everyone, and it was a nice place to chillax if you come by a little later in the night, with a decent amount of seating for a bar, especially if you're old like me and don't want to deal w/ ridiculous crowds. The only downside is that they close so early, which is probably why it was a bit emptier by the time we got there. Last call was at 12:30am. Definitely coming back to try more of their ever rotating beer selection.
author: Lily C.

description:
Great space and layout!

For all the beer connoisseurs, they have 30 craft beers on tap.  They have a small wine selection which runs about $10 per glass.  

We ordered the following besides alcohol:
-chicken tenders (not bad)
-steak fries (soggy)
- some sort of tator tot (not bad)

Scene:
-mostly men 
-techy/college/hipster with a splash of yuppies here and there

The table of  asian females mid 20s-lates 20s were on their phones the WHOLE TIME.  All of them looked unhappy and barely said a word to each other.. Why go to a bar/restaurant and do that???  --I felt compelled to throw that in my review--
author: Angelica C.

description:
Oh sweet heavens to Betsy! This place is my new fave beer and grub refuge. Ya know when you're craving a delicious burger and a cold IPA? This joint is THE perfect spot. 

Came in on Sunday evening, ample seating but lively vibe. The burger was just perfect. Arugula, beet and strawberry salad with blue cheese was great. Pork sliders, YUM. Beer game on fleek! 

Le sigh....in the words of Arnold, I'll be back!
author: Adele A.

description: pretty solid....great selection of local taste.  I was really hammered so I don't recall much more
author: Doug T.

description:
Since my first visit here two weeks ago, I've promptly returned 3 more times. This is absolutely my new favorite bar.

There are many great beers on tap (my favorite is the shallow grave porter), and the food is all terrific as well. The deviled eggs w/ bacon are delicious, as were the buttermilk chicken fingers. I've heard the burger was great as well, but I've yet to try it. My chicken sandwich was solid as well.  

Part of the charm of Hopwater is the decor; from the outside it looks like a divebar that perhaps burned down, was hit by a missile, or lay dormant for a decade, but once you walk it, it's not in the least bit divy. There is an open seating plan with upper deck of tables skirting the main dining area; galvanized industrial look throughout. Maybe a bit impersonal, but it's got this rehabbed factory or empty hangar feel that I really like. 

The staff are all very nice, but get over-whelmed quickly; it's been my experience that you're best to get in and order before 6pm, as it begins to get a bit crowded/loud after that.  Overall I'd call it a hidden gem, mostly because I've walked by perhaps a hundred times without going in or giving it a chance, do yourself a favor and give Hopwater a try!
author: Jesse G.

description:
I've never written a Yelp review but I need to now because I LOVE this place. 

I have food allergies and while so many restaurants are rude about this lately, they were amazing. 

The chef specially prepared me something and checked on me twice. It was delicious and I couldn't have been more pleased. Plus their beer is fantastic.
author: Ricki L.

description:
I have been coming to Hopwater at least once every two weeks for the last several months, so I thought it only right that I give them a shoutout.

I love this place. They have 30 taps, which rotate regularly, and the service I get here is always great. The food menu is limited, but I'll be honest, I'm usually here for the beer. That said, I've enjoyed everything I've eaten thus far. Nothing gets me going quite like their burger with blue cheese and bacon, washed down by an IPA I hadn't previously heard of.

Cons: no hard alcohol for those who aren't into brews, but they do have cider and wine for those folks. 

Another thing to note is they do have a few TVs, so you can catch some sportsball here on occasion.

I will continue coming back.
author: Alex D.

description: Great beer selection. We were very unhappy with the food. The service was friendly and fast. The restaurant was inviting and the bathrooms were clean.
author: Brandina D.

description:
Who goes to a bar to order salad?  Normally that would be the last thing on my mind!

But the night I was here with my friends I found myself ordering an arugula salad. It was totally yum!

The goat's cheese was purty fancy. And the pomegranates and beets were a great touch. It was just missing caramelized walnuts. 

The chef checked my order before making it, which made me feel really loved. 

Fun place to hangout and good place to get salad - ha!
author: AnneMarie W.

description: Great choice of beers for a good price and solid burgers. I really enjoyed their sour beer option.
author: Olga L.

description:
So I've walked by this place like a thousand times. Not a million but a thousand. And it's always looked like a spot I didn't think I would like by the company kept inside. Suits and ties and what not (at least the times I've walked by). But it's always packed and so my interest had been piqued.  So after a Saturday night of sushi and drinks we strolled in kinda later on around 11:00 or so.

There was some scattered open seating towards the entrance but after a little while we were able to relocate upstairs. The crowd there was pretty solid and average that night, some middle aged folk and younger people as well. Not unwelcoming in the least. Kinda dark lighting, good ambiance and overall I ended up really liking the scene inside.

The food we tried was limited. Homegirl and I split a burger and fries as we had already threw down on some sushi earlier. She got the burger medium well which was probably pretty wise considering how rare it came out. I normally get things medium rare, and it came out right in between medium and medium-rare. It was fantastic though, the arugula was a hit with both of us. What was kinda cool to me was that it wasn't anything individually fantastic about the burger, rather just a culmination of healthy and fresh ingredients. Everything tasted really awesome. The fries were good but I mean, fries are fries to me. I'm not someone who's gonna rant and rave about fried slivers of potatoes. I remember the beer selection being pretty standard as well, but I'm not a huge drinker either so don't take my word for it.
author: Jim B.

description: It's very hard to find a seat! I was grateful for the upstairs eating. It's a very crowded place and you order at the bar. I ordered a cider which was tasty and the appetizers are the best part at this place. I got the deviled eggs with bacon jam which were tasty. I also got the tater tots which are basically like fried mini crab cakes.  My friend got a Cobb salad and I got a chicken sandwich which was good.
author: Joleen Q.

description:
Hop = solid beer place that takes hoppiness seriously 
Water = here you can drink beer like water
Distribution = lots of choices like a distribution center

I think what stands out the most is 31 draft beers on tap, all displayed in a row with minimalist decor--it's almost like Yogurtland for grown-ups.  I got the Linden St. IPA since IPA seemed appropriate for a place featuring Hopwater.  I also tried the huckleberry cider, which was bit weird but maybe that's just because huckleberries are kind of weird.

It's a funny coincidence that hoppy is one letter away from happy, because Hopwater is definitely a happy place: craft beer, fancy bar food, and a cozy ambiance along the lines of a rustic pub scene.  Rustic pub scene meaning wooden accents (not rustic as in falling apart) and a no-frills attitude (not pub as in exorbitant amounts of noise).

Conclusion: beery good! (sorry bad pun... but I dissected the name Hopwater Distribution already)
author: Edna C.

description: Came to San Francisco on vacation and our hotel was close by.  This place has a great local craft beer variety, a laid back vibe and a great short menu that satisfies all tastes. They have a short menu that perfectly matches the style of the place. Their "tater tots" are mini-crab cakes that are to die for. This was a great beer experience e for us! Definitely coming back!
author: Mili H.

description:
Too many beers to decide. The food is amazing. We ordered hamburgers and they were great. The ambient is just right though is crowdy. The prices are the regular fee for alcohol in the area and for food they are moderate for the quality.

I'd like one of this places back home in LA.
author: Art S.

description: I absolutely loved the beer, the food, the atmosphere, and the bartenders. I read that seating was hard to find and that ordering your food at the bar was difficult. I sat at the bar so that made it easy, but it appeared that the bartenders kept a tab with your card. The bartenders were very gracious and the food was delicious! If you have to to walk up to Bush, it's a killer but it's worth it!
author: Justina J.

description:
I came to Hopwater with two coworkers looking for a snack and a beer to enjoy an evening after an event. The beer selection is thumbs up; the food is good, but what has not got this place pushed to the four star mark for me is the ambience. 

DRINKS/FOOD: I split the an order of sliders. It was solid, but nothing spectacular. A pretty small slider with no frills, but made decently. The drink options are great and many. All the drinks are local brews of the Bay Area and can satisfy anybody's IPA to red ale needs. 

AMBIENCE: For a Wednesday night, it was fairly packed when we got in at 7:30. We got the edge of a table, but it seems if you are patient, you can get a table. The line moves fast when ordering and is pretty orderly, which is appreciated. It is fairly well lit, but perhaps a touch brighter. Also, the music selection is nowhere to be found. Maybe some quiet music in the background would help. My friend said that there was music, but it was pretty loud so I couldn't hear it. 

Somehow, there's something about this place I like and I feel like is lacking. It is a solid bar, but does not wow me. It is classy, good food choice, and bar selection, but perhaps this bar is not for me. 

Also, can there be wifi for the place? My signal was a little bad there.
author: Albert H.

description: Gary Bossier &I had a blast fabulous time at this,amazing fun atmosphere bar the crowd is Fun the bartender's amazing I recommend this place for a good time. If you love beer you will truly love Beer bar .Ryan the bar tender knows his beer brings on the fun
author: Karen B.

description:
This is a definitely a mood-booster place. It will make you happy right after one good local beer and one appetizer. Overall, it's a very good and lay back bar to bring your family, especially if you have a three brothers that only like breezes instead of wines.

Drake's Imperial Coffee Stout and Dungeness crab Tatar Toes are my two favorite. Berryessa Rye Stout!  Wow I can't say enough good things about this beer.  I had two and my hubby for some strange reason ordered the pomegranate cider- watch out;) It was on the strong side and I had to drive him home. I had a beer from their very hip collection which includes both local favorites and nationally distributed microbrews served by a knowledgeable bartender who will happily provide you a sample of any tap your heart desires, without so much as a prompt necessary. I like any kind of cider beer. So I choose two rivers which is. Pomegranate cider. It's has a good sour back note into a semi-sweet cider-a very interesting favor. I found it a good pair with the buttermilk chicken. Anyway, a happy night out at a good local bar.
author: Candy C.

description:
As far as a place with lots of fancy shmancy beer with food goes, yeah, this place gets 5 stars for sure. I'm not all knowing when it comes to beer (Corona anyone?), but my husband is, and he loves this place. I drink whatever he orders me and usually like it, but probably don't appreciate it as much as a hard core beer person would. Now, if you want to talk about their food menu with me... hells yeah!! Their Cobb salad is excellent (add the fried chicken to it... omg...). Their burger will shock the shit out of you with how good it is. Crab tater tots and deviled eggs with crab on them are highly recommended... if you like crab, that is. I wasn't crazy about the chicken tenders, but that is probably the only thing on the menu that hasn't made me want more. 

The lady bartender that has been there since they opened is super nice and knowledgeable. The space is really big. Surprisingly big, really. From the outside, you wouldn't expect there to be so much space. There are a few big TV's to watch whatever big game is on, which always goes well with beer. This place can get pretty crowded, which is a good thing for the business and shows how much people love the place. I'm glad they are doing so well. If you love beer and good food to go along with it, get your ass over here.
author: Liz M.

description: We decided to stop in for dinner and drinks one night on a recent trip to SF, hoping to have a quiet dinner and taste some good local brews and chews. Well, let's just say we got the good food and beer but not the quiet night out. No worries though, we aren't THAT old yet. This spot is PERFECT for a fun night out with friends or a first date. It's hip, happening and has plenty of action going on. Their beer selection was stellar and featured great craft beers from SF and beyond. My guy enjoyed his burger and my fried cod sandwich was on-point. I highly recommend this spot for anyone young at heart!
author: Carlie D.

description:
I'd make this a regular spot if I lived nearby. It has a cozy pub atmosphere -- it's the kind of place you could hunker down in if it was particularly windy and cold outside.

While they have a range of good beers on tap, I thought it was a pretty casual, no-fuss place. You order your dinner at a counter, pay in advance (which is nice), and can find a seat wherever you please afterwards. They have some booths up high on a mezzanine that overlooks the rest of the restaurant, and it makes a great perch for dinner. 

When we ordered we got an arugula, beet, goat cheese & pomegranate salad, a chicken sando and a couple red ales -- a good combination for dinner. I had no complaints whatsoever, excluding the fact that I'd like to have tried several of other things on their menu.


ps - come on a Sunday night - no wait, but a nice crowd of people.
author: M M.

description:
One of the highlights of my biz trip to San Francisco, they have over 30 local area beers on the menu.

Try the crab taters!
author: Mark C.

description: hopwater nice little irish beer hall with some food good selection of beer a good place to hang out with a few friends and have some good beers yelp on yelpers check them out a good beer head location
author: sushiatown s.

description:
...the crab and potato tater tots are bomb ass good. 

And the angus burger with bacon, smoked cheddar, and avocado just gave my stomach a food orgasm.  

Yes please.
author: Jake F.

description:
What's not to love about 30 craft beer taps?!?  Hopwater seems to get steady business throughout the week so taps rotate pretty frequently.  They definitely promote a lot of the local SF/Norcal breweries (Almanac, Faction, Fieldwork, Magnolia, etc).

I've taken several friend groups here and everyone has been able to find something to enjoy.  The diverse selection and knowledgeable bartenders make this taproom worth a visit!

Note to Owner: Please use BeerMenus or TapHunter :)
author: Jeff Y.

description:
Great for a quick beer! They have something like 50 beers on tap. Good place for finger food dinners too. 

I had the burger sliders and pickle platter. Ask the bartenders to pair your beer with your food.
author: Justin J.

description: They have an incredible selection of draft beers and the bartenders really know what they're talking about. I haven't tried the food yet but the drinks and atmosphere are great. Will definitely be back.
author: Caroline H.

description:
I came here tonight with a group of friends and I loved the vibe of the place! It was very laid back but pretty packed for a Monday night. It may not be a great idea to come here with a large group because it might take a while to find a table, unless you hover over another group waiting for them to leave lol. 

The Angus Burger was DELICIOUS! I highly recommend it! The Steak Fries that came with it were great too, but very salty though. And yes, it's a brewery so there was a wide selection of beers. I honestly do not remember the one I tried, it was a sour beer and I really enjoyed it. (:

Overall, I would definitely come back here (:
author: Karen A.

description:
Beer selection: 4.5 stars
Food: 3

Lots of beers to try which is great for the SF hipster. We ordered the beef sliders and the fried chicken sandwich. The beef sliders were bad - dry, overcooked, and comes completely plain unless you pay $2 per topping. Don't get those. 

The fried chicken sandwich was flavorful and the chicken was juicy, but it was more of a breaded chicken cutlet with slightly soggy breading than it was a fried chicken sandwich.

Come for beer, but skip the food.
author: Amy Y.

description: Stopped here before a show at the Masonic - a really nice neighborhood bar with a super selection on tap. I didn't have any food, just beer - but would definitely come back here when in Nob Hill. I like my beers on the hoppy side, so I tried a Faction Fall-IPA and an Emerald Triangle Pale Ale. Both were really nice and fresh off the tap, and the bartenders were helpful in helping make some selections from the varied tap list.
author: Rob N.

description: We were looking for good food and beer after a long day getting to San Francisco. Yelp sent us here. Excellent choice. We had supper and a different beer each night for 2 nights we were there. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was good and the beer was great.
author: Gerald S.

description:
You'd think I'd get tired of fancy beer bars with pub food, but it just doesn't happen.

We arrived in San Francisco for business and Yelp helped me find Hopwater. IT doesn't disappoint. The beer selection they had was great, and the bartender helpful and friendly. It definitely has that hispter-beer-bar vibe, but I appreciate that on occasion. 

It's the city, so the food prices are a little high for the amount of food you get (I'm looking at you, crab deviled eggs), but it's pretty delicious. We got the crab version, but it was definitely a debate between that an the bacon version. How does one make that decision?

I'm not an SF native, so I don't know how this compares to the local beer establishments, but I'm a fan!
author: Kristy C.

description:
I'm perfectly comfortable admitting that I'm one of those crusty regulars at a bar -- such a regular that some of the bartenders will pour me my preferred drink upon seeing me walk in and order my usual food without needing to ask what I want. 

I also have no shame about the fact that I will wait outside on the sidewalk in broad daylight if I get there before they open. No shame at all. And that's because this place is awesome. I love the food, I love the drink, I love the atmosphere. This is hands down my favorite place to grab food and drink within walking distance of my home.

Bonus: they play a lot of campy movies on the TVs (what's not to love?). It's great fun to see how some of the "classics" from my childhood and teenage years have gracelessly aged.
author: Catherine K.

description:
The atmosphere at Hopwater Distribution is lively with a great open feeling. Ideally, its best for small groups since seating is limited and tight. I really enjoyed the variety of beer options and the food looked pretty tasty so will be back to give it a try! 

Overall Thoughts

Fantastic place for beer lovers!
author: Eddie W.

description:
Hopwater Distribution is for beer lovers. 

It's a great low-key, chill beer haven with plenty of California draught beers - 31 in fact to represent California being the 31st state. There's a wide variety for every taste including pales, porters, pilsners and more.

The atmosphere is very relaxed. It was the perfect spot for the 3 of us to catch up; we were meeting up with a friend visiting from NYC, so we wanted a place with good drinks, a fun atmosphere, but quiet enough to hear what each other were saying, and this was just the spot!

My visiting friend was happy to try some new CA beers he hadn't sampled yet, and likewise, we were happy to explore their extensive beer menu too. There's plenty of seating both on the first floor and upstairs and the bartenders were friendly and helpful. 

We didn't get food as we had all already ate, but it's cool they do food here too. I'm not a huge bar person, but this was definitely a great spot and I wouldn't hesitate to come here again. I wish they had some beer specials or happy hour pricing, but alas, that's my only minor quip. The beers here aren't cheap, but they're not astronomical.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Pretty awesome selection of suds and served by servers who are beer knowledgeable. Nice offering of bar food my pulled pork sliders with fennel slaw was remarkably progressive for a beer hall. The crab tater tots are more like croquette or Dutch bitterballen. Clientele is surprisingly diverse from millennials, lumbersexuals to grandparents.
author: Rob B.

description:
Review is only for the beer

They have a pretty solid beer selection and a stout that I really enjoy..I think it's called north coast (?) don't quote me on that

The food menu is ok but nothing stood out to me so I just stole a few of my soul sister's fries and nibbled on a bit of cheese. 

If you're looking for a chill place to grab a few beers, this is the spot!
author: Jenn K.

description:
Holy wow!  If you're in the neighborhood get over here!

They have 31 rotating taps in hone of California being the 31st state.  You order from the bar only (no table service) and enjoy.  Hopefully you get to be there on a day that isn't so busy so you can talk up the very knowledable barkeeps . My favorite on a recent visit was a Summer Porter - who even knew such a thing existed?

Don't miss out on the food!  The burgers are great as well as the salads.  Seating is first come, first served so you may need to be prepared to wait for a table if you are going to eat.  But that's what those 31 taps are there for!
author: William H.

description: Nice craft beer selection. We shared a nice cheese platter and the duck trio appetizer. The crunchy, little cristini's served with the dishes were to hard and took away from the appetizer. Overall, a nice local spot for good beer.
author: Kevin B.

description: Cool place, friendly staff, good beer selection.  I wouldn't go back for the food, which wasn't bad but also wasn't memorable.  My wife and I had a good salad and two fairly standard sandwiches.
author: Ron P.

description: Great local beer, great hand made food.  Suddenly the expected 2 hour and dinner became 5 hours of fun.
author: John F.

description: Good beer selection and atmosphere and reasonably priced. Kitchen closes at 10 pm so if you are looking for late night eats not the place to be.
author: Thomas N.

description:
Alright. 

Needed a place in the area and had no trouble getting a table here on a tuesday night, which was nice. 

The service was a mix or order at the bar and table service. The sliders we got were pretty bare - they charge you for anything on them and don't have out ketchup or anything, which makes you feel like you're getting nickled and dimed for a casual place. The salad I had with chicken was pretty hearty and delicious though.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
During my 10-day stay in SF, I hit up Hopwater twice. Why? Because the burgers, the beers and the service are effing fantastic. 

Full disclosure: my husband, an avid Yelp user, found this spot on our last trip to SF. He raved and raved about it over the next 6 months, so when we were back in town, it was one of our first stops. They did not disappoint! An awesome beer list (always 31 on draught to represent CA, the 31st state) coupled by an awesome food list. My picks? The stone fruit and arugula salad (with a dallop of fresh ricotta and a sprinkling of toasted sunflower seeds -- delish), and the house burger with smoked cheddar and avocado (yes, do it). So very, very good. So good, I did it twice. Yup, a week later on our very last night in town, we came back because I'd been thinking about it all week!

The staff is very sweet and genuinely wants to please you. When you have as many beers on tap as they do, questions and requests are bound to happen, and they all seem to take it in stride. We were there an a super busy night, and on a much calmer night and the service was pretty consistent, if a little slower (but of course) on the busier night. 

In short, hit up Hopwater. I think their burger may be in my Top 2 for SF -- that means it's a good one!
author: Hilary H.

description:
Fun atmosphere! Came here starving around 9:30 pm and was so happy to find out they served food so late. The portions were a little on the small side... We got the crab tots, sliders, and chicken tenders, but I'm sure the main dishes are larger.

Good beer too
author: Lauren D.

description:
I'm not a beer fan, but a wall of beer taps seems up some of my friends alley!  So many to choose from. I stuck with wine.  Mmmmm

The crab tater tots took a minute to hit my tastebuds, but they were good.  Slightly blander than I would have expected but tasty.

Waitress was super knowledgeable about everything; food and drinks.  

Decided to go with the fried chicken sando after the waitress talked about it. Now that my foodies...was insanely good!
author: Daphne W.

description:
Hopwater is an awesome taproom / gastropub to grab brewskies, snacks, or full meals at. This review is based solely on décor and beer: two essential things for me.

*Atmosphere*

The crowd is young and middle aged professional. Lots of brick with upstairs and downstairs seating. Upstairs is smaller but offers small picnic table style seating for a two or four-top. 

*Whats They Gots to Offer*

The draught beer menu is pretty big, around 30 beers to choose from, and it apparently rotates. My friend and I went in on Friday for a beer and were both very happy with our choices. We didn't eat because we had dinner plans later, but I would love to go back and try the Deviled Eggs with Bacon Jam, Dunguness Tater Tots, or any of the burgers which made my mouth water when they passed our table. 

I got the El Toro 20th Anniversary Double IPA out of Morgan Hill, which was a beautiful orange-amber in color, slightly bitter, but mellowed out with a sweet, caramelly finish. My friend got a Green Flash and was happy with it, though after he tried mine, he wished he had gone with El Toro too. But comme ci, comme ca.

Reasonable prices all around, non-pretentious environment, and my co-worker's friend owns it, so give it a try and support locals! Can't wait to head back over for some grub and more beers, obviously.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Beer was great. One bartender was great, she gave us her suggestions on IPA's we should try as that is our favorite beer. We had a couple samples and were good to go. The other bartender (when we got there) was super rude and gave us a half assed apology as to why it took so long for someone to come over--the place was not dead but not busy at all. 

Anyways, we got the chicken fingers and the deviled eggs. Everything you read here about the Deviled eggs here is true. My fiance likes them and give the dish a thumbs up. Chicken fingers were $8 for 5 pinky finger sized nuggets. Portions didn't match the prices.

5 Stars - Beer
Bartender 1 (the skinnier one) - 5 Stars 
Food - 3
Portions - 3
Bartender 2 (larger one with uggs) - 1 star 
=3.4 overall.
author: Bill L.

description: Stopped in for a quick pre-dinner drink with a group of 6.  Plenty of room on a Sunday night, large tables with stools.  An extensive beer collection, certainly somewhere I want to bring my beer-loving friends.  Not too loud, great for conversation.  I was also really excited that they had Gloria Ferrer bubbles!
author: Beth V.

description: We trekked up to lower nob hill for a few delicious beers after a long day of sightseeing.  Hopwater was busy, but we were able to find a couple of spots at the bar.  The beer is super tasty.  So tasty that we had a few and ended up not being hungry for food.  Sigh.  The food that we did see all looked rather tasty.  They are not signed very well so be prepared to look hard for their location if you visit.
author: Michael W.

description: Stopped in for a before dinner drink with some friends. Cool space, great tap selection of beer. Because of the locale though, parking sucks ass. Ive been on a sours kick lately so I got the Holy Gose which was the closing they they had. Friend got the Heretic Evil Twin red ale. I think we went on a mellow Sat however as the place wasnt very crowded. My other friend says it's generally 2-3 deep normally. I think that would give me quite a different impression but I guess as a weekday bar it might be more my speed.
author: Kim N.

description:
One of the finer establishments in the Union Square area in SF. 

Fabulous pub! So many beers on tap. I found a few that I liked. Super friend staff. Very spacious, very cool, beer drinkers haven.

I'm not gonna lie, I love craft beers. I'm big on sours and IPAs. So the first thing I would ask at any watering holes with good beer selection would be to ask "do you have any sour beers on tap?" Unfortunately, when I went, they had ran out of the sour. When denied, I opt for my 2nd beer of choice, IPAs, they had so many different types of pale ales and IPAs, it was hard to decide. But I got one of the double IPA, just the right balance of hops and bitterness. Noticed they had a stout on nitro, I'm a fan of those too. Argh so many choices.

I came with a big group, and on a Friday night, it was less busy than I thought it would be. Seating was super easy to find. With the right crowd of peeps, this would be an awesome place to kick it. Cheers for Hopwater.... 5 stars!
author: Jackson Y.

description:
5 Stars for drinks.
3 Stars for food
1 Star for service/flow

Great spot to go to hang out, stand around, chat, drink. Bad spot for sit down dinner.

Upon entering, was not greeted by anyone. No signs. No "Seat Yourself" or anything. Saw an empty table and began to walk towards the back to it. Passed by a server and asked if we just seat ourselves and he nodded. We sat for about 10 minutes with no one coming by. Then noticed the party next to us, someone had come back with a number. She then tells us how you have to order at the bar - drinks and food and bring your number back to the table. Awesome. Thank you Mr. Server for telling us as we aimlessly walked in, looked lost, and asked where we can sit. 

Chicken Tenders (3 pieces) and Dungess Crab Tator Tots ($20 total) - Delicious but wayyy over priced. The Chicken Tenders... 3 pieces. Tasty but very small amount. The Tater Tots were not what you would normally think. It had the shape of a jalapeno popper but filled with potato and shredded crab meat along with a slight cheese. 5 Pieces for $12. 

Beer - Over 30 beers on tap ranging from $6 - about $9. Great choices and quick bartenders. 

Again, a great place to grab drinks and hang out. Don't bother with the food.
author: Yohan N.

description:
Wait! How is it that I haven't reviewed Hopwater yet??

I come to SF twice each month for work and found Hopwater about two months ago.  I have made a point to get there during every trip since. 

1. I come for the AMAZING crab salad... It is real crab, people... enough said...

2. I can't drink beer (boooooo for me), but the Rose is perfect. To find a place with good beer *and* good wine is rare, but Hopwater has it!  When they start stocking GF beer, first round is on me!

3. The staff is amazing! If they don't have what you want, they tell you where to go to get it. For real! The service is truly amazing. 

Don't crowd the place though! I like being able to sit up at the bar on Monday and Tuesday nights, listen to their excellent choice in music an enjoy a perfect meal.
author: Lauren S.

description: If you like beer this is a great place, with 30 local California ones on tap. What better place to taste the local brews. This is a spacious bar with lots of seating for groups or couples. We got a spot at the bar and whilst enjoying some of the local beers tucked into some beef sliders with cheese and avocado, the crab tatter totts and a fried chicken burger. The food is the ideal combination with a few beers, it's nothing fancy and will by no means blow you away. It is purely good tasting and perfect for the setting!!
author: Nicola T.
