description: More hops said no one ever or did they. The beer selection was overwhelming and it was hard to pick something. The eggs were amazing and I'll come back just for them. The tater tots were good but a little pricey in my opinion. The location would probably be what dissuades  me from frequenting here for drinks. It's a bloody steep uphill climb.
author: Han Teng W.

description: Hip, Quick, Clean, Tasty. What else is there to say? Lots of craft beer choice and great pub type food, especially the hamburgers and fries!
author: Pat H.

description: Visiting San Fran and loved this beer bar. Great nibbles, highly suggest the crab tots!  Husband is major beer snob and the selection here was great.
author: Amy F.

description:
Not too pretentious, and not too divey. Dropped by here a few times to catch up with friends around the old haunts. Always had a place to sit and chat whenever i've been here.

Wide beer selection served out of cool looking taps in the centerpiece at the bar, and most importantly Old Rasputin is available.

Not a sports bar, but they had TVs playing some sports-ball game. Not a plus in my books since it distracts from the whole "enjoying your time with friends" thing, but I can see how others might take favorably.
author: Artem A.

description:
Remember the flashing light in Beetlejuice, pointing to Dante's Inferno Room?  That's kind of how I found this place, a flickering marquee that subliminally said "Beer! Beer! Beer!" instead of "Girls! Girls! Girls!"

The space is beautiful with exposed brick, high ceilings, a copper bar counter and a seemingly never-ending wall of taps.  Seemingly because they are numbered 1-30.  Try as you might, you're not going to get through them all in one night.

The feel is open yet cozy, plenty of seating and more seating on the mezzanine level, good for a quiet spot away from the hustle and bustle that's soon to prevail, or lording over the masses.  Whichever you prefer. 

Odd as it may seem, as I'm not a beer drinker, I already love this place.  The staff were all very friendly, the charcuterie + cheese plates were generous enough (while being affordable) for 3 girls, and there was one cider on tap for those of us who don't fancy beer.

My vote is a resounding, hell yes!  So happy to have a sophisticated spot in the Lower Nob Hill area that isn't another wine bar - and since I'm an optimist, I look forward to seeing a few more ciders on tap in the future.
author: MJ P.

description: Across the street from our B&B, this friendly establishment proved to be a good choice. The Hopwater salad (I added the grilled fish) was delicious, and my partner's burger was good. Casual, low key, unassuming, no pretense here, just good beer, food, and friendly service.
author: Christi R.

description: The pork sandwich was awesome!   So many beers to choose from.  Staff were super friendly.  Just an all around good experience.
author: Sheila M.

description:
This place is solid. Beers are great and varied. The bartenders really know their product even though it appears to rotate constantly. 
Had some local sausage and deviled eggs to start, both good, deviled eggs a bit better than the Ghost Pepper Sausage. 
Chicken sandwich for dinner was good solid pub food, juicy salty but let's be honest you are here for the beer - the variety and their knowledge of it.
author: dan m.

description:
Pros:
- 30 beers on tap
- pink lady cider (very crisp!)
- Belgian wheat (pale and sweet)
- convenient ordering counter so you don't need to get a server's attention
- not difficult to find seating
- clean, classic interior decorating

Cons:
- no real cons except that empty glasses aren't frequently removed from tables

Bottom line: Go! There are so many choices, you're bound to find one you like! I will definitely be revisiting

Note: when I visited, entree foods weren't being served, but I'm excited to try a burger when I go back
author: Jiann M.

description: This place is pretty nice. Very simple with a great beer selection and a good, simple menu. I had the fried chicken Sando and it was very impressive.
author: Dariel S.

description:
This place is legit. I've been waiting about a year for it to open, and it's worth the wait. The highlights:

The staff is top-notch. Knowledgeable, friendly and amenable. Exactly what I expect from a great beer bar. They were generous about sampling, and had great recommendations. 

The space is very cool, and it's huge! Most places in our neighborhood are holes in the wall, and don't offer much space for crowds. Hopwater has a huge main bar area, a back seated area, an upstairs seated area that seems like it would fit another 40 people, and there's whispers of a back patio opening up eventually too. And the fact that they restored such an odd, awesome old building really enhances the space. It's definitely a tribute to the old Key Klub, and they even kept the old neon sign (which still works!). The beer-themed decorations are great too.

The beer is fantastic. The selection is amazing, and all the beers I tried were top-notch. The new Anchor IPA, which I haven't seen in any other bar, was very good. They have 30 beers on tap, and plan on changing the beers frequently. 

Food service supposedly starts today. They're planning to have good American pub food, with burgers, sandwiches, lots of meat and a salad (Louie, they guessed) or three. 

The fellow bar-goers were great too. We got there and within 10 minutes were chatting up the bartenders and some of the other patrons. I plan on being here A LOT.
author: Evan G.

description: A hearty night with friends completed here by a tasty TrIIIPAle. Food is kinda expensive though but the atmosphere is chill
author: Raen T.

description: Good beer good service great selection wonderful environment. I would come back anytime of the day great to start your day off with these selections of beers. Omg so good the fries try the hot sauce cant get that cali hot sauce no where else
author: Danny J.

description: Omgosh, the Portobello mushroom sandwich ( I added chimichurri sauce to it) was to die for, my meat eating husband said it was worthy of ordering. Paired with the Foundation IPA and Fort Point IPA, WAS DELICIOUS.  My husband's soup was outstanding!
author: Amy O.

description: Locals lined up waiting for the doors to open. Fantastic beer selection on tap. Highly recommend the cod sandwich and delicious steak fries.
author: Cristen M.

description: Hopwater Distribution has a great selection of local beers, with 30+ beers on tap. The food was also pretty good. We shared the crab cake tater tots & the buttermilk fried chicken tenders. I loved the buttermilk fried chicken, especially with the mango chipotle sauce! The crab cake tater tots were also pretty great.
author: Cici A.

description: This place is phenomenal. The beer list is highly curated. You just won't find many of these beers anywhere else. And the food is top notch. Steak fries. Mmmmmm. Only problem? It's popular. And rightly so.
author: Casey C.

description:
Visited this place my last night in SF on business.  Read on Yelp to try the Devils eggs with bacon Jam.  
Did just that.  They were AWESOME.  That paired with a burger and several well selected IPAs (thanks to the awesome bartenders assistance). Truly made for an enjoyable visit.
author: Troy B.

description:
This contains a surplus of pretense but is impoverished of substance; find here beer that is available all over, nothing that is extraordinary or rarely seen, but  here find these more expensive for smaller pours. 

It's like a white wine bar introducing you to your first not-Corona.
author: Joe D.

description:
Mmmmmmmmm beer.....

I love the look of this place. Its all wood and bricks and it has this simplicity and neatness to it that I can quite explain but I admire. The place is dimly lit and at the bar has a chalk board that lists all the 30 something beers they have on tap. Each beer listed has a number so you can easily just say the number you want. They have a great selection and they constantly change it. 

The food is actually pretty good here too. I had the fried chicken sandwich, and it was really freaking good. It surprised the hell out of me that this came from a kitchen in a bar. The chicken was perfectly crispy and the chicken was so tender and juicy. They also put a spicy slaw, mozzarella, Chimichurri. It comes with steak fries as well. The chicken sandwich was $12 and it was worth every bite. 

The smaller bites are ~$4. I recommend the deviled eggs with bacon jam. It is truly genius. These are the best deviled eggs I've had. 

You order your food at the bar and take back a number to your seat. The server will bring you the food. Food comes out pretty fast. 

It's a great pub and one of my favorites in San Francisco, so hop on over here! First round is on me! Just kidding.
author: Allen C.

description:
Went for a late dinner / drinks at 9pm on a Saturday. The place is small and appears crowded but never an issue getting to the bar for drinks. 

We sat down the back for dinner and were not disappointed. Ordered the chicken tenders, crab tater tots and a burger to share between 2 of us, all of which were delicious not to mention quick (delivered less than 15 mins after ordering). 

Moved out to the bar after dinner and attempted to drink as many of the 32 draft beers as we could. Sadly failed at only 11.

If back in San Fran will be going to this place again!
author: Michael F.

description: Great place to hang out and grab a beer! The place has a cool layout and a large selection of beers on tap.
author: Jay G.

description:
I came here a few months back to meet a good buddy from SoCal. Luckily we got here on the early side of dinner before the big rush of people came in.

We sat upstairs and ordered some beer and burgers. The burgers seemed to be exceptional - juicy beef and stacked with tasty condiments between perfectly baked bun.

I'd normally give it a 5 star but our last round of drinks took forever to get so I have to knock it down to a 4. But I'm certainly coming back.
author: Art O.

description: Really great beers!  Huckleberry cider was delicious & not sweet.  Great taste.  Tried fresh cheese plate (delicious- fresh ricotta amazing!), crab tater tots (perfectly lightly fried & yummy aioli) and last pulled pork sliders.  A bit hard to find but worth it!!
author: kathe r.

description:
A buddy of mine recommended this place to me while I was in town for effectively a layover. The weekend I was there Bay To Breakers was going on, and even though the Hopwater isn't on the race course, it definitely made for good people watching. 

I love the exterior of the building. I don't know if they had just moved in and plan to renovate it, but I hope they don't. The rotted out "Key Club" sign gave it a sort of punk-noir/speak-easy vibe. When I went in I was shocked to find everything well-appointed in copper and wood, giving further credence to this being the kind of place Sam Spade finds the bad guys hanging out at - albeit the upscale ones.
This being SF I anticipated a $15 burger and $7 pints, but I was pleased to find the food and drinks there incredibly reasonable, with a lot on tap. I think I paid about $10 for my burger, and $5 a pint for good Northern California beer. I found a place by a window and camped out there, watching the sun go down behind the buildings and a naked dude in a scarf do laps after the race or something. 

Regardless of how many times that man brought his dong around the block, the Hopwater was content to let me sit and watch. I think I hung out for about 3 hours, I ordered one meal, and drank about one inexpensive beer an hour. The whole time the service was still chipper, and everyone was having a good time. If I ever find myself in SF for an afternoon of chilling out, I will be heading to the Hopwater.
author: Ben B.

description:
Was very impressed by the large beer selection. Had the Baeltane Trippel and it was tasty. My only regret is not having the time to try more.

Prices on food and beer seem extremely reasonable for the location.

Food was amazing. The Bacon Jam Deviled Eggs are probably going to be one of my new favorite things.

All of the staff was friendly and courteous. Big shout out to the chef Ryan for being so talented.

Love the inside by the outside is a little easy to miss if you aren't looking for it. They had Ghostbusters on one TV and The Fifth Element on the other while we were there. What more could you ask for? :D
author: Kieran H.

description: Great selection of beer with 20 beers on tap - always fresh. Good food and awesome atmosphere.
author: Nehal M.

description: Came here for drinks and appetizers with some friends. The beer selection is huge. We had a few each. Crab "tots" were good. I also liked the beef sliders.
author: Dre V.

description: Simply but tasty food. Had the Angus burger with Bleu cheese adder($2) and good steak fries. Since I'm not a local, seems like a local favorite. Full of people in deep conversation, oblivious to the Golden State Warriors basketball game on the TV's.
author: Luke H.

description: Great tap list, nice atmosphere!
author: Rania T.

description:
Nice to see a really solid brewery.  The boyfriend and I aren't even normally beer people but it looked like a good place to try out so we went for it. Great decision. 

I went light and got the Two Rivers Granny Apple Cider.  It was a good cider, not too intense. Honestly, it basically tasted like apple juice, but I really liked it.  The bf got the Green Flash Juego con Fuego. He really loved it, he's been trying to find a beer he likes for a long time and he definitely found it in this.  It was spicy and had a hint of chocolate which was super interesting. 

We also got some food, chicken fingers with a mango sauce for me (the more I write this the more I feel like I got the kid's menu offerings of this place), and he got the angus burger.  They were pretty average, good meals but nothing too memorable. 

I will say, the place was packed and it was a bit hard to find a table. But otherwise, we had a great time!
author: Kristen T.

description:
Kind of a slow place on a weekday but the beer selection is incredible. 

Not just the typical OHH WE HAVE 40 DIFFERENT IPAs. Awesome variety of stouts and lagers too. 

Must check out.
author: Danny Y.

description: Great spot!  Tator tots are SO good, chicken fingers too (tasted super fresh and sustainable). And obvious the beer is pretty good too!
author: AM B.

description:
Hit the place the other evening. Didn't even know it was there. A friend invited me and I have to say, it's a pretty darn good place. Food is great too. We ordered quite a bit since there were a few of us and everything was really good.

And getting a pint was not only quick, but the help behind the bar knew what was available and what to pair with the food.

Great place...
author: Dave D.

description: They need to serve upstairs better and take orders quicker. Food and drinks are great though
author: Deepa G.

description:
A wonderful addition to the neighborhood. This place has a top-notch beer selection, a respectable wine selection, and gastropub fare (e.g. cheese plates, sliders, and salads).

I'll be back frequently, probably more than I should. Nice and chill -- and full of locals happy to chat -- on the Monday night I went.
author: David S.

description:
We are in town for vacation and staying nearby. This awesome neighborhood craft beer establishment did not disappoint. 

Make sure to try the Bacon Jam Deviled Eggs and the Crab Tater Tots - delicious!

The weeknight atmosphere was neighborly and laid back. The inside has plenty of seating, perfect for gathering with friends!
author: Jenny S.

description:
This was exactly what we were looking for - great beer, great service & great food at a reasonable price. Close to where we were staying and an awesome atmosphere.

Thoroughly recommend this place if you like good beer.
author: Tony M.

description:
Found this the first night in town and was very impressed. The bartender jumped right in to detailed descriptions of the two beers I couldn't decide between, and it was awesome. The food was fantastic, great flavor and choices. 

For sure would return when I'm back in town! Great service, great food, and GREAT BEER!
author: Amanda A.

description:
Cool place in tender-nob,  good food, lots of beer on tap. I like the loft that surrounds the perimeter of the vaulted ceiling, it allows for extra seating while still being able to look down at the main bar. 

Grab any table that is open, but you will need to order at the bar downstairs,they give you a number then you can go off to an table, they will bring your food to you. 

I ordered  the Roasted Golden Beet & Wild Arugula Salad with Goat Cheese & Pomegranate Seeds with an extra side of grilled chicken..... it was sooooo good! 

The beet were fresh and there was an perfect amount of dressing, there was a fair amount of grilled chicken slices and the goat cheese was delicious. 

My friend ordered the  Dungeness Louis Salad with Avocado, Hard Cooked Egg, Cherry Tomatoes, Broccolini, Dungeness Crab, Artisan Lettuces &  Special Louis Dressing, she really liked it,  although i can only vouch for the avocado as that was all i tried. 

Would definitely go back to try the sliders and some of their apps, looks like a fun place for after work happy hour.
author: Javi Alexa A.

description:
Decided to check out this bar during our visit to San Francisco. It is located near Union Square. Came here on a Friday night so it was a bit packed. The only thing is you have to look for seats so hopefully you can come up quickly on one. I really like the venue here because they have so many beers on tap. I believe I counted around 20 beers they had along with wine and other weapons of choice for the night.

I ordered an IPA and a Raspberry beer. Both were very tasty and fairly priced at around $7. I would definitely give this place a try if you are searching for a bar in the area. I will definitely be coming back to this bar during my next visit! Hopefully I can try more beers on tap the next time around!
author: Henry O.

description: The arugula salad with peaches and seared cod was fantastic!! I was delightfully surprised and the guys loved their burgers. They were happy with how thick and juicy they were and both raved...well worth the 12.00. We will be back!
author: Candicd E.

description: Great place to try some new beer while grabbing a bite to eat.  They had a nice selection of 30ish beers on tap, as well as a cask.  We tried a couple of different interesting beers that we haven't seen elsewhere.  I also got a fried chicken sandwich, which was really good for $12 or so, along with some crab tater tots, which were like mini crab cakes.  Add in the fact that it wasn't totally packed even on a Saturday night, and we'd definitely come back here for a chill night in the future.
author: Simon L.

description: Cool place with a great choice of locally brewed beer
author: Sandeep K.

description: I'm not a huge beer fan but if you're into beer, you must, must come here! Also, if you love deviled eggs, hello!! This place is top notch, five stars, get your ass down here if you can find a seat!! Love it but damn, those deviled eggs tho!! Crab meat and bacon jam!! Stop with the punctuation already!!
author: Olivia L.

description: My co-worker recommended this place for a quick drink and snack after work. I had the chicken sausage/hot dog, and it was one of the best hot dog thingies Ive ever had. Also-the variety of drinks being offered is massive.
author: Dinakar K.

description: Awesome selection of beverages. The dark wood interior definitely set the mood. Food was tasty, yet came in small portions. Would recommend for a low-key evening.
author: Jeremy M.

description:
Solid bar/restaurant, they've got a decent selection of appetizers and beers. I've tried the fried chicken and their cobb salad, both of which were great, but honestly I didn't have high expectations of food for this place, as I've came here mostly to just have a few drinks with friends, with food being an after thought.

As I mentioned earlier theres a good selection of beers here as well. Overall this place has a good balance of ambience, food, and drinks. It's not too dark, not too loud so it's actually reasonable to carry out a conversation here with the people that you came with.

This place does get fairly busy on weekdays around happy hour, so either get there a bit before the happy hour/dinner hour or be prepared to either wait of be cramed in a nook.
author: David C.

description:
I wish I had better things to say about this place, but things went downhill from my first staff interaction upon entering. A tall, heavyset bearded guy was at the register. I asked if it would be okay to push two tables together, something that I as as server would really appreciate because it's annoying when guests start rearranging furniture. All he would say is 'it's open seating' in a soulless voice.

Me: Hi! I'm in a group and the long table is taken, can I move tables together?
Him: It's open seating.
Me: I know, but is it cool if I move tables together?
Him: It's open seating.
Me: Yes, I understand, so no one minds if we rearrange things?
Him: It's open seating.

I finally got irritated at the obstinate refusal to help and walked away. Then, of course, there's no table service, so I had to keep getting up and interacting with this guy whenever I needed drinks or food.

Each interaction was unpleasant and I have no idea what this guy had against me, but he would ignore me as if I were invisible, be oddly dismissive and impatient when taking my order, and in complete contrast to how I was treated, I watched him be super nice to the regulars in my party. We ordered a lot of food and drinks, and I seriously don't get why this guy was such a dick to me the whole time. It completely and totally ruined my experience here, I left feeling livid and somewhat hurt because I'm a nice, polite person that treats service people like gold. I've worked in service positions my entire life and I know how a good customer can make your shift.

He had a lot of chances to turn it around, because we continually ordered drinks. Each time, though, I got the same treatment. I couldn't believe it. He had been kind of rolling his eyes and being all impatient when taking our food order and, not surprisingly, one of the items was wrong. When I took it back to him, he gave me a hard stare and waited for me to explain. 

Me: I'm sorry, we asked for x ---
Him: Yeah? I put that in.
Me: .. but we got y.

With a look of irritated disgust, he snatched the plate from my hand and without a word, disappeared into the kitchen.

I have a lot of patience and rarely complain in restaurants, but that was it for me. I wish I was exaggerating about what happened, but I experienced some really shitty service and a lot of unwarranted attitude, the likes of which I cannot remember ever previously receiving at a restaurant.

The food was okay, not great. Fries came out unsalted, by far not enough crostini on the cheese or meat plates (cheese is mostly soft varieties and needs something to spread it on), chicken tenders weren't crispy (sauce on top made matters worse). 

At a certain point, my interactions with the guy were so unpleasant that my whole experience was affected. It was really hard to find things to like when I felt that I'd been treated so dismissively. No worries, though.. Since he made it clear that I was intensely painful to serve, there's no need for me to return.
author: W W.

description: Great range of local beers on tap, friendly staff and a good vibe. The menu looked impressive, though we weren't there to eat. If you're in the area, definitely worth checking out.
author: Matt P.

description: What a gem!  Great beer and really high end fresh dishes.  Crab filled taters alone worth the trip over.  Definitely recommend for an awesome tap room style experience
author: Tom A.

description:
I really like this place. It was a little late for dinner and we didn't feel like uberring it either. I suggested going to aliment because it's just a short walk from N's place,"NO, lets go to Hopwater", was the reply. 
So glad we did. Great brew, we had a Monk's Blood and a Rasputen Stout, sliders and chicken tenders. Perfectly toasted buns on the sliders, mmm. Tenders were on the dry side but still okay with a little dipping sauce.
author: Kris M.

description: All the tables were sticky. I wasn't actually a fan of the beer or cider that I tried. Semi-cool place but nothing spectacular. Don't know why it has such a high rating.
author: Christopher J.

description:
Gets four stars for the beer selection and the chicken sandwich.  Solid beer selection of interesting microbrews you don't find many places.  Great addition to downtown. 

Crab tater tots are the only thing we weren't impressed with.
author: Michael M.

description:
I was fortunate to try the two rivers blackberry cider - yum!  This is my third cider-made beer I tasted and I am a fan.  The fact that I can find it at Hopwater is awesome.

Too bad I didn't have a chance to try any of their menu but I will when I come back.
author: Pam S.

description:
Wow! Great neighborhood beer bar!
Great variety of draft beer. From light, lager, Pilsner to the very intense IPA's.
Food is great and always served very quick!
Build your own Sliders little expensive with $2 per add on! 
Soup of the day always a good option as well!

Nice atmosphere modern feel and nice staff!
author: Daniel S.

description: I ate here twice while in town. I really liked the cod sandwich. The fries were only so so but they let me sub a salad the next time which was much better. There are plenty of beers of all kinds to enjoy and they are willing to provide recommendations and samples. Friendly staff who make you feel welcome.
author: Michael M.

description: I understand this is more of a beer place. Which they have a ton! But this review is based on the food. Horrible. Just awful. Chalk it up to bland airline food. My fiancé tried the beer said it was horrible bitter as well. I, myself am not a beer drinker so this is my review on their "the pork" sandwich. The bread was good. But the rest was dry and bland. Like a bad Arby's sandwich. Yuck
author: Alexandra B.

description: Great food, nice selection of beer and a kickass atmosphere to top it all off.  I need to preface this review by stating that I am not a fan of Kanye West... Kanye West once said "my life is dope and I do dope sh*t"... The beautiful creature that prepared my buttermilk fried chicken sandwich at Hopewater created such a beautiful fusion of flavors sandwhiched between those buns that they deserve to say "my life is dope and I cook dope sh*t" because they really do!  I loved my meal as much as Kanye loves Kanye.
author: Zach B.

description: Great local pub with incredible beer selection. All beers are on tap and from NorCal breweries. Faction Pale Ale is my favorite. Well-priced and great vibe.
author: Christina L.

description: Came here on a Saturday while we were waiting for Del Popolo.... large and varied beer selection, prices were pretty good!  Even though the warrior game was on and it was a saturday, it wasn't packed and we were able to get a table.  Pretty chill mixed crowd, not too loud... but I guess we were there early (around 7 pm).  I can't remember the beers I ordered but I got two of them with higher alcohol content.  Downed them both.  Got some fries as well and I'm sure it was b/c I was hungry and needed something w/ the beers, but at the time I was thinking they were the best fries I had ever tasted!  Large steak type fries, Piping hot and pretty well salted.  Not super crisp, so real potato-meaty.  It was the perfect spot to wait for our table and catch some of the game.
author: Easter E.

description: Such an fun place and an amazing social atmosphere. So many rotating beer on tap, this is my second time checking this place out and it does not disappoint! Mary, one of the bartenders, does not disappoint, she's so knowledgeable about all the beer selections and can pin point just what you want and I must add she has such a positive and fun attitude. I'd totally recommend this place for both drinks and food. The deviled eggs with bacon jam, HOW CAN YOU GO WRONG?! To the pulled pork sliders and Build Your Own Burgers. Definitely a place you want to check out when you're in the city!
author: TJ R.

description: A gastro-cafeteria with a decent draft beer selection (and nothing else), promising menu of eats (that ultimately taste bland and uninspiring) in an echo-enhancing, acoustically unpleasant large room. There are certain occasions where these (otherwise) limitations might prove excellent (I.e. you want drink many beers, shout with friends, and eat food that seems great after a dozen drinks), but none applied to my experience.
author: Geoffrey C.

description:
Very good food and beer selection.

I had the chicken sandwich, which had a fresh slaw that made the dish.  It was an unexpected bright flavor.  Fantastic.

The side of fries was a little mediocre compared to the sandwich.  Maybe my expectations were set too high - I was anticipating something uncommon.

Topped off with a great beer selection with some Belgians that I like, as well as a friendly staff, it was a place I'd recommend.
author: Rob B.

description: Amazing beer selection, and the staff are also very friendly, helpful and knowledgable. I really enjoyed the food I tried: humboldt fog cheese, deviled eggs with bacon jam, and the potato leek soup. Also loved the el toro jasper amber ale! Very spacious while still maintaining a nice atmosphere. I only wish I still lived in the neighborhood so I could visit more frequently!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Solid 4. I like what they're doing here. It's sort of a bro bar, don't get me wrong, the ladies are here too. Certainly a younger, hipper scene. 

The food was good, nothing to rave about, but I did enjoy the veggie sandwich. My husband enjoyed his burger and beer. 

Service was interesting, you order at the bar and then someone brings it to you. If you even need water refills you need to go to the bar, but I guess it is a bar so that kind of makes sense. 

It was dark so I couldn't see cleanliness and ambiance as much.
author: Diesel H.

description:
Love this place! I've been here a few times but recently I came on a Saturday for a friends birthday. We got there around 5 and were able to stake out some tables before it got too busy. The bartenders were all nice and helpful when trying to decide on which of the 25 beers on tap I wanted to try. They gave me a few samples to ensure I liked what I ordered.

The food is also really good. It's a small menu but everything on it is really tasty -- the crab tots are my personal favorite. My friend got the burger and I had a bite, it was SO good. 

Great place to go and try some new beers in a laid back environment.
author: Lizzy U.

description:
They had a Karl Straus "peanut butter cup" porter that was great! 

I had the deviled eggs with bacon jam and the crab tatter tots. Delicious!!!!!! 

Come here if you are trying to avoid a touristy spot. (I'm a tourist, but I blend like a local) ;) 

Bartendra was very sweet and she asked me if I liked my food even when it got crowded! 

Enjoy!
author: Ereeni A.

description: Easy to read beer menu, great staff of beer lovers and foodies, non-douchy crowd...oh, and 2 different types of deviled eggs! What more do you want? Pricing is good, beers are awesome, food fills all the empty parts of your tummy! Eat, drink, be happy!
author: Paul A.

description: Ordered the chicken tenders and steak fries along side a pomegranate cider.  The cider had a slight tartness to it and on the drier side.  But complimented the perfectly seasoned and juicy chicken tenders.  The steak fries were lightly seasoned but no wow factor.  All in all a finger licking good order. The service was very fast.  I was able to sample the cider before ordering it as well.  The bartender was dry thorough and knowledgeable of the brews on tap.  I will definitely stop in again the next time in town.
author: Sima P.

description: Awesome spot! Great crowd, which can be a little on the 'brah' side, but overall cool people. The food is great and they have an impressive selection of locally sourced beers! It can get pretty crowded after work and peak hours, but it's worth sticking around and waiting for a table.
author: Derwood A.

description: My girlfriend and I spent the weekend at the Grand Hyatt so this was just a short walk from the hotel. What a great selection of beer they have! All craft beer, all delicious. It is a nice environment as well, not too noisy, not awkwardly quiet. Great way to begin or end a night.
author: Tyler K.

description: you want beer? look no further ... 30ish beers on tap. friendly service and great food to boot. tried the bacon jam deviled eggs, crab tots and pork sliders. all delicious. I'd come back just for the food ... but the beer selection makes it that much better!
author: Shelly B.

description:
If you're looking for hard to find beer, one offs or are just looking for things you have not had before, this place is your jam.

I like to think of myself as a beer appreciator.  Typically, I've had several if not all of the items on a tap list.  Hopwater made me look like a noob and that's cool with me.

I was able to recognize the breweries but the actual beers themselves were all new.  I ended up trying a beer that was in a cask with valencia oranges.  Yeah, it was sweet (in the good way, not the cloying way)

Next time I'm back in SF, i'm making it a point to come back here.  The bartenders we chatted with were both pleasant to talk to and informative.  I got the impression they love beer as much as we do.  That's what I'm looking for in a pub.
author: Vinny P.

description:
Large selection of beers starting at $6. Their food is a bit on the pricey side considering their portions. We ordered the crab tater tots, deviled eggs, cobb salad, brie and salami. Cobb salad wasn't something to write home about, but definitely try the tots. Place gets pretty loud and crowded. 

Perfect place to grab a drink before/after dinner.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Such a hipster place to come to! But in a good way not a snobby way 
I had a few of their appetizers on the menu like deviled eggs and crab tots. Both were good! The drinks were good too. I really liked how there is a large row of options of beer/cider on tap behind the bar. It looks very clean and presented well. 
I'd come back here another night if Im ever in the area
author: Natasha I.

description:
I've been here twice and love this spot! It's clean but doesn't feel sterile, there's great seating options for small and larger parties, and the food and beverage selection is awesome. Your girlfriend won't be grossed out by any grime anywhere and it's casual enough for the dudes to be comfortable.

I've had wine, beer, and cider here - it's a great place to meet up with friends for a happy hour or even a dinner. A major plus is that you can actually hear what they're all saying too. The service is really spectacular too, your table won't be littered with glasses and plates at this place. 

Tip: When you sit at a table on the second floor, don't sit directly above the bar. There were intermittent smells of bleach for the 2.5 hours I was there with friends. But hey, kudos for keeping it clean!
author: N D.

description: Hopwater is probably one of my favorite little spots for an afterwork beer and a cheese plate. Everything is well priced and they have a well curated and ever changing beer and wine list and extremely reasonable small plates. A well stocked cheese plate for 4$ is a rare find.
author: saachi d.

description:
Great selection of beer on Tap.  31 beers, i believe it's mostly local California beers. (which are AWESOME, California has some of the best breweries).  Cool spot, low key.  Order your food / beer from the bar.   Find your own seat somewhere.   They give you a number and come find you when the food comes out of the kitchen.  The food came out SUPER fast.   My salad probably came out in 5 minutes.  

Even though the place was packed, turn over was fast.  So just wait, and you'll find a spot.  

Had the deviled Eggs with crab / crab tater tots / crab salad and the sliders.  My fave was the salad and the tater tots.  Sliders... I could pass on those.
author: Sam C.

description: Awesome place. Great brews on tap and good food. The deviled eggs and the pulled pork are excellent. The bar tenders had great suggestions of local brews to try. Will be back.
author: Ben S.

description: Excellent!  Not a fancy place by any means but exceeded all expectations once inside.  Food was great.  We had the pork and the burger sliders, salad, chicken tenders, and deviled eggs.  Took my wife, 11 year old and 8 year old and we all left glad we walked in.  Thank you hopwater!
author: KJ G.

description: Blackened cod salad....so good! Couldn't finish it...portion is hearty..and I am a big eater. Delish! A little loud for my taste but I'm over 40 honey. Would definitely recommend.
author: Iris R.

description:
What to say about this place...in in town visiting friends, and met up with them for drinks at Hopwater. We were cozy sitting 6 to one of the small booths upstairs. Everyone was getting beers round after round and I got the Cobb salad which was pretty good. We didn't have to deal with many servers or people who worked there because we were upstairs, but the one guy who dropped my salad off gave me attitude for having my number stick thing on the ground. Sorry, I've never been here before and assumed you called numbers...don't be rude to me for something that was an accident.

We eventually moved to a bigger booth downstairs and had a couple mini beer glasses that broke during that move. My friends wanted to play quarters in them, but we decided that probably wasn't the best idea in public when clearly the staff either didn't like us to begin with or just wasn't friendly in general. One girl came over and started to take the glasses and said "these are broken and they're dirty anyways, so I'm gonna take them....." with more attitude than I've ever been spoken to with in a bar or restaurant. Just after that, someone went up to the bar and ordered another round. The bartender said the beers would be brought to our table since we were right next to the cash register and there were 6. The woman who brought them was so unnecessarily rude about it, saying "we don't normally do this, so next time get them yourselves". It was a simple misunderstanding no need to be sassy.

So I have worked in restaurants for 6 years. Since when has it become ok to talk to your customers like this? This is my first time in San Francisco, so maybe it's just a culture thing? I work in a ski resort in Colorado, at one of the busiest restaurants, and if I EVER spoke to a customer with an attitude like I experienced at Hopwater last night, there is no doubt I would hear about it later. We had a couple misunderstandings at a bar none of us had been to before.....I'm sorry you find that reason to be rude. With the amount of beer consumed and dollars spent, you (whoever is reading this) absolutely need to make sure your employees get an attitude adjustment and learn how to work in the service industry so that they don't make their customers want to leave on the spot, no matter how good the beer and vibe is. 

Maybe it was an off night and everyone was pissed because it's Halloween weekend or because the Giants aren't in the World Series...I don't know. But something over there needs to change.
author: Elana M.

description: You can't go wrong with anything on the menu here. We went a couple times as we were staying at the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins for about a week and Hopwater is only a couple blocks away. We probably tried about 5 different dishes from the menu and they all exceeded expectations. Draft beer selection was extensive and local and there was a variety of unique brews to try...and the staff was very knowledgeable about them. Very cool atmosphere with a casual crowd mixed in with "suits" (lol) around happy hour.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Theres only 1 time in your life when you know, everything is perfect. That happened to me here. I would have my wedding here if I could. 

The scene is great. The drinks good. Even the bathroom smells delicious. 

Id love to die and be buried in this place.

5x infinity stars
author: Bonerjams04 J.

description:
I absolutely loved this place when Boyfriend and I stopped in here for a drink with a good friend of ours! She met us out here after work for dinner and some drinks, and this was the first stop of the night for us.

The guys pulling the beers behind the bar were super friendly and very knowledgeable about what was coming out of the taps. There was already a pretty decent crowd here for after-work-on-a-Friday, but we had no problem snagging seats at the bar and ordering beers. The place is very small though, so be prepared to stand around with your glass if you don't manage to snag a seat right away.

The food looked amazing from what I saw, but sadly I didn't order anything. I will have to next time though!

I loved that there were so many local brews on tap -- some of which I hadn't seen anywhere else yet (and I've been a few places with beer now, so I feel like I can justifiably say this). I never felt pressured to order more and I never felt like I was being rushed through my visit. This is the perfect place to decompress after a long week of work.

I will definitely be back, Hopwater!
author: Anna W.

description:
This place is amazing. The beer is great and the staff are super knowledgeable and able to help. I didn't know any of the brews, but I could describe my likes (hoppy and strong) and the bartender made some excellent recommendations. 

The food is also great, but kinda limited. The crab tots are a must have, however.
author: Jack H.

description: It's got everything you would want in a great neighborhood pub - loads of solid craft beer, delicious steak fries, great seating, good music and a nice crowd. Service is very friendly and fast too!
author: Marisa S.

description:
mmmm, such a good, rotating selection of beers on tap! everything is super fresh, and i've been able to find something new and delish everytime i've been here.  

got the crab tater tots the last time, but they're a bit underwhelming considering the rave reviews on here. definitely open to trying other items though! and in such a convenient location. thumbs up!
author: Christina L.

description:
Great new find! Like this place a lot. Great beer selection and a few decent wines as well.

Really big fan of their deviled eggs and beet salad! I can make a meal of just those - so good!! 

Cool atmosphere as well, they play random movies (on silent) on huge TV's in the corner, and the upstairs seating is really nice. It kind of lines the room, which is an open almost warehouse-type space with a super high ceiling. 

Staff is friendly and accommodating. My date & I were there on a really busy Saturday night and the one food runner looked quite haggard, but he went out of his way to bring us a extra stool when he saw us asking people if their extras were free. So nice!! M

This is sure to become a regular spot for me.
author: Jinja R.

description: Craftastic!  Solid brew lineup with creative finger foods to snack on in between hoists.
author: Teyo B.

description:
I was on vacation in the city, so this was one of those places on the route to where I was headed. It had a relaxed space, a good looking menu with plenty of small bites, 30 taps, and a nearly full house that seemed to be enjoying all of the above. 

So this was not a full meal; I just had a couple of pints (very good variety of taps) and the chicken tenders, which were expertly prepared: light, moist, even the ends resisted toughening in the hot fat.  They were a bit stingy with the sauces that night, but otherwise I'd visit again when I need of a snack and a pint.
author: Josh M.

description:
Great selection of craft beers. One of the best I've seen in the city. Blueberry ale & Belgian stout were my favorites.
You need to go to the counter to order anything. They have a sign that reads "Order here" so it's easy to find it.
author: Muhip T.

description: I thought this was a really great spot to grab a brew.  The place is large enough and the bar area where the taps are are really cool.  They have such a great variety so it covers all tastes.  Definitely a great spot to gather a large crew to nosh and drink.
author: Kirsten M.

description: The closest thing to Father's Office I've found here in SF. It's got a decent beer selection, a good amount of seating and decently-priced food. Nothing stood out as amazing, but it was a chill place to grab a couple beers and relax after work.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: Here on business and used to all the finest that SF has to offer.  Hands down, without exception, the best experience I've had in the City. Down-to-earth, chill staff; relaxed vibe and neighborhood street cred give this place must-visit status. The food is exceptional as is the rotating selection of beers. Do not pass up the crab tater tots and deep fried cauliflower!
author: Jathan S.

description: Great fries. Otherwise average bar food. We tried the cod tater tots but over cooked. Nice selection of craft beers. Order and pay for food at the bar.
author: WTroy B.

description:
No Service! you literally have to go grab a rag if you want a clean table, beers are reasonably priced, served reasonably cold and the line moves reasonably quickly, but the staff behind the bar was, well tired. We couldn't sit a group of six after 3 hours, but the staff was ok with a couple holding a booth and making out while drinking customers were standing.  

Prices get this place 2 stars, and the third star is for the crab-stuffed tots.  They were over-priced, but quick to come out and very very good.
author: Spenser T.

description: If you are thinking about going here, do yourself a favor. Call a Lyft or uber and go, right now. Great beer, nice people and good food. Highly recommend!!
author: Todd S.

description: Diverse and large selection of beers. Each beer I've tried has been unique and fresh and amazing. There's bar style seating in the front, booths upstairs (cool view overlooking the whole bar) and restaurant style seating in the back.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
This bar does not have waiters.
This bar was noisy.
When I arrived here I thought it would be great by the reviews indicating 4.5 stars.  The beer selection was impressive but I give them 2 stars because they never asked me for what I wanted.
author: Luke M.

description: Hopwater is a great addition to the SF beer scene.  The interior layout is cool, the bartenders are knowledgable and friendly, the food is very good for a beer bar (more high-end than most), and the beer list is solid.  They even have a few healthier food options that are very good.  My friend and I tried a butternut squash "soup of the day", which was great!   As were the pulled pork sliders with slaw.  Not many top notch beer spots leave me talking about excellent food.  Enjoy!
author: N Y.

description:
Hopwater is awesome! Came to celebrate a friend's birthday and was able to score the tall table. They have a million beers on tap and I got the cider. It was refreshing and had just the right about of fruit flavor, kind of tasted like soda. The crispy fried chicken sandwich was AWESOME, super flavorful and had just the right about of crunch. I recommend getting the fried chicken sandwich instead of the chicken strips. The strips were no bueno and you only get 4 itty bitty pieces.

I would definitely come back here again to try other beers!
author: Joyce M.

description:
Beer should *always* be complimented with two things, great food and more beer. 

I was staying a couple of blocks away in the Financial District so I decided to scope a few places out while I was here. I had just flown in, dropped my shit at the hotel, had my first meeting and proceeded to get numb drunk here at Hopwater. 

After walking around for a bit, the commotion of this bar on a Wednesday night gave me a great feeling about being here. I sat at the bar and had a couple of the Saison on tap before busting in to their highly rated Fried Chicken Sandwich. 

First of all, the selection here is pretty damn great. I sat at the bar, which provides ample elbow room, and faces this wall of 35 taps. Each one corresponding to a craft brew labeled on the chalkboard menu above. 

Overhearing the bartender (and possibly owner), it seems like they change their selection fairly often as he said he was going down to Santa Cruz to pick up a new keg of something. I like hearing those kinds of things. I am by no means a beer snob, but you will never catch me with a bottle/can of coors or bud in my hands. 

Anyways, the SANDWICH. Okay, wowuhhhh. Juicy tender pieces of fried chicken breast tenders sit on a soft french roll bun, soaking up all the garlicky-herby goodness that chimichurri has to offer. Melting mozzarella cheese graced every crevice of that chickmeat while thinly sliced tomatoes waited to be devoured in a single bite. 

Paired with handcut steak fries, crisped to a perfect golden brown, this was an excellent meal to end my Wednesday and start my short trip in Frisco. 

I nightcapped with the barley wine that was also on tap, and I have to admit, I don't remember how I got to my hotel so quickly. It must have been that I walked/tumbled down some steep ass hill. Anyways, I'm still alive and breathin'! 

I will make a point to stop in here again if I am near Union Square.
author: Thomas O.

description: The best part of moving to the lower Nob Hill is infect being within a 3 min walk from Hopwater. Amazing, rotating selection of awesome beers on tap, food that is good but not all that special (We go for the libations anyway). Always packed, with good reason. We will miss this place when we move.
author: Chintu P.

description:
I often have difficulty differentiating my overall experience at a place from the bare bones of the establishment: food/drink quality, customer service, aesthetic/atmosphere, and so on and so forth.

Not only did I have a stellar experience here, I am realizing that this would not have changed had I been alone and not with a friend. 

The appetizers were incredible, not to mention they were at our table within mere minutes of ordering them.  My friend and I split the crab deviled eggs, chicken tenders, and cobb salad--a perfect pre-concert combo, and each indulged in a Voodoo Belgian Ale. Delicious! 

The overall atmosphere of this joint was late-20's professionals kicking off their Saturday night with a tap list of more than 30 beers (most of which were new to me).  

The buildings infrastructure was sleek and modern, and while arriving at this location from the BART required walking up hill several blocks, it was well worth the effort.  

Definitely recommend stopping by for beers and pre-going out dishes.
author: Rachel H.

description: Average is what best describes it. No music, chill vibe. Reasonable selection of beers. Passable food. Ntn great. Probably wdnt come back.
author: Nikhil R.

description: Great food! Very fresh n tasty.   Cool ambiance to just chill.   Lots of beer on tap to choose from.
author: Hermine O.

description:
Love it. Checked this place out last night. Great food- deviled eggs with bacon jam, the chicken sandoozle, beet salad, and truffle brie cheese! D E L I C I O U S. Maui Wait IPA is the drink of choice!
Bartender was really excited to answer our questions about the beer too. We picked correctly. GO HERE.
author: Michael C.

description:
Hopwater has a good selection of beer on tap and I was impressed by the quality of the beer on offer. I tried their Amber ale and the black lager, and both were really good quality brews.

The food is acceptable, nothing very special but worth the sacrifice considering that you will enjoy some quality drinks in return.

The staff is really helpful and the service is good, though I missed a free wifi
author: Vinay K.

description: Enjoyed this place so much I had to write a review for it. Awesome craft beer selection, not pricey, it wasn't crowded on a Friday night (although it was later) and the bartenders were really friendly. Just an overall great experience. Will definitely be back soon!
author: Ciera L.

description: Try the burger and fries, skip the deviled eggs. You really got to go to the place for the beer selection. Great neighborhood hang out spot
author: Sundeep R.

description: Great beer selection! Fun and sexy bartenders. It's a solid yes!
author: Life I.

description: I would regular this spot all the time if I worked closer. Very solid beer selection here. I absolutely love the cozy atmosphere at Hopwater Distribution. If you've ever been to Portland, OR, the atmosphere here is very reminiscent of being at a bar in Portland. I can't say anything about the food since I only had a few drinks here, but just looking around, it seems like the burger here is very popular.
author: Austin W.

description: Fun spot with a nice beer selection and fun small eats. The wine menu is limited but the selections are decent. Good service and atmosphere.
author: melita s.

description: Hopwater Distribution was a great dinner choice. The hipster gastropub had great food. I had the arugula and stone fruit salad, and it was great. I would definitely recommend this spot to most. The only downfall is that you have to order your food at the bar, and when it's busy, you can lose your table.
author: Jake M.

description:
Where am?  Beer Heaven?!

I am writing this review as I sit at at their copper top bar and being serviced by John, Michaela and Edward. So impressed.

The beer selection is top notch. My favorites? The higher the ABV the more likely I am to order it.

Cement shoes
Green Flash
Prankster

FOOD - tator tots stuffed with crab?  It hit the G-Spot.

Pissed Gonzaga won their sweet sixteen game but that has nothing to do with this joint.

Thank you for the ambiance and making eye contact with my beer to make sure its always full.

Xo,
Two girls who LOVE beer.
author: Jenny B.

description: I'm so happy that a cool beer bar finally opened up in this area! I've had drinks at Hopwater on multiple occasions now, sometimes for happy hour, and other times after dinner. They have a great local selection of beers that rotate frequently. If you are looking for something out of the ordinary, I highly recommend spending some time here. I haven't had any of their food, but it always looks good when people around us are eating. The crowd is a bit odd, not the friendliest bunch of people. Otherwise, the decor is industrial and chic, and there's plenty of seating.
author: Regina L.

description:
really happy about the fact that more bars are popping up in this neighborhood!

on a saturday night, hopwater wasn't too crowded. there was open seating upstairs and downstairs, but it was by no means empty. hopwater has a pretty wide range of beers to choose from that are numbered so you don't have to fumble over names of beers you might not know how to pronounce ;)

but beyond the beers, hopwater is a great place to go with a big group of friends. there's room to stand and sit, and food is still served late into the night! well, they were still serving food at 10 pm, which is great. the bacon jam deviled eggs and crab tater tots = amazing. the chicken sandwich was also good, but my favourite was their fries that came with the chicken! i haven't had fries that good in soooo long. aaaand they were piping hot! 

anyway, what makes hopwater distribution really stand out is that THE MUSIC ISN'T TOO LOUD. this makes me so happy. i could actually socialize with people!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Met a friend there on a Wednesday night and was able to find seating pretty easily. The place had a very cool atmosphere and a rustic feel to it. The bar itself was well stocked with California beers. Bartenders were nice and knowledgeable and helped me select a couple off the massive beer list.

I will definitely be going back with some of my beer snob friends.
author: Ian F.

description:
30 microbrews on draft and they rotate them quite often. Excellent variety as well from lagers to heavier ales and porters. 

The staff is incredibly friendly; don't be shy about asking them for a suggestion from what appears initially to be an overwhelming selection. They're also pretty good about comping regulars with a free round every now and then.

The food has highs and lows. The chicken sandwich is excellent, succulent chicken breast augmented nicely by the chimichurri. 

The steak fries are incredible; crispy on the outside and airy on the inside. The crab tater tots are really more of a mini croquet but are delicious nonetheless. The deviled eggs are also good as the bacon jam adds a meaty sweetness to the richness of the yolk. 

I personally enjoy the brisket sliders but they seem to be hit or miss for others.

My only recommendation to avoid is the chicken tenders as they aren't crispy and seemed a little dried out.

The decor is awesome as well from the repurposed illuminated arrow marquee to all the classic brick interior.

This is a big happy hour spot so get there at 5:30 to get a table, especially on Thursday or Friday.
author: T.J. S.

description:
30 local beer taps, simple bar food concept. No wait staff so you have to order at the bar. Loved the concept.

I had the dutchess crab tater tots and sliders. The food was excellent. I wish that the tots came with a dipping sauce.
author: Scott B.

description: This brew pub will carry 35 micro California brews you won't find in Safeway, and they will all be on tap! They have a chef who specializes in pairing good food with beer, so this will be a casual place serving craft beers and well matched food. This comes from the people who bring you the immense variety and mixology knowledge at 83 Proof in downtown San Francisco and the down home goodness of the  Dogpatch Saloon. Final touches are being done, so expect it to open very early  in 2014!
author: Wanugee N.

description:
Some local friends recommended this place, happy they did! Hopwater has a fantastic layout, the upper level has a great viewing area for people watching and there are a few TVs with sports on. Plus it's not too loud for a conversation. The space feels open with the high ceilings, the staff is friendly and greeted us with a smile, and the tap wall has beer/brewery/alcohol content info and an interesting aesthetic. Simple, but well done. The beers we had were very flavorful, and all 30 beers on tap were $6 or $7.

We really enjoyed the deviled eggs with jam, and the burger and chicken sandwich were juicy and excellent. Their fries were also very good. The food was hot and came quickly which makes a big difference when you're hungry. I'd definitely come back to this spot if I'm in SF again. Good value, along with everything else. Also, bathroom was clean. Table was clean. Good presentation, plenty of napkins. Comfortable seating.

There's really only one small negative, it isn't readily obvious that you order at the register when you walk in. Took us 20 seconds to figure it out. They have a couple signs with chalk, but I noticed a couple other people had a bad reaction related to this aspect and that's too bad. Hopefully they fix this tiny thing for the best customer experience.
author: Anonymous D.

description: Chill place. Come by for a good variety of local brews. Averages $6-$8 for 16 oz beers
author: Mark M.

description:
This spot opened right across from my work, and immediately became my after work drinking spot. Great, very broad selection of beers in a chill, kind of rustic atmosphere. Great sandwiches too. 

They have constantly rotating beers on tap, so saying they have 30 beers actually doesn't even do them justice.

The service is pretty relaxed, but very efficient, which is good because this place is always always busy.
author: Alexander W.

description: What a wonderful find on our weekend trip to San Francisco! The outside was rather unassuming, so my wife and I almost walked right past it. But once we figured out we were at the right place, we knew we found our kind of restaurant. Just grab a menu and find a table, and then come and place your order at the bar and they'll bring it to you. I started off with the bacon jam deviled eggs and then had the house blend burger and the Rasputin's Imperial Stout. Give me a good burger and a stout, and I'm happy....add in some deviled eggs and I'm in heaven! We will definitely be dining here again the next time we come back to San Francisco.
author: Kris G.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!! Rotating local taps for which even the pickiest of beer snobs will be satisfied.  It does get slightly crowded/loud at times but that is the environment that you should be looking for in a great neighborhood watering hole.  The food was delicious (BURGER ADD EVERYTHING) and every time i come here I end up staying hours longer than I had intended. yummmmmmm i need a beer.
author: Raina D.

description: Awesome gastro-pub type of place in San Fran.  Its casual easy and very reasonably priced.  They only have beer though; hence 4 stars.  If they were more of a mixology bar, which would totally fit their personality, they would get 5 stars.  I highly recommend the deviled eggs, chicken tenders and the beef sliders.  There is much more here that I want to try.
author: Aman S.

description:
Fun spot! Stopped in on a busy Friday night. You order drinks and food at the end of the bar, then turn your eagle eyes on to find seating.  Weekdays may not be as bad, but it was busy busy on a Friday night. It's all open seating, first come first serve, including the tables on second floor.  This was the only downside. We got lucky when two bar seats opened up right before our food came.  

We tried the fried chicken sando and deviled eggs with bacon jam. Can't really go wrong with those ingredients :) Tasty food and drinks, fun atmosphere, and friendly, hard-working staff. I'd call it a winner! Oh! And they have a few TVs scattered around, made for an even livelier crowd with the sports games on.
author: Brianna M.

description: Great bartender, knew his stuff. Awesome beer, yummy food. Great vibe for a rainy night when you just wanna drink beer. I see myself having awesome first dates here. I sort of want to stay forever.
author: Erin D.

description:
Get thee to the Hopwater. 
I was impressed with the buzz and reviews and so the Sharkfin and i set out on a Saturday night (early) tor partake in three of our favourite things, ALE, Food and More Ale! 
The Ale selection is fantastic, Take a moment to study the selection as it is likely to be busy and your time with Le Tender de Bar is apt to be rushed. Once satiated, repair for a study of the menu before Round II.
We had great deviled eggs with a bacon topping, Pulled Pork sliders and buttermilk fried chicken tenders. The food was delirious and quite reasonably priced. So 3 small plates and we're happy and giggling. We will be back at an off hour to snuggle into a quiet corner and really relax the nice atmosphere and great food and Ale offerings.

No idea where one would park but it is a hefty hike from Powell St BART up the hill thus deserving of the tasty reward at the end.
author: Mark S.

description:
I love this place.

Came here with the mister and ordered 4 beers total, tried their chicken sammich, and their crab taters. 

The clear winner was their White Chocolate Stout. I normally dislike stouts due to the heavy taste but this - O.M.G. it was delicious. I don't remember the beer I had previously but that stout was DELISH! Not sure if they still carry it, such a bummer if they don't.

Haven't been back since October. But I've been dying to go back.. Parking here is a paiiiinn. (Uber it is!) Hoping they have an option to get a growler of that yummy stout. 

One sad thing, no beer flights. Spoke to the owner and he said he was still trying to find an easy way to bring flights upstairs. Its okay though, all the more reasons to come back and try more beer.

It's a mission of mines to go back this month! mmm I love beer.
author: Mare L.

description: Nice Ambiance, good selection of beers and good food. The deviled eggs were delicious and I had an amazing cobb salad. Will be back, although I'd probably avoid on on busier nights as it gets crowded rather quickly.
author: Daniella O.

description: This place is awesome! Great beers on draft and seriously delicious food. Feels like a real local spot. We'd definitely be coming here frequently if we lived nearby! Such a cool atmosphere!
author: Meg M.

description: Food looked wonderful here, and beers were of a unique and good selection. I would stray from here since it's pretty pricey, but after a payday, it's worth a nice beer on tap
author: Kerry G.

description:
I WISH I absolutely loved this place because I'm only a block away. Owners please read and get some higher bar stools at the bar. They are such an awkward height and I'm not even short. They are much too low, it's weird to eat. Also, get more TV's please!!!!!

great beer and food none the less but it's just uncomfortable eating at the bar due to the stools.
author: Jackie P.

description:
A nice spot situated in Union Square to
get beers and grub. They have a nice large selection of beers here.The angus burger was good and you can customize it like you want (unlike certain hipster gastropubs that don't let you swap out ingredients because it's a house rule...) it was a decent size burger that goes well with your beer.  I was left still feeling a little hungry after devouring it but it was cool - I just ordered another beer for that problem... I mean, if you're at a bar with a ton of selection of beer you probably shouldn't be here for the food anyways.
author: Fred O.

description: A new taproom in SF near union square, and definitely worth locating, and more local feeling than touristy.  The place was an old laundromat, and they did a good job with the bar with lots of seating, and a gastropub food menu.  I love the variety of taps (30 rotating taps), and the owners do a good job of locating some rare and interesting ones.  I tried the Ruhstaller Black IPA and OBC sticky zipper, both were quite good.  You should try the half-pints, so you can sample a few different ones.  I will definitely come back here when visiting the area.
author: Dan M.

description: Great place to stop by and have a bite n drink , Fresh local organic food with a 30 tap selection of beers ...
author: Ali S.

description: Rotating beer menu (over 30 on tap always) - all local Cali microbrews - small gourmet bites and entrees - Nob Hill/Tendernob locals bar - my favorite bar in the area... Soon to be yours!
author: Brett B.

description: The beer selection here is really good (but not amazing) with I believe 22+ beers on tap. They usually have an interesting variety and cycle through different selections to keep the regulars happy with new choices. The food here however, if you want to eat dinner, isnt very good. It is basic bar food with very little to choose from. The appetizers though are really yummy but on the pricey side. This is a good place to either stop by on your way to dinner, hit up for a happy hour with people or swing by for just a beer but dinner shouldnt be had here. The service is always friendly and you order at the register for food and the seating is open for you to snag when (if) available. It can be busy here too so you might not always find a place to put your plate down if you opt for food. The interior is really beautiful with exposed brick and nice lighting elements. overall it is a great spot for a good beer and a nice appetizer but again, skip the full meal.
author: Luis M.

description: Loved this little find!   My husband and I just landed in San Francisco and this was our first stop. It was late night, but the bar tender knew more about beer than just about anyone I know and was very happy to tell you about it.  The place had a great energy and we'll be going back before our trip is over.
author: Tracie T.

description:
If you're in the area and want to grab some beers...stop by this place. Plenty of different beers to choose from; light/crisp to dark/heavy. 

Bartenders seem pretty well informed about the beers they have on tap.
author: Frank M.

description:
I went here the other night with a few college buddies and the wives/girlfriends and we had a great time just hanging out. We chose this place because of the beer selection, like everyone else. It's impressive. 

Beers are served in an imperial pint glass or a snifter and they are either $6 or $7. They also have wine options between $7-12 a glass. These beers apparently rotate frequently and had a bunch of interesting varietals to try. Food: we ordered the Dungeness crab tater tots, which were bizarre and only had like 5 or 6 pieces, so we didn't get anything else. Crab mixed with potato severely diluted the point of the crab and the end result was mushy with most the taste coming from the sauce. Pass.

Seating upstairs feels crammed, it's stuffy. and loud. I definitely recommend finding a spot on the ground floor next to the glorious beer board and beautiful tap wall. Much more space and comfortable even though the place was packed with brew drinking enthusiasts! ..What was nice, it was a good crowd, not a bunch of snobbish, hipster "douche-baggery" that often fills places like this in other places in the city. 

The major drawback, like anywhere in this area of the city, is the parking situation..so I am not counting that against Hopwater...but it made our night start much later than anticipated. Nearby parking lots can fetch up to $30 flat rate. 

Overall, we definitely enjoyed our time and trying some neat and tasty suds. Because we live north of the GG Bridge, parking for an hour made this destination tough as a rendezvous point. We didn't try enough food to provide a fulfilling review on that subject, but the appetizer we did try was mediocre. Next time I am in the city with some friends I will probably cab over and do it again! Cheers!
author: Ryan B.

description: Good beer selection. Rather loud at times. Limited food choices.
author: So N.

description: Restaurant/sports bar. They have a variety of good beers and small food options. A good early night stop before going out later
author: Jim N.

description:
This just opened up down the street from my place. My local friends and I met here on a Friday happy hour and I must say we were impressed. We didn't eat but the beer selection they have on tap is top notch. The service was quick and it wasn't overly crowded. The space is great - they have kept the brick walls and some of the old molding that was there and added some clean looking wood updates. They have a few TVs in random places and I would just say this place doesn't seem like a good fit for TVs. I am also a fan of not having a TV in the bedroom so there ya go. 

I look forward to eating here soon and frequenting the new hot spot in the neighborhood.
author: Kim M.

description: Not your average yuppie bar. Very down to earth owner and wait staff... Very attentive and an amazing beer selection that changes frequently. Very local, very recommended!
author: Phil S.

description:
Good beers,  OK starters,  delicious chicken sando. 
Broad selection of beers on tap including one of my favorites,  Pranqster. 
Devils eggs with bacon jelly, were good.
Dungeness tots were OK.  
Chicken sando was super yummy, the chimmchuri sauce is Great call. 
Mixed happy hour crowd,  although no happy hour specials.  
 Table service and ordering would be a nice addition rather than having to go to the bar.
author: Kelle K.

description: What a find! We were meeting some friends for dinner on a Saturday night in SF with zero in the way of reservations or plans. As I always say, "Yelp and ye shall find." Parking is a bit of a challenge because, um, San Francisco but we got insanely lucky with a spot a few feet from the door. There's a great selection of community tables and small 2/4 tops. The food was amazing. Don't miss the crab tots or the crab deviled eggs. If you see the word "crab," eat it. My fried chicken sandwich was fantastic. I had to fend off my girlfriend with a butter knife so she wouldn't steal it. And beer! As I'm a big fan of Altamont Beerworks, I was thrilled to see two selections of theirs (I went with the Maui Waui since HD was smart enough to order enough so they have it when everyone else has run out). Another favorite of mine (Napa Smith Hopagedon) was on the list too. The service was beyond friendly. You do order at the bar and get a number on a stick. A runner brings the food. But in ordering and closing my tab, the bartenders were especially charming and knowledgable about beer. I almost don't want to write this review because I'd love to have one place in the City where I can find great food and beer AND a table on a Saturday night but fair is fair. Great people, great food, great beer, great atmosphere. Check it out but don't tell anyone, OK?
author: Brian B.

description: Good beer and tasty food.   Chef makes it a point to stop by and make sure you are happy.  Will definitely be back often.
author: Julia S.

description:
Solid brewery. I really like this addition to the Union Square neighborhood - I've always had trouble finding a good bar that wasn't crazy loud or crazy expensive that is a convenient location to meet out of town friends :)

Super spacious and nice, friendly staff. Dungeness Tater Tots not to be missed :)
author: Food E.

description: I really liked the different types of beers that were available here.  The addition of the food made the flavor.  We had the deviled eggs that were amazing.  I also had the blue cheese burger that just melted with every bite.  Excellent.
author: Robert D.

description: Best mushroom soup I ever tried in my life. Good selection of beer. The only one thing I dislike is that you have to order food and beer at counter. So stupid.
author: Alexander M.

description:
They say they love beers. It shows: 30 draft taps, very impressive! The bartender recommended half moon bay IPA. It is very fresh, tastes sweet at the first, then comes a bit of bitterness as usual IPA.     

I like their space design: airy and rustic modern, specially the way they display beer taps.  A neighborhood gem!
author: Emmy P.

description: Came here for dinner and drinks with a few friends one evening, and it was definitely a cool place to check out. You order food and drinks by the bar area, which makes it pretty easy to get everything you want at one time. Once you place your order, they will bring your dish to your table. I ordered a friend chicken sandwich that I was pretty good. Nothing too spectacular with the sandwich, but it got the job done and was satisfying enough. I also ordered a cider to go with the meal, which was enjoyable. I think that next time I would opt to try one of the many beers that they have on tap. Seating was found quite easily, although the tables were a bit small and more equipped to hold two people to a table. Definitely a neat place to scope out if you are in the area.
author: Daniel H.

description: I made the hike uphill to see if the reviews were true and they were! The crab tater tots are incredible and I had one of the best beers I've ever tasted. Great spot and worth the hike. Casual. Filled with chatter and good energy. Good for going solo, with friends, or a date. Two thumbs up!
author: Shawna J.

description:
We were staying at a hotel nearby and happened upon Hopwater Distribution for some Happy Hour drinks and a snack.  Being from Denver, we love our beers, and Hopwater had some really great options on tap.  We also had a cheese/sausage plate and they had some great local options for cheese and meats.  Yes, you have to go up to the bar to order (we sat at the bar the first visit) but that doesn't bother us at all.

Came back a few nights later for a late night drink and the place was packed!  Seems like a great spot for both HH and late night drinks.
author: Kendra B.

description:
High expectations, left disappointed.

I found this place on Yelp and wanted a place close to where I was staying (Union Square).  When I first walked in I had high expectations - pretty cool decor, lots of positive energy.  The  bartenders were attentive and friendly, the crab meat tater tots were pretty good (as mentioned by others).

They have about 30 different beers but nothing truly special - they are all available at other bars. The burger and sliders were less than average, the steak fries were greasy and cold, and when I mentioned it to the guy running food, he acted as if I was inconveniencing him  I kept the fries.
author: Sean D.

description:
First timer here... Happy find!! Wonderful beer selection on tap and friendly staff!! We order Dungeness Tater Tots, (heavenly, light, not greasy) and Deviled Eggs with Crab (nice amount of crab on each one!), both were awesomely executed... 
I'll be back!!
author: Chuck L.

description: Decent. Low-key bar with a few TVs. Food was relatively average -- the best thing was the fries!
author: Viet N.

description:
This place is great. Went out for my birthday this year with a group of ten or so and had a good time enjoying unique Californian beer. The food is good too, but is limited. 
I would peg this place as a great place to come after work with a few people and have some beers and a good snack. Happy hour of sorts. It may be crouded so getting a seat during peak hours could be difficult,  but their is plenty of standing room. 
I must defiantly will be back, and if I lived closer would make this place one of my standard stomping grounds. 
Similar to toronados (sf)  and beer revolution (oakland) but upscale, a good place to go with coworkers.
author: Nathan K.

description:
Great selection of beers and great food! 

The reason for a 3 star review is that I really don't enjoy having to find/fight for my own table and then go stand in line every time I want to order something. If this place had servers I would frequent it more often.
author: Kayla R.

description: Awesome atmosphere... 30 Draft Beer varieties! Knowledgable bartender, trendy crowd... Food looked awesome, even though we didn't order any!
author: Allison M.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite bars in SF. Hopwater is a great place to grab a beer after work. Awesome setup and vibe, and the food is really good too!

They have a top-notch selection of beers and the bartenders are very friendly. So glad this place opened up close to my house!
author: Lauren W.

description:
Went here for food and drinks. I want to start of with the decor of this place- A+. Friends,family,date,coworkers- the way this place is set up will be ideal for any company.
What's on the tap are mostly local beers. They a have a wide variety and a good pour. You'll find some very interesting ales, stouts, and ciders over here. My favorite was the Pecan stout.
We also ordered some food. The highlight were the deviled eggs and meat charcuterie. Deviled eggs were quite possibly the most amazing appetizers I've ever had.
