The spotlight from the charcuterie was definitely on the duck liver mousse. Smooth, creamy and delicious. We also ordered a Burger which was delicious and juicy(fries could use some help). However, stay away from chicken tenders here. Pretty soggy, lackluster flavor and a tiny portion. 
 To sum it all - it was a great experience at hopwater, but they could use some extra staff behind the bar (gets pretty busy) and maybe work on their portion size.
author: Dhruv B.

description: Stopped by last Wednesday and it was still poppin! After squishing into a corner and watching the tables in the back like a hawk, we were able to get some seats. They don't take orders at the table though, so make sure to know what beer you want and send a representative to order everything. As a not so great and super picky beer drinker, I was able to find some beers that were good but hands down, the best thing there were the steak fries (I know, lame sauce, but they were AMAZING!) and honestly, better than the crab tater tots and chicken tenders we had as well.
author: Leina K.

description:
Fantastic beers and amazing food, this place is the perfect mid-week/weekend meet up place. 

Feels original and a place to get comfy in!
author: Daniel R.

description: Amazing beer selection, knowledgeable staff, and a cool laid back environment. The place is clean, not divey, but still has character. The food was more expensive than some late night smash face bar food, but it was certainly of a higher quality. I had the ghost sausage and local Humboldt fog and they were both delicious.
author: Joseph H.

description:
As much as im a beer snob and pretty picky about the new places - these guys are awesome! Bartender even let me pick into the Holly of them all - the beer fridge on the other side of THE wall ( oh it was beautiful :) )
Good beer selection, no problem to try befor getting, okay food ( we got fried chicken sandwich with cut french fries)
Awesome ambiance, dimmed lights, somewhat loud but totally bearable. 
If in the area - definitely will come back!!!
author: Alex S.

description:
Best new spot in this area. Superb selection of craft (California breweries only) beers on tap and knowledgeable, super nice bartenders. 

The space is big and open with lots of seating options, so you can sit along the huge bar, in nooks around the edges at small tables or stools, at high tables with stools, at one of a few booths for bigger groups or in the back at tables where I saw more than one pair of parents with young children doing dinner.

That's to say nothing of the upper deck featuring booth-like pews in two- and four-tops. 

Oh, and the burger is amazing. Also has two flatscreens, so not optimal for sports watching but there in case you need it.
author: Derek S.

description: I finally got to give this neighborhood bar a try as they had opened a few weeks back, and they are busy all the time.  Hopwater is built in a historic spot with original brick walls with tables on two levels - very charming with a warm ambiance!  They have tons of beer on tap, and I think they let you sample beers to narrow down your choice.  It was crowded so I made my choices based on brief descriptions on the chalkboard menu above the bar.  They also serve bites - the dungeness crab puffs were mmm good and so were the deviled eggs.  It gets quite loud as it is quite popular, but it is a great place to make new friends or catch up over a cold beers and appetizers.  I can't wait to go back!  Love it!
author: Maile N.

description:
Great bartenders, great beer, and tasty food.

Can't go wrong.

My only complaint would be the hard walls and floor reverberate a ton of noise so even though the place wasn't super packed it was very loud. I bet the place is deafening when full (then again, maybe the bodies help with the accoustics).

In any event, the mushroom gumbo made an imprint on my taste buds and I will be back next time I'm in the bay for craft beer and food!
author: Dustin P.

description: Excellent beer selection always on rotation. Haven't tried enough of the food to really review that, mainly because getting a seat/table here is always difficult. I recall it being fine but not noteworthy. I wish they would accept reservations! I will continue to come during the weekdays from time to time, but this place is always packed to the brim so I only go every few months. But is deserves all of the success it has seen. Awesome taproom.
author: Katie S.

description:
Dungeness tater tots are definitely the way to go! I also recommend the pulled pork sliders. 

Nice selection of beer. There's something for all tastes on the board.

Lively but laid back atmosphere. Good place to meet up with friends over good beer and bar bites.
author: Riz W.

description:
Amazing beer selection, and reasonably priced. APVs with the names, which is always appreciated. Good burger, limp fries. Get the bacon jam.

Holding back the star because they don't write food orders, and our orders came out slightly off as a result of the bartender's memory. Nothing dealbreaking, but I did miss those onions, and there was some confusion with other people's food as well when it showed up. Then again, that's what we get for trying to order food at a good bar on a saturday night.
author: Patrick S.

description: I love the simplicity of Hop Water.  California only made brews that change frequently to keep things interesting. A small brick warehouse look. Friendly bartenders. Had three pints of hoppy goodness; can't recall which ones, but all were very good. Tasty cheeseburger and fries to soak up the brewskis. HWD is a a couple blocks from Union Square, but not swarming with odd tourists as most probably don't want to climb the hill. That's good for those of us that make it through the door. Cheers!
author: Doug M.

description: A little tough to find a place to stand on a Saturday night, but there were lots of beer options.
author: Zachary C.

description:
I think this place must be in its peak. 

Crowded but no wait, awesome value, extensive beer list, great atmosphere, excelletn customer service... and one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. I mean the thing was phenomenal. Order it without any frills to experience the purity of perfection. It was cooked perfectly, seasoned mythically, arugula + pickles + tomatoes = perfection. The bun. The aioli. The awesomeness.

Oh yeah, and the beer. 5 out of 5 w/out hesitation.
author: Jake B.

description: First night in San Francisco and we found one of our favorite spots. We loved the brews and the food was spot on. We plan on hitting this place up everytime we visit the Bay Area!
author: Jose T.

description:
Smart set up, order at the counter and grab a seat. 30+ beers on tap and they know their beer.  
Food looks delicious, wasn't eating but friends were. 
I'm all about a great cold pint and good music, so pretty much my jam. 
Music was on point too. 
In this hood they are going to kill it. 
Welcome!
author: Crispy R.

description:
This location has been vacant and neglect for years, I mean 8+ years (if not longer.) Finally somebody has the determination to tackle it. 

City Beer has a great beer selection but am never able to find a seat to enjoy a beer with friends. 
 I am in no way knocking City Beer. Hopwater solves that problem for downtown folks. 

There are plenty of seating and the mezzanine provide a great view to people watch. The decor is simple but the details are exquisite.

The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. the Faction Triple IPA, left me speechless. 

My girlfriend does not consume alcohol so I got her a Coke. The carbonation is was kind flat, they offered me another one but still flat. They were nice enough to offer me a canned Pellegrino. 

When I went to close my tab, the total was almost twice what I had. It was an honest mistake, but always look at your itemized receipt when ever you dine out and the grocery store.

I only imbibed at this establishment so cannot review its food.

Thirty Californian beers on tap. Must...come...back...for more.

Thank you Hopwater. Muy Bueno!!!
author: Tony N.

description: If I had to go to one place for beer in San Francisco, this would be the place. It has an excellent selection of California microbrews, some tasty food, and a non-pretentious west coast industrial vibe that makes you want to come back again and again.
author: Rob K.

description: Amazing beers. Service wasn't the best, I have to wait  10 minutes till I get someone to attend me. Maybe the had a bad day.
author: Bruno A.

description: Good beers and food.  But like everything in SF-a bit overpriced. When did 3 beers and two appetizers start costing $70.
author: Blood W.

description: Awesome. Great beer selection - good IPAs and a nice sampling of coastal breweries. Great service - friendly and helpful. Nice atmosphere. Excellent Cobb salad - fried chicken and the rest as you'd expect.
author: Joshua L.

description: One of my absolute favorite beer bars in San Franciso, alwas an extremely reliable stop.  Great beers, good prices, excellent staff.  Easy to get to location, aside from the hills.  I can't say as I've eaten much here, but it was all good.  Hard to pass up a stop here.
author: Mike W.

description: Crab tater tots, deviled eggs, buttermilk chicken tenders, and so many craft beers. This bar kicks major butt. There's so much room to stand/sit, and you don't have to deal with hipsters, because, let's be honest, they don't have jobs, so they can't afford to frequent establishments such as this one. Bartenders are super attentive, and taps rotate often. Down. So down. Parking sucks, and prices are pretty high, but you know what area you're in.
author: Danny C.

description:
I have been waiting with bated breath for this place. I have pestered the owners for months as they prepared to open, and I couldn't be happier to tell you that it is F***ING AWESOME. 

Readers of my reviews will know that I am a snarky B who is unafraid to pan any place unworthy of praise. I flatter myself that it's saying something when I say that this place is absolutely worth it.

The beer selection is par excellence. While their menu is still in development, I just tried their steak fries. Full disclosure: I generally dislike steak fries. But these ones were...perfect. Don't laugh--it is hard to actually impress on something as commonplace as fries. But Goddamn if these ones weren't perfectly seasoned, exactly the right width, dreamily crispy, and blessedly tender.

AND, they have amazing service! John, the barkeep, was nothing if not friendly. Chris was around to pitch in unexpectedly, but did it with a smile. They were slammed, but he still found me a bottle of hot sauce on demand.

I'll be back...a lot. See you there!
author: Michi K.

description: This place rocks! The staff is super friendly and the food is consistently amazing.
author: Jake B.

description: Great beers nice atmosphere a tad cold inside many beers to choose from very friendly and prompt bartenders. Mary who was our bartender even gave us some info on our next trip to San Diego definitely will back here again though.
author: Aaron D.

description: Good drinks, good atmosphere. I think more places should have steak fries. The only disappointment were the chicken tenders. They were like Chick-Fil-A sized (read--more nuggets than tenders) and barely breaded. Teeeeeny tiny for the price!
author: Christie C.

description: Went to the hop water for our last night. Atmosphere was lovely! Very clean and modern. The beer was overflowing and reasonably priced at 6$ a glass. It was the awesomest beer ever. All local! The food wasn't bad... but nothing to write home about.
author: Kaylee K.

description: This is a great spot for a beer or even a bite to eat. They have a lot of great beer options on tap and a cool vibe. Great happy hour spot in the hood.
author: Derek S.

description: Very good, friendly. Great beer. Food is OK too.
author: Christopher V.

description: Hopwater is in my top 5 favorite bars in SF.  They focus more on California brewed beers, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.  I had a Nelson draft here and is was a lot more fresh and flavorful than the Nelson I had at a different bar.  This speaks of a top notch tap system.  I had the crab tater tots due to Yelp comments.  They were tasty, but not legendary.  I wished the placed opened sooner than 5PM.
author: Bob B.

description: Good selection of beer, good prices, nice staff and a great place overall. The food was good, but simple.
author: Ellen M.

description:
Great beer. Nice digs. Fun people. 

I definitely found my new favorite local spot. Completely unexpecting place. You'll see what I mean when you walk up to it.
author: Brent L.

description:
I saw the taps installed in this place months before opening and knew I would like it. There really isn't anything like it in the area save maybe Beer Hall, which is hardly in the area. The space is cool and fills in with the after work crowd during the week.

The beer selection is top notch and it is all California Craft beer, many which are very difficult to come across and even some you probably haven't heard or seen before [insert hipster joke]. I'd like to think of myself a little beer snobby and I was satisfied with their selection (Faction Brewing, Pine St Splitter Pale, a rare Lagunitas Fusion "SF" beer, Two Rivers Granny Smith Cider as some example beers). The bartenders are also knowledgeable and can tell you a couple things about each beer on the menu.

Their steak fries are bomb. I'd stay away from the dungeness tots. They sound good, look good, but do not live up to the hype or price. I'm interested to delve into their menu a bit more. 

I've been there twice already and definitely will come back a few more times.

It's too bad they aren't open more hours, it would be a definite lunch hit with it's proximity to downtown.
author: Nicky T.

description: A really great beer bar. This is the second time I've been here in two days and I think from now on this will be my fall back bar. The staff has been incredibly helpful but hands off enough to not be annoying. They have a great selection of California beers. The patrons at the bar at least were welcoming in conversation and recommendations. Hands down a great establishment.
author: Marcus R.

description: Great selection of excellent California craft beers!  We went to Mikeler bar first but I like this place better.  A better variety of different beers.  Did not try any food. Service was friendly and gave us samples to try. I will return!
author: Jmarc P.

description:
Hopwater, you are craft beer heaven in San Francisco! Thank you for NOT overcharging for your sweet nectar simply because you are "in the city." Hopwater, your industrial design gives you a stylized cool vibe that too many bars and restaurants in SF lack. Service is great, but again... oh the beer selection! 

Only recommendation for improvement here... the chicken tenders. Though delicious, these are less "tenders" as they are bites and for $8 for four nuggets it leaves your hunger ready for the second half of the order.
author: Ryan S.

description: Incredible beer bar that's easy to miss. Great seating options upstairs. High quality local and imported beers on tap, plenty to choose from and always changing. Chicken tender bites and crab tater tots if you're in the mood for high-end apps/bites. Best chicken sandwich in the city hands down, and this is coming from someone born and raised in the heart of SF. If you like beer and food, you can't go wrong.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend when we were in town.  It was close to our hotel so it seemed like an easy place to grab food and a few beers.  They have a nice craft beer selection.  It took a minute to read every thing they had up on the draft boards.  There are help yourself water stations  downstairs and up on the balcony.  
The menu included small plates and sandwiches, which I would expect at a bar.   The food that came out was much better than I would expect at a bar.  I really enjoyed their veggie sandwich.  The  aioli on it was tasty!
I plan to stop here again when I'm in town.
author: Sara H.

description: LOVE this place. They always have new/interesting beers to try. Great spot to stop by after work, on the weekends, or have a party. No reservations but if you get there early enough, they will let you take over however much space you need. The burgers and the deviled eggs with bacon jam are perfect. Bathrooms are clean, which is clutch for a beer bar. Great go-to bar.
author: Wendy K.

description: I love this gastropub. Great selection of ales and beer. Reasonable prices. The beet salad, charcuterie plate and pulled pork sliders were a more upscale take on more basic pub dishes that all worked well. Will be back again!
author: Mariana L.

description:
I really like this low key, lots of seating, craft beer exclusive place. Nothing super impressive but a great place to hang out, enjoy some local craft beer while sitting down. You pay at the cashier and find a seat and no one will rush you out. 

The reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because of their poor ventilation....the whole place including our clothes smell like burgers when they fire the grill. Maybe they can put a door to seperate the kitchen.
author: Maggie C.

description: I really enjoyed going here. Nice cozy atmosphere and staff are all very friendly. Food was delicious, especially those crab tots and the ricotta with crostini. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because I did not care for a lot of the beers they had on tap. I tried a lot of them and they were just average.
author: Alison W.

description: This is for beer.  Yay beer! lalalal   a few more words because they wont let me post.  Blah blah blah. Word word word.
author: Dave M.

description: Great atmosphere and the wait staff is on top of everything! If you like to people watch this is the place. The beer selection is great too! I was slightly disappointed in the food--very salty, but I must say the food is probably a couple steps up from most bar food.
author: G F.

description: Loved this place.  I'm a "beer head" and the beers and food were awesome.  The deviled eggs are spectacular!  We are staying on Knob Hill and this is a great place to grab a craft brew and some good food.
author: Jay J.

description: We started our night at Hopwater Distribution, with the intent to barhop to other bars in the neighborhood. Hopwater was a cool place that's been open about a year. Very clean and casual. They have 31 taps reserved for California Breweries, which offer a bit of everything.
author: Kellee K.

description: Were there Labor Day. Great beer, great food, pleasant bartenders. Good time.
author: Charles B.

description: This place has a great atmosphere! It's not too packed, but it's still busy enough to let you know that it's a decent pub. The kitchen closes at 11, so I didn't get to try the food, but it looks decent.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
If you love craft beer, you're going to love Hopwater Distribution.

They have a rotating set of 25-30 draught beers from all over the realm; many of which are local breweries you may never even have known existed. There's many excellently named brews to be had, from "Monk's Blood" to the "Sticky Zipper IPA".

It's amazing.

Most of the beers are $6-9 a glass. The exact size depends on the beer and its alcohol content. In particular, I had a cask ale the other night that was stunning. It dropped me right back into London, which is no small feat.

I didn't sample the food menu, but it looked amazing. And you better believe I'll be going back for dungeness crab tater tots!
author: Nick S.

description: Came here for drinks/food before a show at the Masonic midweek.  This must be the place to go before an event there because the place was PACKED.  It's a little strange how you wait in line to order your food/drinks at the bar and then the waitstaff delivers your food to you wherever you happen to be... which for us was standing amongst other drinking concert-goers packed like sardines.  It was challenging to finagle our drinks and two plates of food.  Seating is scarce.  They need to invest in ledges where people can rest food/drinks while standing.  I'm sure it's no issue on quiet nights when there is nothing going on at the Masonic but it was a bit annoying the night we went.  That said, beer selection is obvs on point and the food was pretty darn tasty:  hubs got pork sandwich that he really liked and the I got the chicken tenders which I could have easily eaten another portion.  I would go back but next time I'll either make sure there is nothing going on at the Masonic or be sure to eat beforehand.
author: Krista C.

description:
Pretty basic pub fair but well made and presented. You order at the bar where they have about 30 beers on tap. 

The deviled eggs with crab louis were tasty as a start. The burger, again, basic but done well, which is the mark of all good food. 

The prize is the freshly tapped beers.
author: jeff f.

description: If you want beer and you want it on tap, and you have a crowd that's hard to please, this is the place to come.  You can sample, you can sip, you can drink.  Outrageous selection.  There is something for all palates.  Hoppy?  check.  Chocolate overtones?  check. Clean finish?  Nitro?  check. check.  All good. Just the names themselves (Ninja Date Night) are enough to have a good time.  Austere and delicious.
author: Alittle G.

description: Excellent place to stop in and grab a nice beer and a burger.  I recommend one of their IPAs and the Angus Burger.  Also, get the 5-Deviled Egg with Crab and Leek.  That alone will change your mind regarding "Deviled Eggs".  Overall, highly recommend!
author: Eric B.

description: Great atmosphere, service, food, and beer!  Just flew in town and was looking for a place near our hotel for a late dinner and drinks. Loved the vibe when we walked in. Ordered at the bar and got a table upstairs that overlooks the bar - great for people watching! Food was delivered to our table sooo quickly. Loved the deconstructed Dungeness Crab Louis salad and sliders were a good bite. Two Rivers Pomegranate Cider is light and refreshing. If we were locals, would totally hang out here for a chill date night or with friends. Also spotted some high chairs being stored under the stairs(??)
author: Jane N.

description: I found this place thru Yelp, of course, and the reviews made me want to come. It was just as great as I thought it would be!!! Beer was amazing, they let me try different drafts to see if I liked them. I also had a burger and it was fantastic!
author: Stefanie L.

description:
Love the openness of this place, I sat at the communal table by the bar. Young professional hang-out, great for dates but a little crowded downstairs. You also have to go to the bar to order, which may be challenging if it's super busy. 

I got the Auburn double IPA and it was delicious and 2 were good for me! I also tried the Brie and charcuterie (the cacao one) because reviews said it was great - and they were right! Loved it, and surprisingly there were enough crostinis to finish all the meat and cheese, which I find to be one of the most annoying things about getting cheese plates at places - they never give enough crackers! Also got the steak fries - I know, weird dinner, but they were also amazing! Would definitely recommend to anyone around the area.
author: Kat M.

description: Awesome beer selection - 20+ microbrews, many which I had never had before, including Belgian style ales, rye ale, imperial stout, etc. the bar food is good also. - crab tater tots, tasty sliders, crab salad, etc.
author: Larry P.

description: Pretty good - beer selection is excellent with a great selection of dark beers and IPAs with a few I'd never seen before. Place was packed and it took quite a while to get a seat and to get our food. Buttermilk fried chicken was OK, nothing exceptional. Price was great, but all things considered I don't think I'd go back.
author: Michael L.

description:
I stopped here on a Friday night with the boyfriend. Our hotel was only a few blocks away, and we wanted the pub+restaurant ambiance. (Rather than a shitty fast food place or diner, especially around 10:30 on a Friday.)

Ambiance: A chill bar-feel with lots of seating. Music and nice company. Plenty of space, and the establishment had a unique layout. Def recommend if you're looking to drink craft beer with friends, and especially if you wanna grab a house burger too.

Drinks: We honestly didn't order any, but according to the drink menu, everything was a Cali craft beer and ranged pretty much from $5-$7. Not bad, considering what the rest of SF charges. Free water.

Food: Not much on the menu. Some apps, and a verrryy small handful of burger/sando selections. Ranged from like $8-$14. Delicious though!

Overall: 4 stars. Would definitely give 4.5 if possible! I liked everything about the place. Just wish there was a bigger menu!
author: Jessica Z.

description: Great steak fries and cold beer. I would come back again. Ambiance is classy. Great bar.
author: Ali F.

description:
A quick pint on the way home... impossible at Hopwater Distribution

The website pictures look too good to be true until you get there and realize you just entered the inner sanctum of Californian Zymurgy

I asked John what he might suggest for an IPA, which turned into a three hour long conversation and extensive beer sampling. Along the way the Humbolt Fog and Point Reyes cheese, the Rustica Soppressata, and Ghost Pepper Salami, and a healthy portion of Steak Fries all provided perfect accompaniment to the very fine journey through the micro breweries of California.

Thanks for the education, conversation and great beer.
author: Geordie W.

description: Delish cider beer and really good small bites. Super chill place and friendly service.
author: Lola S.

description: Been really looking forward to trying this place and initial impression was Loud! Lots of shouting and no real "atmosphere" other than screamy. Started with Beer for me and my woman. My beer was flat. Her beer was skunky. Didn't bother ordering food after that. Too bad, really wanted to like this place. :(
author: Pavle R.

description: Terrific beer selection! Even the ciders are really good. They have such a wide selection of brews. So far all good. Great buyer too!
author: James T.

description: It's a great beer place with good food. It's not a restaurant so don't review it like one.  Nice atmosphere ... and considering the hipster scene, its not at all overdone or pretentious.  Will visit again when in SF.
author: Lewis C.

description:
I wish I could give one review for the drink and one for the grub. Alas...I cannot. So, let's start with the good news: the beer selection is excellent. I have yet to find a better selection of California craft beers. I tried three beers, all IPAs which ranged in goodness. The specific beers matter less than the great selection. A plus was that the servers behind the bar were all really friendly and helpful. So, if you want to have a wide range of CA craft beers to try with a friendly beer-tender...this is a great place.

 As for the grub well...why not five stars? In a word, the food was average...and I'm being kind. I had the charcuterie plate to start which was fine. Nothing to brag about but not bad. What really left me sad was the pathetic burger. Notwithstanding the fact that having it with cheese is an option (at a gastropub?) the meat was terribly overcooked. I order my burgers medium rare and this was decidedly medium well. A chef knows that if you're going to error...error on the side of rare. While I'd like to think this was aberration, I was sitting at the bar next to a regular who confessed he's experienced a the same issue again and again and orders his burgers rare. My advice to the chef is to pick a cheese for your burger and stick to it. Once you decide on a cheese...cook the damn thing correctly. I simply can't give 4 and 5 stars to a place with truly pedestrian food. And all I'm really judging here is the burger. But if you can't do that right...am I really going to explore the rest of the menu? Me thinks not. In summary, excellent selection of California craft beers accompanied by average, at best, gastropub fare.

A hint: This is a seat yourself place with an order at the register and get a number style. So...if you have a large party it could be painful. Before you head to this place have a good sense of what you're getting into...this is not a sit down and be served by a waiter place. This is not a problem...just something I know some folks will want to know before they arrive.

In closing I'd like to share that if these guys can better define their burger and learn to cook meat...i will gladly revise my rating to 5 stars.
author: Z Z.

description: Great beer selection.  I had a Belgian ale which was excellent.  Combined it with a buttermilk fried chicken sandwich.  The sandwich was amazing with slaw, what seemed like a pesto sauce and an nice baguette.
author: Tom D.

description: Good place. Very casual, and equally inviting if you're alone or with a group. Great beer selection and amazing food.
author: Jacob T.

description: Good burger. Small food selection, but impressive beer selection. Can be slow and almost always busy. Prices are a little high...a burger can end up costing $15-$20. The beer is reasonably priced (for the area) though.
author: Justin H.

description: So many beers to choose from! They let you sample  any of them, which is nice when you're somewhat a newbie at the beer scene. I got a Kolsch which was delicious. The bartenders were really nice and informative. We ordered the pickle plate, which we thought were going to be just that - pickles. It was an interesting mix of actual pickles and other pickled veggies. It was good! If we were ever back in SF, we would definitely go back to this place.
author: Emily R.

description: Took a chance on trying because of all the good Yelp reviews! It was Awesome! It helped knowing that you order first at the end of the bar and then take your number to your table. Knowing this we found a table first, lucky one had just opened upstairs and we looked over the menu and I went down to order. The friendliest people in San Francisco work here! Deviled eggs Awesome! Chicken Sandwich Awesome! Beer Awesome! 5 Stars!
author: Mark B.

description: This is the best spot in the city to enjoy a dizzying array of fine beers and have a good night out experience - the place strikes the perfect balance between a spot for connoissieurs and a friendly neighborhood bar. The food is great and has only gotten better the longer it's been open. The staff is great too. Go for the beer and stay for good times!
author: Jay L.

description: Came here by myself while visiting San Francisco in October. Amazing beer selection and just what I was looking for as an out-of-towner (a great CA variety). The food was pretty good and the place was packed with people. Bartenders were not the friendliest but what are ya gonna do. Probably wouldn't make a point to come back here the next time I'm visiting, but overall it's a cool place with great beer.
author: Emily W.

description: Only here once. The food (burger) was good. They had a carefully curated selection of craft brews for cheap! And though very busy, they should have more bartenders (my only complaint) they were attentive and helpful!
author: Kelsey O.

description: The beer menu is impressive.  The Friday post work crowd was bumping.   I'd skip the food, but definitely would come by for some drinks.
author: Larry L.

description: Hopwater has become a go-to for my friends and I. The extensive draft selection is constantly rotating, ensuring there is always something new for you to try. The prices are reasonable and the staff is generally helpful in finding you something you'll like. Although the food selection is somewhat limited, you really can't go wrong with the crab cakes or deviled eggs (with bacon jam!). The burger and fried chicken sandwich are also solid choices if you're looking for something more filling.
author: Lauren C.

description: We enjoyed our beers and meal! Food came out incorrect because I ordered it wrong, but they fixed the order anyway for free. If you like beer and good food, great stop.
author: Shawn S.

description: Perfect place to go for dinner and craft beer. The fried chicken sandwich was delicious, and was paired with some hearty steak fries. ~30 taps with every style available from a wide variety of CA breweries. Only complaint is they close very early on some weeknights - last call was shouted at 10:30
author: Tucker K.

description: We decided to come for a late night snack and drink and were pleasantly surprised with the chicken sandwich and tenders!! One bartender and one waiter, but the place is small enough to handle it
author: Joseph B.

description: This is a diamond in the rough in the tendernob area. Excellent beer selection, and efficient ordering process. The food was excellent as well. This is not the place for hard liquor, but if you're in the mood for great local beer and a chill vibe, this is your place.
author: Isaias G.

description: Wonderful bar with such a good selection of beer. You can go in there and always have a new beer. The food is pretty solid though limited so reading there more than twice can be dull
author: Stephen H.

description: I didn't try any of their beer but the ambience was great and they had quite a selection of beers. The bartender was also great at giving recommendations (for my friends).
author: Amber C.

description: Terrible, slow bar service. On a Wednesday night waiting over 20 minutes for a bartender to pay attention. Hire another bartender, people.
author: Matt B.

description: Brew pub atmosphere. Plenty on tap. Good place yo go for a drink if you are visiting in the union square area.
author: Michael M.

description: Great beer selection food was also good. You need to get there early resturant fills up fast.
author: William H.

description: Went on a fundraiser evening for Performing Arts Workshop, where 10% of purchases that night for food and drink went to that great non-profit.  How can you not like a bar that promotes good causes?  The space is tastefully done, the wall of taps particularly classy and handsome.  Great selection of craft beers.  Had the crab tater tots, at first bummed there were only 5, but they're so rich it ended up being just enough!  Bartender greeted me with the best smile :)  (only mentioning it because it was so great I remembered it :P.)  Will definitely go back.
author: Mirba E.

description: Good food, very bad operations. I'm guessing that this place was taking a bet that they would lower cost significantly by eliminating a phone line--and thus someone who needs to be there to answer it, and by having their bartender take food and beverage orders for the entire establishments.  The only catch is that this makes for a pretty unpleasant customer experience.  While the food comes out quickly, we spent half of our time in line.  And if you forget to order something, want to get another drink or if your order is entered wrong -- as was the case for us--  you have to start over and stand in the long line once again.   Hopefully they can work out these kinks so the service can live up to the tasty food and beer.
author: Laura C.

description: Fun vibe, great beer selection and just enough 35+ to keep the crowd grounded and not too hipster.
author: Lynn B.

description:
Chicken tenders off the hook (for being chicken tenders) they were totally not what I expected, crispy, farm-to-table flavor (if that's such a thing) and the sauce they were placed upon, definitely tried to scoop that up. Also ordered the clam chowder soup, nothing special there.  My boyfriend ordered the Portabello mushroom sandwich.  Since he's a vegetarian, he's had a lot of portobellos sandwiches over the years. The mushroom had a very rich, savory, firewood smoky flavor (I have to really emphasize the firewood flavor). Also, as a connoisseur (at least I wish to be) of craft local brews both home and abroad, I'm disappointed I wasn't feeling really well because they have a beautiful selection of about 30 crafts on tap. I like the atmosphere as well, bare brick, lots of wood, sort of classy. steam-punk.  Lots of gentlemen in collared shirts with/without jackets - likely here with the citywide VMware conference.

Ordering at the bar is a new concept for me, I didn't like having to decide right there but of course I could've taken the menu back to the table. After writing my review and reading others - that's a great point about not being hassled by waiters. Totally dig that in hindsight.
author: Marissa C.

description: Great selection of Cali craft beers with a good atomsphere. Limited first come seating though.
author: Tim F.

description: Love love love this spot! It was our last stop on a Friday night out and I really wish we had made it an earlier one. Some great beers and awesome staff. The female bartender helped me figure out which beer I wanted AND gave me a small taste while she poured my friends drinks. She was not even a hint of pretentious and I appreciate that in such a new and "cool" spot. I'll definitely be spending some time here on my next visit.
author: Sarah H.

description: Good beers on tap.  Food was sub par and the ordering "system" at the bar is just plain dumb and inefficient. I would only return for beers.
author: LT B.

description: If I was rating on beer alone I would give a 5. Food on the other hand gets two stars. I ordered the fried chicken tenders. They were tough and not crispy at all. Almost like they were microwaved. Eww...Not good and cost $8. For sure a disappointment. My husband had the burger which he said was good. Atmosphere is cool. Worth it for the drinks but don't come for food.
author: Carline R.

description: walked in last week for dinner at 7 (based on yelp's reviews)... it was warm outside, but it was friggin HOT inside... no AC no fans nothing... and to get food they needed us to sit upstairs which was a sauna, so we left.
author: Joe A.

description: Great beers. Great staff. Great space. Great neighborhood. Terrific atmosphere. Highly recommended.
author: West R.

description: We stumbled upon this place. Unique character and ambiance,, it's one of a kind. Really good beer and food. Really good service and super friendly staff and patrons. Definitely a good spot to come back to. Ryan you rock!
author: Zara S.

description: Great draft beer selections! They changed the beer every week, so you get different  choices every visit. Good service, friendly atmosphere, and draft beers are perfect for socializing! Also their buttermilk chicken are good companion for drinking beer!!
author: Ibnu A.

description:
I was visiting San Fran recently and wanted to find a cool restaurant near my friend's house. I saw Hopwater on Yelp and we decided to try it out. The front of the place looks pretty run down, but purposely...you know, in a cool way. The inside is very nice with a large bar, tables and a loft above with more tables. The vibe was pretty chill (we had early dinner on a Monday). There were mostly young people (late 20s/early 30s) but also a few older folks. You order at the bar and then they bring the food to you at your table. Sometimes when restaurants are set up like this, your plate never gets cleared, etc. but the service was surprisingly good.
We had a golden beet salad, some deviled eggs and a chicken sandwich. Everything was very good--deviled eggs aren't necessarily my thing but they had bacon and something sweet on them, so they were delicious. My only complaint about the food was that the chicken was a tad over cooked. 
The bartender was very friendly and was very patient with me while I debated at length over which beer to order. The beer selection was extensive and the taps were set up in a unique and uniform way.
I liked this place! Good for food or just drinks.
author: Jane G.

description:
If you want beers, this is the place to go, but their only mediocre food keeps it from becoming more than a local watering hole. Perhaps, that's all it wants be, but this place has so much more potential. 

It's hard to go wrong with the beers here. Local, seasonal, and wide in variety are often echoed in other reviews. They are not wrong. The beers are definitely the mainstay. 

The food is a completely different story. While the menu seems focused and a winning combination, the execution leaves much to be desired. The acidity in the 3 dishes I tried were over the top. The fries were passable at best. They seemed to have been out of the frier too long. The sandos, what they called the burgers, didn't meet expectations either. The bun wasn't fresh and the aoli wasn't well balanced. 

This place can be so much more. The layout is great and the beer awesome. It just needs to build on that foundation and make the food great too.
author: Bei Y.

description: Really good selection of beer. Friendly and talkative bartenders. Cool old/random movies on the TV. This is a good place to go and try a few beers - not great for a group  or a night out. More of a casual watering hole.
author: Bryan R.

description: Great beer selections on tap, I stuck the cider! People seemed to have been really into the sliders, sadly I did not eat here but I definitely will next time. Such a cool space, pretty big and open. They closed by 12 on a Tuesday...I was surprised but also thinking it's Tuesday why am I still out. The crowd was mixed, young and old, men and women a good sign.
author: Sonya S.

description: So I had the deviled eggs with bacon that was really good.. I feel like the chicken Sando missed some other flavor in it ... Like it needed a different sauce with some flavor ....beside some waiter with glasses be really rude to our table who works there.. Next time be nice to your customers who pay your salary and support your job and company...crab tots were nice alil to mushy on the inside for me.. Great night !!!
author: Jackie I.

description: From an east coast beer enthusiast, this is a must visit while in SF. Great selection of some of Cali's finest brews. Nice atmosphere. Foods good too. Feel free to open another one in CT!
author: Brian B.

description: Was there at 5:00 PM when they opened.  Great atmosphere, friendly service, music on the speakers, windows open and bringing in the sounds of the city.  Had a local pint and the deviled eggs.  Both were delish.  Will return and continue to try other options on the menu.
author: Phil P.

description: Loved this place!  Great beer and awesome service. We were in town for the night and wanted to head for a late night dinner after drinks. Asked the busboy for recommendations. He took some time to think about it and came back 10 minutes later with directions to and Italian place in his iPhone!  Talk about good customer service!  Anyways great ambiance and gets pretty packed on a Saturday night. Will definitely be back next time I'm in the city.
author: Ivy N.

description: This place could easily become one of my favorite spots to have nice food and good beers. The place is very nice looking and has great ambiance and music. My friend ordered the Angus burger and I ordered the cobb salad and they were both really really good! The bartenders are super friendly and in my case, they helped me order exactly the type of beer I wanted from their WIDE variety of beers on the menu. All in all I recommend this place, I would definitely come back!
author: Daniela P.

description: HolyCraft Magnum Opus now being served at Hopwater!!!
author: Steve S.

description: An amazing beer selection! I definitely liked their dark beers and a nitro one. Also, the setting is really cool and a good place to catch up with a friend.
author: Charles Z.

description: This place was great. I was visiting SF for a few days  for work and hopwater was just a few blocks from my hotel .. Not an extensive food menu but perfect for a tap room .. 30 beers (all local from CA) on a rotating tap, how can you go wrong? Voted one of SFs top 10 beer bars .. Highly recommend it!
author: Pat V.

description: Great addition to this part of neighborhood. Seems more like local spot than any touristy. Decent selection of west cost beers and simple but well made dishes to pair with. Have a mezzanine level as well which a little bit snug. Bar area has better access to beer:)
author: Lyra S.

description: I'm so happy a great California beer place has opened up near me! Their beer selection is exceptional, with 30 taps and most of the beers are specialty beers we rarely see anywhere else. The food is also fantastic, with our favorite being the dungeness crab tater tots. Even though it was packed, we were able to get a seat at the bar and the barmen were very attentive and friendly despite how busy it was. Highly recommend.
author: Jessie L.

description: Beyond my expectations.   Not just beer, but great appetizers.   The Dungeness crab tator tots were like crab cakes but totally different, and the seafood deviled eggs were nearly as awesome.   My wife had lentil soup which is normally not something for me, but I helped finish it - it was exceptional.    We got there before it got three deep at the bar... for a new place, this is really humming.
author: Jeff A.

description: Got the beef sliders with bacon, avocado, and yellow peppercorn mustard. So good! Awesome place.
author: Jerry B.

description: 30 craft beers on tap of excellent quality. The bar staff were very nice, and knowledgable on the brews.  The beer was worth a five star review, but on top of that the food was excellent and of good value. I enjoyed the vege sando and the greens and grits.
author: Rohan L.

description: They have a great selection of beers on tap and the food is pretty good. I recommend trying the Dungeness Salad.
author: Anderson M.

description: The beers here are wonderful, and I love the space! The only thing I don't like is the food. The $13 Dungeness Crab tots were a waste...okay tasting,...but 5 tots? Really? We also ordered the chicken strips, which I could have made at home out of a frozen bag, for $8. Not worth it. The only thing worth the price tag were the steak fries. I know this is a new place so I hope they get the food situation sorted out. I'll definitely come back here for beer, just not for food.
author: Kristin H.

description: They have 30 different beers on tap and they all look delicious. About half well known and half from microbreweries so a little for everyone. The food was delicious as well although portions on the smaller side.
author: Sasha O.

description: I went to Hopwater Distribution on a recent trip to San Francisco. This place has such a cool vibe and I loved the industrial feel to the whole place. I got the Two Rivers Raspberry Cider and it was great. My boyfriend got the Hella something lager? and was not a fan. They should have a tasting package of all the beers because that would be a good experience to try new ones and we wouldn't have mind to pay extra for this. We shared the chicken tenders, sliders and fries and they were good. Overall a great experience and would recommend to others.
author: Ashley G.

description: The setting is great. The beer is great. The devils egg with bacon jam is a must try. Well worth it. Nice place to hang out with friends. Great experience. Will return!
author: Nancy L.

description: Hands down best neighborhood bar for beer. SO many beers on tap, at least 30 most days and they sell out of the good ones! That's saying something. Very nice wood/metal theme and not too crowded so plenty of seating. They also have a few tables upstairs which is fun for eating while people watching. My new favorite place in the neighborhood.
author: Anthea L.

description: My husband and I came here for dinner and we really enoyed the food and ambiance. The only downfall was how long it took to order our food. We didn't mind having to go up to the bar to order but having to wait in line made it pretty inconvenient and took a long time. If they can find a more efficient way to take orders, it would make for a better overall experience.
author: Anonymous H.

description: Solid beer selection and deviled eggs are delicious. Only downside is that it's not super busy- there are other cool bars in the area that detract from the traffic.
author: Eric S.

description: Loved this place. Fantastic rotating range of beers. The bar itself also looks really cool.
author: Noel S.

description: I really enjoy this place for a beer. Great selection, pleasant atmosphere. Service is hit or miss but generally above average.
author: Eater S.

description: Great place with lots of beers on tap. Try the crab tater tots and the raspberry cider.
author: Meredith F.

description: Good food, good beer but looooong lines to order either one. No servers and only one place to order food and beer. They must lose hundreds of dollars a night with such slow and inefficient service.
author: Will M.

description: So happy with this place! Great atmosphere, reasonably priced, and the food is fantastic!
author: Courtney T.

description: Great bar, great beers, great vibe. Came straight from a Guinness tasting and was told to watch out for the Milk Chocolate Stout, which was a little disappointing, but was super impressed by the selection of beers and the way the place is put together. Surely there isn't a finer craft beer spot in SF...?
author: Jonathan U.

description: Amazing selection of beers on tap, including some I've never seen before. With sports playing on screens around the bar, I could see this place being popular with the after work crowd. The food was decent- about what you'd expect for fries and chicken strips so I can't fault them on that. Overall I will definitely be adding this place to my list of usual haunts.
author: Brooke G.

description: 30+ brews on tap with a good number of Belgians thrown in the mix. Clean, open bar space. Good spot to meet up with a larger group of friends. Wasn't too loud even with the number of people there. They also have food to satisfy spells of hunger. Definitely worth checking out - you won't be disappointed.
author: Tim S.

description: Great pub with a great selection of beers. The Belgian Tripel was fantastic. Food was okay - what you would expect from typical bar food.
author: Anoop J.

description: Fantastic, all California craft beer selection - 31 taps. Perfect atmosphere, great for groups.
author: Chris K.

description: The place is clean and some of the beers are well worth the trip the menu items consist of deviled eggs, sliders and salad on the whole better than other bars around lower nob hill.
author: N A.

description: Not a huge beer fan but I really enjoyed my time here. Huge selection of beer, open/high ceiling interior, great food/snack option. Loved it.
author: June C.

description: Very cool place, easily might have become my new favorite. You order at the bar then you can sit where you would like. It took too long to order two beers though. I guess there was some technical problems with the kitchen so it was getting backed up. But once we got our beer and sat down, we really enjoyed ourselves. I am looking forward to going back!
author: Bianca M.

description: Great beer selection and food. Staff is very friendly and it's not packed......  Yet.   We had the sliders, fries, and crab salad.
author: Nicholas A.

description: Great beer bar. Edward is awesome and super knowledgeable - beer run on the strong side
author: David G.

description: Good range of beers on tap. I had the North Coast Belgian Golden Strong Ale, really good with the burger. The Trippel and the Quad were also really excellent beers. The burger was good, but nothing to rave about. The ambience is a little too bright and wide open layout. But it's a good place to try out some good brews.
author: David V.

description: I ordered the smoked IPA and it was pretty good. I love the way this bar is set up. I do with they had someone to take your order because we sat upstairs and had to keep going back down to get more beer. I also ordered the cobb salad and my husband ordered the burger. We were both pleased with the food and our drinks. Cool place.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Visiting SF for work and staying at a hotel in Union Square, I turned to Yelp to search for a craft beer watering hole. Yelp delivered.

Hopswater was a few blocks away, uphill. Like, really uphill. Man, why didn't I take the cable car? Because, you know, cable car.

Found the bar despite minimal signage and entered a hip exposed brick room full of beards and tattoos. Settled in at the bar and let my eyes wander up to the chalkboard listing the 30 California beers on tap.

My, oh my. Every Bay Area favorite and then some. All styles well represented from the 10% double IPAs to American lagers to the blackest of stouts.

Started with a Bear Republic Mach 10 hop bomb which blew my mind and ruined my palate. Sampled some new releases from Drake's, Green Flash and North Coast. All good stuff.

Had a burger which was average with fries that were good enough. If you're all about the food, it won't blow you away.

But the beer..yes ma'am the beer selection is top-notch. Looking for a place to have a couple of world class brews, in casual setting? Go here.
author: Andrew M.

description: I went to this please last night with some friends it was very packed and there is no waiter service so you must order and then find your own table. Normally this would not be a problem except the venue was packed and everyone was standing because there weren't enough tables for all of customers. I felt like we had to race/compete to sit. Aside from seating issue, they have a small simple menu for food but a grand selection of beers on tap.  If your looking for a fun night out on town, this is a great stop but I wouldn't recommend taking a date here. Its more a social venue not an intimate one.
author: Michael C.

description: The beer selection and bar tending were first rate. Great choice of local beers and friendly knowledgable bartenders. The decor is simple with an urban industrial vibe and there is plenty of great seating. Very relaxed casual atmosphere and just the sort of place we were looking for to enjoy a couple of good beers on a weekday evening.
author: Shayne H.

description: I love the bright airy clean interior and wide selection of handpicked craft beers on tap. I think most are local too. No rancid bar smell or vibe whatsoever. I'd go with my family, friends, coworkers, overall superior experience and not too expensive. I had the crab tater tots, though not a large number, I could taste the fresh crab. Not too far from Union Square shopping. I'll definitely return.
author: Diana P.

description: Good Bar Food! Large Selection of Beer! Must try Pomegranate Cider! Taste like Kool-aid!
author: Sandy R.

description: Great beer selection- try the Sticky Monkey if u can. Awesome crab tots and also fried chicken tenders- good for two to share these two small plates. A little crowded on a Friday night. Great find near the fairmont and intercontinental on nob hill.
author: Kristin E.

description: A great spot! 30 interesting drafts and good friendly service. The deviled eggs with bacon jam were good too.
author: Nate D.

description: I like the low no fuss of this place. I had a hard cider on tap and great starters! Order at the bar, grab a seat, and chill in a great space!
author: Josie C.

description: I'm in love with this place. There are many options for eating with a great little loft for people watching. The ambiance is casual/rustic. Beer selection is amazing and at great prices. The food I've tried was all very good. I particularly enjoyed the grits and greens. Looking forward to trying more soon.
author: Monika M.

description: I came in on a Thursday night and this place was CROWDED! Super loud, but cool tunes were slightly audible above the roar of people talking and laughing. To order you have to go to the register, and you get a number. Considering the amount of people, we were served rather quickly! My burger with aioli and steak fries was delicious. I never order burgers- but this one was exceptional. A little pricey (10 dollars for a burger+2 for cheese) but for a little trendy spot like this I guess that's expected. I can't say anything about their beer- which is obviously the main attraction- because I didn't have any. But my dad had a lager which he enjoyed. Overall cute place.
author: Katarina S.

description: Great place to find a superb selection of draft beers.  Not as grungy as Toronado, which is great.  Has a nice vibe going inside, and decor is SF classy.  It's two stories so it doesn't feel too crowded at any point, and they have a separate quieter room in the back plus some small tables up top in the loft area.  Didn't have the food so can't comment on it, but it looked like your standard bar affair with a slight SF twist (e.g. the chicken fingers didn't look like they came from Burger King).  Will definitely be back!
author: Tristan Z.

description:
AMAZING!!!! This is now my new favorite place in san fran.  The staff is so friendly - ready to have a good chat over which beers they like best and recommend to you what they think you will like.  if you're not sure, the staff will gladly give you a free tasting of whichever beer you want.  When we left, one of the owners took the time to say goodbye and shook our hands. 

It has a really big space with exposed brick which gives it a cool and refreshing vibe. 

The bar food is excellent.  The fries are a MUST!! 

Do it - Go!!
author: Maiah P.

description: Love this place! Crazy busy all the time. Definitely a twenty-something scene. I love the size of the beer selection. The aesthetic is pseudo-steampunk: exposed brick and chrome everywhere. Love it!
author: Jen H.

description: Nice variety of craft beers. The Red Ale is good. Not a huge selection of food but what I tried was delicious. Definitely recommend for travelers.
author: Zach M.

description: Good lively atmosphere. Short menu, however the burger was cooked to order, quick service and friendly bar & wait staff. Definitely worth a try if you fancy a beer and burger.
author: Marc T.

description: Was a little put off by how cramped the place was, but it really is just that good! Really friendly and knowledgable staff; I asked about a beer and got a great explanation about the brewing process, not just a hurried sample, which was really nice.  Had the Drake's Hefeweizen and loved it. You should definitely order the burger if you've got room for it, it was delicious and the fries were perfectly crispy. All in all a great experience, just wish there was more room to sit.
author: Clara C.

description: The chicken sandwich was amazing as was their beer selection!! The crab tater tots fell a bit short for me...the inside was like a mashed potato with a tiny bit of crab meat.  The most amazing thing I tasted though was their "ranch" which didn't taste much like ranch at all and was phenomenal!!!  Will definitely be back to try more!! And no phone number-only fb and twitter...
author: Nelle L.

description: The owner needs to give Mary a raise, stat. On top of being crazy knowledgeable about every beer on the menu (and possibly in the world) she's efficient, and nice. The food is fantastic. Crab tots? Don't hesitate just order them. Chicken thingys? Yes, do that. I wish this place was less popular because I live around the corner and would love to not have to fight for a bar seat... But I will for Mary, the beers and the food.
author: M W.

description:
One of the best new craft beer/gastro pub concepts to open in SF. They have an incredible 30-tap rail always pouring a great selection of rare craft beers and micro brews. The place is open and airy so even when it's packed you're not stifling in the body heat of strangers.

The food is great. The burgers are some of the best I've had in the city - I definitely recommend getting it loaded with bacon and avocado. The crab tater tots are more like potato puffs, but the aioli brings a nice complimentary flavor. 

The girlfriend ordered a salad and it was almost too large for her to eat. It looked fresh, and tasty and was well-dressed.

One of our favorite new spots, going to quickly become our go-to.
author: Jon M.

description: Great craft brew selection. If you like beer you'll like this place. Went Sunday at 7 pm and place was packed. Either no one works on Monday in SF or they really like good beer.
author: Brian H.

description: The decor is amazing so good job there. To state the obvious, they have a great selection of beers; tasty beers. The food is not too shabby either. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and it was tasty. The chicken was not dry and the french fries were really good. It does get pretty crowded so come early if you want a seat.
author: A. R.

description: This place is a great place to get a beer, the selection is amazing (30 on draft!).  The beers are all Californian as well!  The place is beautiful and rustic, in a pre-prohibition nod.  Loved the food as well, try the chicken sando and the deviled eggs.
author: Jason D.

description:
Brought my friends here over the weekend for a belated birthday celebration.
I LOVE it when I pick the right place because all my friends asked me, "How did you hear about this?!"

Amazing selection of beer at great prices. About 30 beers on tap!
Awesome selection of bar food that is DELICIOUS. My friends gave thumbs up to the crab cakes and burgers.
Big, open space for an open party to sit down and catch-up. Not too loud either.
Great, central location if you want to party it up anywhere else after.

Service is great as well. You order at the counter and they give you your beers. Food,-- they give you a number and it is served right to you with no fuss at all!

Definitely coming back here soon!
author: Aggie Z.

description: Found this place on Yelp on our first night in San Francisco, looking for somewhere interesting to go close to our hotel. Glad we found this place. Great selection of draft beers, helpful bar staff and we even managed to squeeze in an order of chicken tenders and steak fries one minute before they closed the kitchen. The pink lady cider went down well with the missus (who's not a beer drinker) and the two local brews I had (a pilsner and an IPA) really hit the spot.
author: Paul N.

description: Great selection of California beer.  Staff knew a lot about the beer they were serving. Had the Fried Chicken sandwich. It was very good. Busy at 5 pm, service was just okay.
author: Tim S.

description: Great selection of beers. Good service.  Got crowded on a Friday after work, but why wouldn't it.  Not sure if they have anything to drink other than beer, so plan accordingly.
author: Dilly M.

description: You have to order at the bar, but the bartenders will work for you! Get the deviled eggs with bacon for some tasty noms.
author: T S.

description: Good beer selection with fairly good prices but the food is overpriced for what you get. Two of us split the pulled pork sliders and deviled eggs with crab and weren't too impressed, especially considering the price. There was very little crab on the deviled eggs (no where near enough to justify the extra price) and the sliders weren't very big for $10. We spent $40 for two beers, pulled pork sliders, and deviled eggs with crab. Tasted good but over priced.
author: Rick E.

description: Great beer and Veggie sandwich. Cool atmosphere ... the bar has 30 beers on tap. Great place to hang out after work and meet up with coworkers and friends.
author: Jackson B.

description: The food here is amazing! We came here for a quick pre-baseball game dinner and we were blown away! We got 2 Drake's hefe's, the Dungeness tater tots, the buttermilk friend chicken tenders with mango-chipotle sauce, and the golden beet-arugula salad. We will definitely be coming back here every time we come to SF!
author: Jaime G.

description: Great beers and pub food!!! Chicken sando was excellent. Buddy had the burger, said it was great. Prices were very fair.
author: Bill T.

description: Decent pricing for a place near the financial district. It can get really crowded but if you come earlier you can get a seat and talk without yelling. Lots of seating: upstairs and downstairs. Lots of beers on tap.
author: Gee H.

description: Nice after-work vibe for the Hipster / Start-Up types. Spartan decor (actually, using the word "decor" is even too much) outweighed by a solid beer menu and decent tunes. Don't come here to get comfortable - even the Spartans would've been a little grumpy about lack of furnishings.
author: Downtown D.

description: The service here was awesome and the beer was great! Ordered a chicken sandwich and that was ok...will def be back!!!
author: Stephanie A.

description: Excellent Pub to go to. Went there last night and their Craft Beers were fantastic. Best Pub in town!
author: Kate M.

description: Yes yes yes I am so happy this place has opened. Great beers, great space to meet up with people, can't wait to start coming back already and I'm still drinking my beer.
author: Jesse H.

description: Great beer selection and good food.  I had the fried chicken sandwich and it was delish - my only gripe would be the bread (gets a bit soggy) but it was still overall tasty and I would definitely recommend it. The steak fries are a little bland but with some salt and pepper they're also pretty good.  It gets packed around happy hour, so plan to stand or have someone on the lookout for a seat.  Also, it's LOUD!  But the atmosphere is fun and I'll definitely be back!
author: Riley D.

description: i'm a fan! what a nice selection of great beers at good prices. wish the menu was a little bit bigger and a little bit cheaper, but the portions aren't insanely small and expensive like many other places in SF. it gets REALLY crowded and loud but the bartenders are nice and attentive.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Food quality on par with beer quality. Usually, food is secondary at a beer focused establishment. Varied atmosphere to cater to your social preferences. A gold star for cool & casual place with good quality food & brews. Price is good too.  -1 star ... can get too noisy at times.
author: Amy J.

description: Solid Belgian at a reasonable price. Hits the spot and good bartenders. Surprised it's not a bigger crowd.
author: Khalid N.

description: Came over the bridge from Oakland last night. We thought we would hit up the new pub on Bush street and try their food. The beer selection was just "OK", not great. The food was poor, tasteless and expensive. Save your money and your time and go somewhere else for beer and food. Oh, and the service was bad. It's rare when I'll say that about service but they most certainly earned it. Summary: boring food, too expensive, bad service, beer was just  "OK".
author: Tony G.

description: Great place! Had the deviled eggs and the crab tater tots, absolutely delicious! Then it was time to try as many of the 31 craft beers on tap as we could!
author: J M.

description: This place is definitely a beer lovers dream.  I think they had 30 beers on tap and the selection was pretty varied.  I was alone and got a seat at the bar.  The bartenders were generous with the samples and the cobb salad I had with Mary's chicken was right on.  I would definitely go back.
author: Marnie D.

description: Great selection of beer. Very friendly staff. Relaxed atmosphere.
author: Mike J.

description: This is one of the best beer bars in the city. The beer selection is diverse and unique, the staff is above and beyond friendly, and the food is excellent. I've had the burger w/fries which was one of the best burgers I've had in SF, and the beet salad which was delicious. To top it off, all food and drink is very reasonably priced by SF standards - no food item over $12 (at least on the current limited menu) and beers all range from $5-7.
author: Isaac T.

description: That was cool. Very good and really many (29) draft beers. What a surprising service. And everyone was very friendly. We also enjoyed the food. Sald was good, but the Buger sandwiches were really cool. The service was very friendly an helpful.
author: Joachim H.

description: Great spot for local beer and awesome food. Portions are a little on the small side, but worth every penny. I had the Cobb salad with chicken and I swear the flash fried buttermilk chicken was one of the best pieces of chicken I've ever had. I will be back!
author: Aaron S.

description: Good beer selection.  Laid back and informative staff.  If your are looking for a place with a good California beer selection, you got to try here.
author: Kevin D.

description: Good selection of beers. Food leaves something to be desired -- had like 5 chicken wings for $8. However, was a chill place to meet a friend who I hadn't seen in 6 months.
author: Jay Y.

description: I had wanted to try Hopwater since it opened and when I finally got the chance to go I LOVED it! I went with my boyfriend and two friends and we all tried different beers, all of which were delicious. (I even got to taste before I ordered which I appreciated). We had dinner and my burger was the perfect compliment to my drink. Excellent service, happy staff, beautiful space. I HIGHLY recommend Hopwater and will be back very soon!
author: Anne P.

description: Great food, better beer, and a cool ambiance. Highly recommend this to anyone in the area.
author: Corey J.

description: Good beer selection - quite a variety.  Burger was very good as were the steak fries with it.  Chicken sandwich rather dry and blah. Nice interior though very noisy. I'd definitely go back.
author: Cody W.

description: The definition of KISS. No  crazy complex eclectic menu. I only wish I could breakdown the  chuck/brisket burger. Amazing flavor!  Simple options all well done and a selection of beers to meet any picky palate. Service was attentive and speedy.
author: John Q.

description: Went there on a recommendation from a show on TV. The beer was good, but the place was way smaller than it looked. The crowd was like a college bar and seemed like the neighborhood was not the best area. Tip, there is no sign, it is where the large, lit up sign with nothing in it is.
author: Thomas I.

description: Went for drinks only. California centric list of excellent and not so easy to find beers. Bartender was very knowledge about what was being served. Great lighting and not so noisy you can't have a good conversation. Will be back again soon.
author: Marshall R.

description: This place had a great vibe, friendly staff and a great selection of beer - even a cider on tap! Tons of space too.
author: Wendy C.

description: Excellent selection of beers and the chicken tenders were very good. No signage outside to lead the way but a cool old sign marks the spot.
author: Tom U.

description: This was better than your average bar food for sure. My husband and I wanted to go to a laid back place close to our hotel but wasn't frozen reheated junk, Hopwater fit the bill.  The decor is nice but the acoustics are terrible, it is really loud. There is a great beer selection full of a lot of beers I have never heard of.  I didn't ask for any but I saw some people trying samples prior to ordering.  As far as dinner, we shared the deviled eggs with bacon jam, which were fantastic, there were 6 so it wasn't a skimpy appetizer either. I had the Dungenus  Louis salad and my husband had the chicken sandwich. My salad was fantastic, lots of crab, the lettuce was arugula (yum) and the cherry tomatoes and broccolini were fresh.  My husband thought his sandwich was so-so. The fries on the other hand were great, thick cut steak fry style. All in all I would come back.
author: Tracy G.

description: The wife and I got in from Florida during the late afternoon and our stomachs were still on Eastern time. This place was near our hotel so we decided to check it out. Excellent beer selection with super nice bartenders that made us feel right at home. The food was surprisingly great as well. We had the crab tater tots and sliders and would have ordered more if we didn't already have dinner plans later. Wish we didn't live 3000 miles away.
author: Andrew A.

description: I am visiting the area and met a few friends here. Delicious food and a nice lively atmosphere. The burger was great and I loved that they serve you a normal portion of fries (not a heaping huge mound!). Food came out super quick. Great beer selection. Great place to go for a casual dinner or drink!
author: Lauren B.

description: The place is a little hard to find because there is no huge sign that says Hopwater Distribution,  but its right next to a large out of order movie theater sign. I was a little surprise how spacious the place is. It's two stories, with a huge beer bar and kitchen on the first floor with lots of bar seats and large tables for big groups. Upstairs there are smaller tables (fits 4 per table). They have over 30 selection of Californian craft beers with a large chalkboard menu atop the bar that does a pretty good job in describing each beer. Prices per beer were pretty decent at about $6-8. Food menu was small but tasty, their burgers and deep fried stuff were pretty solid. There's no waiter service so you have to order everything at the bar, but they are pretty fast about it.  They also have a good selection of salads and healthy eats as well. The place has a cozy feel to it, I came on a Tuesday night, so the crowd was predominately people coming off work. Overall, a great gastropub (a pub that specializes in serving high-quality food, yes I just learned this word) in the union square area!
author: Quyen T.
